* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and other tools for the maintenance of the farm.

loans.name: John Deere

texts.en:
John Deere is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. He has been in this business for 12 years, and he earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

He is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy spare parts and other equipment for his motorcycle transport business.

John Deere has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  He dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other equipment for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mutindi

texts.en: Mutindi appreciates for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es: Luz, con 59 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que, a los 15 años de edad se involucró en el campo de las confecciones, pues realizó cursos de capacitación y, cuando se casó, montó su propio taller en la casa arrendada en la que convive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, con el tiempo se especializó en modistería de alta costura y trabaja sola todos los días, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Su empuje, fortaleza y dedicación le han permitido ir fortaleciendo su negocio y ya es reconocida en el sector donde reside, por su trayectoria y por la excelente calidad en su trabajo. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una máquina recubridora, pues la que posee tiene muchos años y le falla constantemente; con la nueva máquina podrá agilizar su proceso de producción y  mejorará las condiciones de trabajo, pues no perderá tiempo, ni insumos y, podrá adquirir nuevos clientes, lo que para ella significará tener mejores ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Luz se entusiasma con la idea de saber que tiene una oportunidad más para llegar a cumplir el sueño de adquirir su casa propia y darle continuidad a su taller, pues esto le abrirá la posibilidad de disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida, en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz, age 59, is a hard-working woman.  When she was 15 she became involved in the field of making clothes.  She took some training courses, and when she got married she set up her own shop.  She set it up in the rented house that she lives in with her husband and their two children.

In time, she specialized in high fashion dressmaking.  She works alone every day.  This way she generates enough resources to help her husband with the responsibility of the household finances.  Her drive, strength, and dedication have allowed her to strengthen her business.  She is now well-known in the area where she lives because of her track record and the excellent quality of her work.

The reason she is requesting the loan is to buy an overlock sewing machine.  The one that she has is several years old, and it constantly breaks down.  With the new machine she will be able to streamline her production process, and her working conditions will improve.  She will not lose time or supplies, and she will be able to get new customers.  For her this will mean getting better income to contribute to the household finances.

Luz is excited about the idea of knowing that she has another opportunity to fulfill her dream of getting her own house and continuing with her workshop.  This will bring about the possibility of enjoying a better quality of life with her husband and their children.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is from Noravan village within the Syuniq region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, parents and sister.  Arman is a contractual serviceman in the military service and is the only breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is not enough to cover the needs of the family. With the help of his family members, Arman is engaged in breeding livestock of sheep, pigs, piglets, and hens, and in cultivation of wheat, potatoes, apples and walnuts.  He sells the agricultural products in the local market. 
To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Arman needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase wheat seeds, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, and to renovate his agricultural machinery. With the help of the loan, he will maintain and develop his agribusiness. Arman and his family members highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, and to renovate his agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past two years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. Mwanamkasi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Maria Blasina

texts.es: Maria, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive  en el municipio de Choloma,Cortes. Lleva aproximadamente 20 años de dedicarse a  a la compra y venta de mercadería en general como ser lociones, cremas, sandalias, artículos para el hogar,ropa  etc. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y mediante pedidos. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de de mas mercadería para el negocio como cremas,lociones,sandalias y articulos para el hogar, con el proposito de aumentar sus ventas y ganancias. La  meta es tener mayor clientela.
texts.en: Maria is 57 years old. She is a single mother and has a son. She lives in the city of Choloma, Cortes. She has been buying and selling general merchandise for about 20 years such as lotions, creams, sandals, household items, clothing, and more. She sells as a street vendor and through orders. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 lempiras and will invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as creams, lotions, sandals, and household articles with the plan of expanding sales and profits. Her goal is to have more customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as lotions, creams, sandals, and household articles to supply her business.

loans.name: Ramachandra

texts.en:
Ramachandra is a 27-year-old differently able man living with his parents in the small village of Balugaon, Odisha, India. He runs a small grocery shop in his village and earns 3,000 INR per month. In his village, there is no other grocery shop so all the villagers depend on his shop. There are many potential customers in Ramachandra village but in his shop, there are no more items available so sometimes villagers have to purchase grocery items from the nearby market. If Ramachandra can make available more items in his shop, then he can increase his customer base and he can earn 7,000 INR per month.

Ramachandra has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase a refrigerator, oil, biscuits, sugar, cold drinks, snack items etc. for his grocery shop. Ramachandra wants to give a better standard of life to his parents who depend on him and he wants to earn more money to open a big grocery shop in his village.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, oil, biscuits, sugar, cold drinks, snack items, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  help her husband to buy raw materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza was born in 1992.  She is a hardworking woman, and she is a good sewer.  She has been busy with her sewing business for more than 3 years. Aziza manages the business alone. Her working day begins at 6 o’clock in the morning, and she works hard until late into the night.  Every day, she sews two woman's dresses.  She is developing her business year by year. Aziza is married and has 2 children. Her children are little. She wants to develop business and maximize profit because she needs the money. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 Tajikistani Somoni to buy a new sewing machine, fabrics, treads, needles etc.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabrics, treads, and needles.

loans.name: Lina

texts.pt:
Lina é operária agrίcola tem 53 anos é viúva mãe de 6 filhos todos já maiores de idade vive na casa do serviço e sustenta 3 netos que vivem com ela.
Com o valor quer comprar cimento, pedra, areia para dar continuidade a sua obra que esta na fase da viga casa tipo 2.
Seus planos para o futuro sustentar os estudos dos seus netos, terminar a obra, mobilar a casa e fazer uma cozinha.
Diz que irá pagar pontualmente o credito e solicitar mais para concretizar o seu plano
texts.en:
Lina is a farm worker. She's 53 years old and a widow. She has six children, all of whom are adults. She lives in company housing and supports three grandchildren who live with her.
With this amount she wishes to purchase cement, rocks and sand in order to continue building her two-bedroom house, which is currently in its early stages.
Her plan for the future is to pay for her grandchildren's schooling, finish the construction work, furnish her house and build a kitchen.
She states that she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for more loans again so that she can accomplish her plan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks and sand.

loans.name: Fátima

texts.pt:
Fátima é doméstica tem 40 anos de idade,  casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 estão a estudar 1 já é maior e a trabalhar ele irá ajudar no reembolso do crédito, sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ele.
Com o valor irá comprar cimento, pedra, areia, ferro para fazer a garagem na sua casa para a viatura de seu esposo que étrabalhador da RSA e que também iré ajudar no crédito.
Para o futuro tem como plano ingressar numa escola de corte e costura uma vez que tem ja a máquina e irá deste modo reforçar a renda familiar.
 Diz que compromente se a pagar pontualmente as prestações e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para realizar mais planos.
texts.en:
Fátima is a housekeeper. She's 40 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school and one is already an adult. Her adult son is in the workforce and he's going to help repay the loan. She supports a nephew who lives with her.
With this amount she'll purchase cement, rocks, sand and iron so that she can build a garage in her house for her husband's car. Her husband works in South Africa and he'll also help with the loan.
Her plan for the future is to enroll in a dressmaking school, since she already has the sewing machine and that way she'll increase her family's income.
She states that she pledges to make the repayments in a timely fashion and apply for more loans again so she can achieve other plans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks, sand and iron.

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
Hamest is an experienced farmer from Sipanik village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and son; they work in a car maintenance service, and they are the main breadwinners of the family. Their salaries, however, are not enough to fully meet the family’s needs. 

To help her family members in earning a living, Hamest in engaged in cattle breeding, and in cultivation of grass. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family.

As the autumn is progressing, Hamest needs to make some investments in her agribusiness for it to function in a sustainable way. 

She needs a loan of USD 850 to purchase a calf and to buy some forage for cattle. 

As this is Hamest’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. 

Hamest and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and to buy some forage for cattle

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has a butchery business in Nairobi town. He is 27 years old and is single. He has been in this business for eight years, and he currently makes a monthly income of 15,000 Kes. 

He plans to use the loan to buy an additional stock of meat to sell. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock, as well as improve his living standards. This is his third loan term, and he paid his previous loans successfully. 

John hopes to open more butchery branches in his location to expand his businesses.

loans.use: To buy an additional stock of meat to sell.

loans.name: Elicenia

texts.es: Elicenia, con 52 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijas y madre cabeza de hogar desde que separó de su esposo. Es una mujer que ha sabido sobrepasar las adversidades y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha sacado adelante a su familia. Hace aproximadamente 15 años trabaja en el área de la confección a terceros, actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de un familiar, cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada directa y otra persona que le colabora por días, trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 9:00 pm desde la comodidad de su hogar, con la ventaja de que no paga arriendo por lo que genera mejores utilidades al prestar su servicio. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para terminar de pagar  el saldo que debe de las dos últimas máquinas de confección que adquirió,  con lo que podrá estar más tranquila y continuar trabajando para culminar todos los proyectos que tiene pendientes, lo que le permitirá tener mejores ingresos para seguir velando por el bienestar de su familia. Elicenia desea seguir ampliando su negocio y generar más oportunidades de empleo a personas jóvenes y  mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como de las demás personas que influyen en esta ardua tarea.
texts.en:
Elicenia, 52 years old, is the mother of two girls and the head of her household since she and her husband separated. She is a woman who knows how to overcome adversity: with a lot of hard work and dedication, she has been able to get her family ahead.  About 15 years ago, she started working in on-contract sewing, work which she learned from a family member.  She has the help of one employee and another person who works with her on a day by day basis. She works every day from 7:00 am until 9:00 pm from the comfort of her home. Not paying rent for a shop helps her get more out of what she charges for her services.

The loan she is currently requesting will help her finish paying off the balance on the last two sewing machines that she bought. This will help her feel more at ease and enable her to keep working to finish her pending projects. These will bring in the income she needs to continue providing for her family. Elicenia wants to expand her business and provide more employment opportunities for young people. She hopes to improve not only her own family's quality of life, but also that of the other people that she touches in this difficult line of work.

loans.use: pay the remaining balance on two recent sewing machines

loans.name: Riffat Parveen

texts.en:
Riffat, a 37-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, one daughter and two sons. All the children are studying, and her husband is a barber. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Riffat is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Riffat has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses, and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. 

She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sewing supplies at wholesale

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store.  Her business has been running for three years and it continues to grow.  The income from her previous loan helped cover her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her partner work hard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better.  More items to sell will result in more profit.  The profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Perla hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and is 38 years old. She runs a retail shop and has been in this business for four years. Right now her monthly income is 7,000 KES. Together she and her spouse  have been blessed with two children. She supports five people in her family.

She plans to use this loan to purchase more items for selling in her shop. These include sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil. She will use the anticipated profits to open another retail shop. This is her fourth loan term and she repaid all her previous loans successfully. 

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods for selling.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is 46 years old, and she lives in the city of Vanadzor, which is in the Lori region. Armenuhi graduated from the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute's Department of Physics and Mathematics. She is married and has a daughter and a son. 

Armenuhi works at the local school as a teacher of information technologies, and her husband works at the same school as an accountant. She is a very respected and beloved teacher among both the teaching staff and the pupils. She also gives private paid courses in information technologies, and she manages to make these courses very interesting and interactive.  

She is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer, which she needs greatly, and also some necessary literature for her private courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some necessary literature for her private courses

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce appreciates her previous loan that she used to educate her children thus continuing their learning without any interference.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase more items such as sugar, sweets, biscuits, and rice to sell.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sugar, sweets, biscuits, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 39-year-old woman from Iraq. She is married and has a child. 

Amira works to assist her husband to provide the family living. She tailors various types of women's outfits. She has been practicing tailoring as a business since 2011, and has gained much experience in this field.  Amira is well-known in the neighborhood, and has an excellent reputation, thanks to her affordable prices.

Amira is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD, which she will use to buy two new sewing machines. 

Amira is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she may continue educating her child and provide her family with a good income.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is 38 ears old and married, the mother of two children. She belongs to a small and happy family because she did not have more children for extraordinary expenses, and her husband earns sufficient income as well. 

Her husband owns a small general store.  Its turnover is sufficient to cover the expenses of a single family. Her husband wants to grow his business, and for this purpose he wants to expand his shop and inventories as well.

Therefore, Ghazala has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can grow his general store. With the help of this loan. her husband will buy flour, soap, detergent, etc., to sell. 

Ghazala says thanks to Kiva, its field partner BRAC Pakistan, and the honorable lenders for their warmth participation in supporting needy people.

loans.use: to buy packs of rice, sugar, flour, grain, biscuits, soap, and beverages for her husband's store

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 31 years old. He has a taxi and has been in this business for nine years. He makes a monthly income of 30,000 Kes. He is married and together with his spouse they have one child aged 2 years old. His wife, who runs a boutique business, provides additional income for the family. 

He plans to use the loan to purchase new clothes for his wife’s boutique business. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more clothes to sell in the boutique. This is his third loan term and he paid all his previous loans successfully. 

In the future Michael hopes to be successful in life and also to purchase another vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for his wife's business.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 39 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 6 children. She does farming in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops such as maize, vegetables, bananas and cassava. She also keeps cattle. She has been in the farming business for 10 years and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan term and she plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs. These include fertilizer and seeds for planting. She will also buy feeds for her cattle. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her farming business by buying more farming materials.

In the future, Priscilla hopes to venture into dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gregorio, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often at a single price for all of the items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting her supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Helen dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, who is 59 years old and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married, with children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating her business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Rebecca maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products.
 
Rebecca dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is from Iraq. He is 38 years old and married, the father of three children. Hadi is the sole provider of the family.

Hadi is a grocer and owns a small grocery store in his neighborhood, where he sells various products like dairy, juices, canned food, and detergents. He established his business in 2000, and now he has an employee. Hadi has an excellent reputation in his society and is loved and respected by his neighbors.

Hadi is requesting a loan of USD 3,000. He will use this loan to buy a motor generator and to increase his inventories. 

Hadi is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and increase his  inventories

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell vegetables. Mary Ann is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fancy rice, sugar, oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients including fancy rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Lamyae

texts.en:
Lamyae is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children. Lamyae and her husband provide the family income together.

Lamyae is a tailor, and she works from her house. She specializes in tailoring various types of women's outfits. Lamyae established her business in 2011 and has gained much experience in this field. She is well-known in the neighborhood and has an excellent reputation.

Lamyae is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. She will use this loan to buy a new sewing machine and to paint the walls of her workplace. Lamyae is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she can provide more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and to paint the walls of her workplace

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a businesswoman who is very hardworking and enterprising. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Margaret practices crop farming, and she has been in this business for the past 2 years. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the requested loan of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase a water tank and pipes for irrigation. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is from Iraq. He is 60 years old, married, and has no children. 

Taleb owns a garage, where he sells and repairs vehicle engines and filters. He has been in this business since 1998 and has mastered his trade. Taleb has 3 hired employees and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Taleb is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD. He will use this loan to install an external ceiling and to increase his inventories. Taleb is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can continue providing for his family's needs and to offer them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and to increase his inventories

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en:
Shamigul is from Tajikistan.  It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful. Shamigul loves her country very much.

Shamigul is 36 years old and married, with five children. To make a living, she sells food items in the shop. 

She has been engaged in her business for one year and earns a little money for these activities. She works day by day in the shop. She works around 10 hours a day. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind, and she always loves what she does.

She is requesting a loan of TJS 5,000, which will be used to buy more food items to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been running a tailoring business in Kangundo town for five years now. She is 36 years old, married, and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children. Her spouse is a farmer, who also provides income.

She will use this loan to buy textile materials for making clothes. She anticipates making more profits that she will use to buy another sewing machine as well as repay the loan. 

Having paid her previous loans successfully, this will be her third loan term. In future, she hopes to be financially stable and to educate her children to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy textiles for making clothes.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is a famer from Sisian city of the Syuniq region of Armenia.  She lives with her elderly pensioner mother, and two school-age sons (10 and 6 years old). To take care of her family, Siranush is engaged in agriculture and in the cultivation of apples and walnuts.  She is the breadwinner of the family and works hard to be able to make ends meet.  She sells the agricultural products in the local market.  
As the family's needs are growing day by day, Siranush wants to expand her agribusiness to be able to effectively cover her family's needs. A loan of $1,500 will be a great help to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase four calves. As this is Siranush’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.  Siranush and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase four calves and expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma has a retail shop that she has been running for 12 years now. She is 35 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 3 children. Her spouse is a farmer provides additional income for the family.

Emma will use this loan to increase her stock of retail goods such as rice, sugar and flour to sell.  After repaying the loan, she will save any remaining  profits.

This is her first loan term and she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to add to her stock of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. 

Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and make enough to meet their household expenses. Currently, Sughran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy stock of rice, flour, and grains to meet the increasing demand of customers. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

She thanks Kiva, its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and honorable lenders.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, flour and grains to meet the increasing demand of customers.

loans.name: Mamoni

texts.en:
Mamoni, 25, is a hardworking lady from the small town of Mayanaguri in Jaipaiguri Dist. She lives with her husband and two children. One of the children goes to school and the other one is too small to go to school. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not sufficient to bear all the expenses of the family.

So Mamoni decided to start a business to help her husband to maintain a good livelihood and to give financial support to her family. They have land just two miles away from her home where the land and weather is very favorable for tea cultivation. She also has knowledge of farming. So, Mamoni decided to cultivate tea on that land. There is a great demand for tea in that area. She wants to take a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, with the profit from her business, she dreams of buying a cow so she can sell milk products in the market to earn more money. She accepts all the hazards of life that came to her pathway and she tries to solve all those with an exceptional inner strength.  She is the shining example of India.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo.

Malak is a 19-year-old married woman from Jabalia. She lives with her husband and one young daughter in a small house. Malak's husband owns a small grocery store,  which he opened recently. It is a good business and earns a good income, but still needs a lot of development. 

Malak took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more products for his grocery store and also a refrigerator. This will help them to improve the grocery and also their income.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy more products for his grocery store and also a refrigerator.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her gift shop. Ten years in the business, she has experienced a lot of ups and downs, but her business remains stable and continues to grow. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her child. Her income from the business supports the family's everyday household expenses.

Celia would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 20,000 PHP, to buy different products, such as toys and gift items, to sell in her gift shop. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits the from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Celia still hopes that her business will soar and dreams to give her family a beautiful future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different products, such as toys and gift items, to sell in her gift shop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick supplies retail goods to several retail shops in Kangundo town. He is 52 years old, married, and together with his spouse, he has been blessed with four children. He has been in this business for 16 years now. 

He will use this loan to buy more goods for supply. These include plastic cups and plates, which he will supply to retail shops. He will also buy lotions and hair weaves, which he will supply to beauty salons. He will use the generated profits to repay the loan and also buy more goods.

This is his fourth loan term and he repaid his previous loans successfully. In future, he hopes to be financially stable and educate his children to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more goods to supply to retail shops.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, which has been running for
 twenty years. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income on the other hand, supported her family's everyday expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rhodora hopes to have more loyal customers and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her farming business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 KES to buy a small water tank for irrigation. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a small water tank for irrigation.

loans.name: Lilik

texts.en:
Lilik is from Agarak city of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and son. She works in the government sector, and her husband works in a private copper-molybdenum factory. Both of them pit their efforts together to be able to earn a living. Their salaries alone, however, are not enough to cover the family's daily expenses. 

Apart from her main job, Lilik, with the help of her family members, is engaged in beekeeping and in cultivation of several fruits (peach, cherry, quince, pomogranate, fig, grapes, apple, and walnut). They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of family's income. 

To make her beekeeping business sustainable and more productive, Lilik needs to make some financial investments. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase several new beehives and buy wax for beekeeping. 

As this is Lilik’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they had no credit history. 

Lilik and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new beehives and buy wax  for beekeeping

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is a hardworking woman who is striving hard to better her family's life. The previous loan helped her to buy goats and sell them to her clients. In addition, she sells motorbike tubes, bicycle spare parts and rings to supplement her income. Here again she comes to you, asking for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy motorbike tubes, bicycle spare parts and rings to sell. She appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to buy motorbike tubes, bicycle spare parts and rings to sell.

loans.name: Alik

texts.en:
Alik is a young farmer from the Petrovka village of Lori region. He lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter and son. Alik's wife works in the village local self-governance body. 

To take care of his family Alik is extensively engaged in agribusiness: in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding livestock of sheep, pigs and piglets, and in cultivation of wheat, barley, potatoes, and grass. He realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of family's income. Alik and his wife work hard to be able to earn a living. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a more sustained way, Alik needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase two cows, two steers, and some forage (barley) for the livestock. The expanded agribusiness will function in a more productive way. 

Alik and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows, two steers, and some forage (barley) for the livestock

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita, age 43, and her husband Sachin, age 54, are living in the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri with their three children. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband has completed his studies until Madhyamik (grade 10). Two of their three children are going to school for their higher education and the other has completed his education and is working in a gold shop. Her husband is running his blacksmith business but due to lack of money, they couldn’t take out as much profit as they want to run their family. So she decided to take a loan and help her husband in his business so that in the future, her family won't suffer for anything. This business is profitable for them because farmers use different types of agriculture equipment for cultivation and that area is agricultural-based. Her husband makes these items in his shop.

Her dream is to develop this trade on a large scale so that they can have as much profit as they can, and with that, they can fulfill all their dreams .Though she is not educated, she can understand the business' value and can help her husband as much as she can. Both of them are thankful to BJS and KIVA for this loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like coal for their blacksmith business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer in Makueni town, where she grows fruits, maize and vegetables for selling. She has been in the farming business for ten years and it has been profitable. She is 36 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with six children. Her spouse also provides additional income.

Alice plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer for use on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. This will be her second loan term, having paid her previous loan successfully. 

In the future, Alice hopes to have a sustainable business and be able to provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Kholod

texts.en:
Kholod is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Kholod is a 22-year-old married woman from Jabalia. She lives with her husband and two young children, a boy and a girl, in a small house. Kholod's husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a very low wage that is not enough for the family's needs. Kholod and her husband would like to improve their home and buy all the necessary items to do so.

Kholod took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar water heating system for the family home. This will help them to reduce their use of electricity and use a clean power source that will not affect nature.

loans.use: to buy a solar water heating system for the family home

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is 40 years old. He lives in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. Harutyun has a very nice large family; three puckish sons.

It is already five years that he has perfectly runs his own business.  In a rented garage he gives repairs cars.  He already has had a successful deal with Nor Horizon and Kiva.  With the loan amount that he asked, he bought a car, which he still uses to import necessary tools and spare parts for his business. 

Now Harutyun has some new plans.  He has managed to buy a half-built building, and he wants to make it a kind of car service center for his business.
He asks a loan of AMD 700,000 in order to build a roof on his workshop as soon as possible, since winter cold months are too near, and very soon constructional work will be impossible.

loans.use: To build a roof on his workshop before winter

loans.name: Sante

texts.en:
Sante is a 45-year-old married woman. Her husband Suren is 52 years old and they have three children. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri (Pet Kathi Neech Colony). Though they both are illiterate, they can sign their name. They both are running their tea cultivation business. Due to insufficient money, they can’t grow their business to a high capacity. For that reason, they need a loan so that they can buy more seeds for tea cultivation and make a good profit from this business. They live in a Kachha house (a house made of mud and straw). This business is profitable for them because they have been in this business for the last few years. They want to make themselves financially developed from this business.

In the future, they want to buy a milch cow (a cow used specifically for milk) from the profit of this business to sell milk products at the market, and give their children a higher education.  She is very grateful to BJS and KIVA for funding her loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds to cultivate tea

loans.name: Trinidad  Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Trinidad, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace 6 años  que tiene un negocio  de una pulpería donde vende refrescos, churros, carnes, verduras, lácteos, embutidos, pan,dulces,azucar, arroz,etc. Ha invertido varios prestamos para mantener surtida su pulpería.  El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para la compra de más productos de la canasta básica y así podrá tener su negocio más surtido comprara azucar,arroz,manteca,carnes,lacteos,churros,refrescos y otros,para obtener mejores ganancias ya que tendrá  más variedad de productos. Su meta es  ayudar con los gastos del hogar y obtener ganancias.
texts.en: Doña Trinidad is 66 years old, married, has four children and lives in San Pedro Sula municipality. She has had a convenience store business for 6 years where she sells refreshments, snacks, meat, vegetables, dairy products, canned goods, bread, candy, sugar, rice, etc.  She has used several loans to keep her store stocked. The loan she currently seeks is for 10,000 Lempiras and she is going to use it to buy more basic grocery products and in this way be able to have her business better stocked. She will buy rice, sugar, butter, meat, dairy products, snacks, soda pop, and other items in order to obtain greater earnings as she will have a larger variety of products. Her goal is to help with her household expenses and generate income.

loans.use: to buy meat, dairy products, soda pop, snacks, sugar, rice, butter, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 57-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village of the Marneuli district. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and a calf. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown. Zuran is very hard-working man and always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. 

Zurab decided to start a family business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get GEL 1,500 for purchasing a mill.  Maize is popular in his region, and he will get orders to grind it and thus will generate income. 

The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to buy a mill for grinding maize

loans.name: Yeison Arley

texts.es: Yeison actualmente vive con su madre y un sobrino que fue abandonado por su madre, por los que debe generar ingresos para llevar el sustento diario, pues toda la carga económica del hogar recae sobre él. Por ello, desde hace 4 años tiene su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició, aún sin tener conocimientos en este campo de acción, sin embargo por el método de prueba/error ha logrado aprender y ahora es reconocido en el sector. El cliente es consciente de que trabaja en un área muy competida y sabe que el valor agregado que puede ofrecer a sus clientes, es tener su tienda muy bien surtida para satisfacer las necesidades y requerimientos de sus compradores; por ello se motiva para solicitar el crédito, pues con el dinero comprará surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, granos, galletería, pastas, entre otros), así tendrá bien abastecido su inventario para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de fin de año, generando así mejores utilidades y logrando hacer de su negocio, una actividad rentable. Yeison desea seguir adelante, fortaleciendo aún más su establecimiento y hacerlo crecer, para percibir mejores ingresos que le den una estabilidad económica favorable para sacar adelante a su familia, especialmente a su sobrino, quien lo motiva a seguir luchando arduamente para poder disfrutar más delante de un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida junto a las personas que ama.
texts.en: Today Yeison lives with his mother and a nephew who was abandoned by his mother. It is for them that he needs to generate income to support them daily, as the household depends on him for economic support. Therefore, for 4 years he has had his own business, a grocery store that he opened, even though he didn't have any experience running a store. Nonetheless with trial and error he has learned and now he is well-known in the area. He is conscientious that he works in a competitive area and he knows that the value he can offer his customers is to have a well-stocked store in order to meet their needs and requirements. Therefore he seeks a loan to buy stock at wholesale (pastries, soda pop, grains, cookies, pasta, and other items), and in this way he will be well-stocked to meet the demand that typically increases with the end of the year season. This will be very useful and help him with his business, which is very profitable. Yeison wishes to be successful, strengthening his business and making it grow, in order to have greater income which will give him economic stability in order to help his family get ahead, especially his nephew, who motivates him to continue fighting in order to be able to enjoy well being and a quality of life with people that love him.

loans.use: to buy store stock at wholesale (pastries, soda pop, grains, cookies, pasta, and other items).

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a homemaker and her husband is a rickshaw driver. Though their education is not very high, they can sign their name. They have three children, two of whom are studying and one is working as a mason. Her husband has taken credit from the market for her family's use, which Basanti didn’t like. Her husband is a rickshaw driver but due to insufficient earnings, he is unable to clear all the credit that he has taken from the market. The credit was necessary to feed his family. So, to clear her husband’s credit, she made the decision to take a loan to purchase a cow, sell its milk and earn a profit with it. 

She is a hardworking woman who wants to help her husband in any condition. Now they are living in a Kachha house (a house made of mud and straw). After earning a good profit from this business, she would like to build a Pakka house (concrete house) for her family and would love to give a higher education to both her children so that they can live happily throughout their life. She is very grateful to BJS and KIVA for this loan, as she was very much in need of it.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 30 years old and a housewife. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband owns a restaurant, the only source of income for their family. 

Shakeela has requested a loan from KIVA's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase food items like flour, rice, pulses [grain legumes], vegetables, etc.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and will bring a positive change to their monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase food items like flour, rice, pulses, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Al-Slwan Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Slwan. The group consists of four ladies who live together in Sana'a, Yemen. The group took a loan of 230,000 YER. Safa is 30 years old. She is a married woman and has two children. She has been working in the embroidery business for five years. She started her business as a hobby at her home where she embroidered at her leisure. She strives as much as possible to expand her business so that she can improve the living conditions of her family. She has a small house and she would like to renew it. So, she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy building materials to use for renewing her house. She hopes to live a good life with her family..

loans.use: to buy building materials to use for renewing her house.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira wants to repair the stable of her animals. 

Zamira is a young mother of two children, five and three years old, and together with her husband they have been in the livestock industry for almost five years. They live in the northern part of the country where the cold has already started, and their animals will be sleeping and staying in the cold soon should they not repair the stable. As you can tell from the photograph, they also raise chickens, ducks and other poultry. 

“If you don’t do livestock in the village, what else can you do? Almost everyone does this kind of activity whether for money or just to secure the food for the family. In our region, we consume a considerable amount of dairy. Every meal is about dairy. A bit of cheese and bread along with a salad and/or fruit is a favorite meal for villagers,” Zamira said, smiling.

loans.use: to repair her stable.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is 48 years old. She is a higher-educated woman who lives in the south of Tajikistan, in a rural region. She has been a secondary school teacher for more than 28 years. She is a good teacher. She has a lot of students. Her students work in different spheres of society. She is also a careful mother of three children. She is married. Her partner has a small income. Her child wants to get married but she does not have enough money to make her marriage party. She is asking for a loan because she needs money. She is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to make her child's wedding party. She awaits your support. She is kind and responsible.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding party.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco, un campesino y agricultor antioqueño, salió de su pueblo natal siendo una víctima más del desplazamiento forzado, debido a la violencia que se presentaba, se trasladó con su esposa y sus 6 hijos hacia la ciudad, allí, sin tener experiencia en otra labor, comenzó a vender frutas y café de manera ambulante, por las calles del centro de la ciudad y, así pudo sacar adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Su empuje, fortaleza y la tenacidad con la que se esfuerza día a día le han permitido tener una nueva oportunidad para resurgir y luchar por el bienestar de los suyos. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en surtido al por mayor (mecato, confitería, café, gaseosas, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de fin de año, en la que se incrementan sus ventas. Esto le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y podrá continuar solventando las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Francisco sueña con tener la oportunidad de adquirir un local para vender sus productos y evitar los desafíos que se le presentan por las temporadas de lluvia, que afectan sus ventas, así podrá mejorar la rentabilidad y tener una mejor calidad de vida para disfrutar al lado de su familia una vejez más tranquila.
texts.en: Francisco, a farmer from Antioquia, left his birthplace as one more victim of forced displacement due to the violence that was present. He moved with his wife and 6 children to the city. There, without having any experience of any other work, he began selling fruit and coffee as a street vendor on the streets of the city's center, and in this way he was able to help his family get ahead with great effort and dedication. His drive, strength, and tenacity strengthened him day after day and permitted him to have a new opportunity to survive and fight for his family's well-being. He seeks a loan to invest in stocking his items (pastries, cake, coffee, soda pop, and other items), and in this way meet the growing demand of the end of year season, which is when his sales increase. This will permit him to have greater income and be able to continue providing for his family's basic needs. Francisco dreams of having the opportunity to acquire a locale to sell his products and avoid the pitfalls present during the rainy season, which affects his sales. In this way he could increase his profits and have a better quality of life to enjoy with his family at his side and have a tranquil old age.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale (pastries, cakes, coffee, soda pop, and other items)

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a widowed woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. The rest are grown-ups. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She makes soft drinks using fruits and juice flavors and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase juice flavors and fruits for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase juice flavors and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of Esther's Group from Dansoman in Accra, Ghana. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of GHS 3,400 for the members of the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Esther, aged 32, is the featured leader of this group. She is married to a businessman, and they have two children. Esther has been a businesswoman for twelve years now; she sells wigs and creams. 

With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy wigs and creams to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sadaf Group

texts.en:
Sadaf is a 25-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and two daughters in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Since 2003, her husband has had an electrical store. He works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Sadaf is a member of two-person lending group, and she has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the loan money, her husband can buy a more equipment for his store, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Sadaf and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To pay for electrical equipment.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Ofelia, a sus 68 años de edad, se dedica a elaborar sombreros alusivos a la temporada navideña, fabricados en espuma, trabaja sola y no tiene horario de trabajo, pues su labor solo es realizada en la temporada de navidad. Comenzó a realizar la actividad de manera empírica y de esta forma ha generado los ingresos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Su creatividad y perseverancia la motivan para solicitar el crédito, con el dinero desea comprar insumos al por mayor (espuma, pintura), de esta forma podrá ampliar su producción y tendrá la oportunidad de vender más artículos, lo que le generará mejores ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ofelia sueña con poder hacer que sus productos no sólo sean elaborados en temporada, sino que se fabriquen todo el año y que sean objetivos divertidos para las niñas; de esta manera podría disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y pasar una vejez mucho más tranquila al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Ofelia, at 68 years of age, is dedicated to making foam hats for the Christmas season. She works alone and has no fixed work hours. Her labor is done exclusively in the Christmas season. Ofelia began this activity in an empirical manner, and with this, she has generated sufficient income to pay for the basic necessities of her home.

Her creativity and perseverance have motivated her to solicit a loan. With this money she wishes to purchase supplies at wholesale (foam and paint). In this manner, she will be able to expand production and have the opportunity to sell more articles. This will generate better income to cover the sustenance of her home.

Ofelia dreams of being able to make her products not only in season, but also, to manufacture hats year round. She wants them to become entertaining objects for girls. In this manner, she could enjoy a better quality of life and spend her old age with much more tranquility alongside her husband.

loans.use: buy hat making supplies at wholesale (foam, paint).

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a 44-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband, who works as a farmer, and four children attending school. In 1997, she started to work independently at her house as a women's hairdresser and beautician.

She helps her husband with the expenses to be able to satisfy the family needs. She is very talented at her job and always makes her clients happy thanks to her expertise.

Today, Leila is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase hairdressing tools and beauty products. She aims to reinforce her business operation by expanding her work and targeting wider clientele in order to amplify her income. She is very optimistic and willing to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and beauty products

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 27 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city which is in Lori region. Armen is married; he lives with his mother and his wife. He graduated from Armenian Republic State Military Academy and now he works in that sphere. He  has the rank of captain. Very often, working in his specialty, Armen visits frontier military units, but unfortunately he has no a car of his own. 

He is asking for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams which, together with his savings, will be enough to buy a car. Having his own car will make his visits faster and he will have more time to spend with his family.

loans.use: to buy a new car to make his visits faster

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en: Jemal is a 47-year-old married man. He lives with his son and wife in Batumi region, at the seaside in Georgia. The family has seasonal income. In particular, they have a water scooter, which is rented out to tourists. As the income is only seasonal, Jemal decided to start a family business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, has enabled him to get a loan of $3000 for purchasing a truck. When the truck is purchased, he will get orders to transport cargo and generate income. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Sanira-Begim

texts.en:
Sanira-Begim is a first-year student of AUCA, in the department of Business Administration. Here is her story:

“I had several reasons to apply to AUCA, department of BA. I am very interested in this field of study because of my experience as an exchange student in the United States. Comparing two different countries like the USA and Kyrgyzstan, one that is developed and another developing, has really opened my eyes. I would like to run my own business, which is a swimming pool with hot tubs that is open throughout the year, and that is affordable to everyone. This is how people can care about their health. So, studying at AUCA is a great opportunity for me to realize all of my plans for the future, to put Kyrgyzstan is a global dimension so that more and more international companies are interested in investing in my country. AUCA is going to open the doors to the whole world for me and I am very excited to study here. AUCA gives lots of opportunities to all its students, and even gives financial assistant to all of them. Therefore, I would like to take this opportunity and apply for Kiva loan. I hope I will be awarded a loan, so that I could be able to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate  is a single mother of four children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members and has been in this business for 12 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Cate is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also building her own house.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Annam

texts.en:
Annam is 26 years old and a hard-working woman. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband. She belongs to a lower class family. Her husband is a painter by trade, which is the only source of income for their family. He owns a small painting shop in the market. 

He is interested to purchase more products for his shop so that he can increase his net income and savings as well. Therefore Annam has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase brushes, paint and canvas, etc., as a result of which he can increase his sales and monthly income as well as savings. She is very thankful to KIVA for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase brushes, paint and canvas, etc

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila is 35 years old and her husband is 40 years old. Both of them earn by cultivating different crops in the field. Sushila has received an education up to class VIII (grade 8) and her husband has received an education up to class X (grade 10). They have two children, both of whom are receiving a primary education.
 
From the very beginning, Sushila has many problems running her family. Due to a lack of capital, it was not possible for them to buy different seeds for cultivation. For this reason, they have taken the loan so that they can buy potato seeds for cultivation. Both of them dream of giving a bright future to their children so that their children can become established in their life & look after Sushila and her husband when they become old. They hope that the loan that they have taken will help them in their future and that they will have high profits.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for potato cultivation

loans.name: Raelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Raelina Del Carmen es un joven estudiante de Medicina, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar todos sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Raelina, tengo 21 años y vivo en La Vega, Rep. Dom. Donde nací y me he criado junto a mis padres y mis hermanos. Mi papá  trabaja en transporte de arroz y  mi mamá es ama de casa, soy soltera y no tengo hijos.
Actualmente estudio Medicina en la UCATECI, elegí esta carrera porque me apasiona y es mi vocación, tengo siete cuatrimestres cursados en los que he tomado 46 materias, la que más me han gustado son anatomía y fisiología porque pude conocer el funcionamiento del cuerpo humano.
Estoy optando por el préstamo KIVA-FUNDAPEC ya que mis padres son de escasos recursos y no pueden pagarme la carrera, si no me aprueban este préstamo tendré que dejar la carrera ya que no puedo costearla y mis padres tampoco podrían ya que lo que ganan no es suficiente para los gastos de la casa y de mis estudios, esto cambiaria de manera drástica mi vida porque no podré lograr mi sueño de ser Doctora.
Mi meta es graduarme con un alto índice; estar al servicio de todo aquel que lo necesite; poder servirle a mi país y a mi comunidad.
texts.en:
Raelina Del Carmen is a young Medical student. She is requesting a loan to pay all her medical expenses.

This is my story: My name is Raelina. I am 21 years old and live in La Vega,  the Dominican Republic. I was born and raised here together with my parents and siblings. My father works transporting rice and my mother is a housewife. I am single and have no children. 

I am currently studying Medicine at UCATECI. I choose this career as it is my passion and my vocation. I have spent seven quarters studying 46 courses. The ones I like the most are anatomy and physiology as I could learn the functions of the human body. 

I have decided to request a KIVA-FUNDAPEC loan as my parents are of modest income and cannot pay my education. If I am not approved for this loan I will have to abandon my studies as I can't fund them. Nor can my parents as what they earn is not sufficient for the household expenses and my education. This would alter my life radically as I wouldn't fulfill my dream of becoming a doctor.

My goal is to graduate with high marks and to serve all those who need it, to serve my country and my community.

loans.use: to pay tuition, transportation and books for her Medical studies.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en: Shyamali is 31 years old and her husband is 36 years old. Shyamali has a class VI pass (grade 6) education and her husband has a class VII pass (grade 8). Shyamali is the mother of two children, both of whom are receiving an education. Shyamali is a housewife while her husband manufactures tin boxes. For preparing these high quality tin boxes, good quality tin & a machine is required so the quality is good and the sales will be high. So Shyamali has applied for a loan from BJS so that they can purchase good quality tin as well as a machine for manufacturing tin boxes. These boxes can be used to hold household items such as clothes and utensils. They hope that this loan will help them and will increase their profits.

loans.use: To purchase tin and machinery to create boxes

loans.name: Rabia Shahzadi Group

texts.en: Rabia Shahzadi is a 29-year-old, hard working and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons, who are studying in third class. Her husband is a driver by profession and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. For four years, Rabia Shahzadi has been running a beauty salon. She wants to purchase more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Rabia Shahzadi is a member of a three-person lending group that has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. When she earns a profit, first she will repay the loan to Kiva and than she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows and she is very thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
Shoghik is an experienced agronomist from Qarakert village of the Armavir region.  She lives with her husband, her 20-year-old son, her 18-year-old and 13-year-old daughters, and her elderly and retired mother-in-law. Shoghik's husband is employed in the government sector; he works in the village local self-governance body. His salary is so low that he cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. To assist her husband in earning a living, Shoghik engages in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding a livestock of pigs and piglets, and cultivation of alfalfa, peaches, apricots, apples, and walnuts. Her son sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Shoghik currently wants to expand her agribusiness. She needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase the neighboring piece of land for horticulture. Shoghik and her family members rely on the good will of lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount for the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase the neighboring piece of land for horticulture.

loans.name: Sharmila

texts.en: Sharmila is 23 years old and her husband is 28 years old. Sharmila is the mother of one child. Sharmila is a housewife and her husband makes incense and sells it in the market. They have taken a loan from BJS so that they can enhance their business and earn more from the business. This business is a profitable business and does not involve much labor cost. Sharmila has applied for a loan of INR 10,000 so that they can purchase more raw materials & prepare more incense sticks to sell at the market for more profit. They are thankful & grateful to BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make incense

loans.name: La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
Magdalena es otro de los integrantes del grupo La Candelaria, ella tiene 54 años de edad, solo estudio la primaria y está casada con Teodoro que tiene un taller de vulcanizadora.  
Magdalena platica que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar para salir adelante durante  su vida a desarrollado diferentes actividades económicas como ventas de antojitos, pero desde hace 6 años entro a vender artículos para el hogar por catalogo y le gusto ya que la ganancia es buena, ella realiza sus ventas casa por casa sale con sus clientes y amigas de la comunidad ha levantar pedidos “siempre que salgo a vender voy muy alegre y con buenos pensamientos para a la hora de la venta animar y convencer a mis clientes de que mis productos son los mejores”.
Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a comprar variedad de trastes para surtir sus pedidos y continuar con sus ventas.
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere gane más clientes y aumente sus ganancias para iniciar un ahorro y esté preparada para los imprevistos.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Ramona repostería 
Norberto alquiler de transporte
Gerardo alquiler de transporte
Beatriz venta de refrescos
Teresa venta de antojitos 
Ninfa venta de refrescos 
Yadira reposteria

loans.use: to buy items for the home.

loans.name: Ilucion Group

texts.es:
Don Filiberto es otro de los integrantes del grupo Ilucion, él tiene la edad de 52 años y platica que durante su vida ha tenido distintos trabajos pero desde hace 8 años se inclino por la rama de los servicios, es taxista, el eligió esta actividad porque se gana el dinero a diario y no hay temporadas la gente siempre busca el servicio de los taxis. 

El inicia su jornada de trabajo desde muy temprano como no tiene un sitio, anda dando vueltas por todo el centro de Tierra Blanca  y las colonias buscando a sus clientes, en ocasiones también lo buscan para hacer viajes especiales a alguna de las comunidades u otras ciudades y es cuando gana un poco más. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es que todo el día está en contacto con la gente platica con ellas y escucha muchas historias de la vida de cada uno de sus clientes, el está muy contento con su pequeño negocio ya que le da la oportunidad de tener un empleo y día con día mejorar su calidad de vida.

Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a comprar piezas de refacción y dar mantenimiento a su taxi para continuar con su actividad. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo:

Eunice venta de zapatos
Maria teresa venta de cosméticos 
Claudia venta de frutas y legumbres 
Rosa venta de ropa 
Guadalupe panadería 
Rebeca venta de ropa 
Santa venta de bisutería 
Maria Lorenza perfumería 
Cristian Alberto venta de ropa 
Guillermina cria de  borrregos y gallinas 
Maria de Jesus venta de ropa
texts.en:
Filiberto is another of the illustrious members of the "Ilucion" communal bank. He is 52 years old and states that he has done a number of distinct jobs in his life. For the past 8 years he has opted for the taxi field. 

He is a taxi driver. He choose this as he can make money every day. People are always looking for taxi rides.
