He starts his day very early and as there is no taxi stand he drives around the center of Tierra Blanca and it's neighborhoods looking for passengers. Sometimes people also look for him to make special trips to another community or city. He makes more money doing this. What he likes most about his work is the daily contact with people talking to them and listening to the many stories from the lives of his many clients. He is quite pleased with his small business as he has the opportunity to work and day by day improve his quality of living.

The loan from VisionFund will help Filiberto buy replacement parts and maintain his taxi to continue his work. 

The other members of the group are:

Eunice; shoe sales
Maria Teresa; cosmetic sales
Claudia; selling fruit and vegetables
Rosa; selling clothes 
Guadalupe; runs a bakery 
Rebeca; sells clothing 
Santa; costume jewelery sales 
Maria Lorenza; perfume sales
Cristian Alberto; selling clothes
Guillermina; raising sheep and chickens
Maria de Jesus; clothing sales

loans.use: to buy parts and do maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 60 years old and married with six children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks, such as rice, soft drinks, sugar, etc. to sell.

Nenita has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Nenita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, such as rice, soft drinks, sugar, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Erkabi

texts.ru: Эркаби 53-летняя жительница Яванского района. Она мать двоих детей. Ее старшему сыну 23 года. Он живет и работает далеко от дома в чужой стране. Дочке 13 лет, она учится в школе. Эркаби с мужем около 13 лет работают на плодовом поле. Сезон их работы начинается ранней весной, они собирают зимний урожай, обрабатывают землю и сажают весенний урожай. В начале осени они собрали посаженный урожай и теперь активно готовятся к осеннему посеву. Эркаби просит кредит, чтобы закупить нужное количество минеральных удобрений, горючей смеси и семян. Такие продукты помогут ей скорее обработать землю и посадить урожай. Эркаби верит и надеется, что они получат богатый урожай и их труд не останется без награды.
texts.en: Erkabi is a 53 year old resident of the Yavan area.  She is the mother of two children.  Her older son is 23 years old.  He lives and works far from home in a foreign country.  Her daughter is 13 years old and studies in school.  Erkabi and here husband have been working on a field for about 13 years.  Their work season starts in early spring, they collect a winter harvest, work the land and plant the spring harvest.  In the beginning of autumn they collected the planted harvest and now are actively getting ready for the autumn planting.  Erkabi is asking for a loan, in order to purchase the necessary fertilizer, fuel, and seeds.  These products will help her to work the land faster and to plant the harvest.  Erkabi believes and hopes that they will collect a rich harvest and that their work will not be left without reward.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel and seeds

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is married with four children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires to own a wholesale business and also to get enough profits so as to build rental rooms. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen, a 33-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and two sons. Both sons are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Parveen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is at the age of 58 years, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children, and a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. Her husband owns a small shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income to the household expenses. He always tries to establish his business through offering the latest cosmetic products. Nowadays, the latest cosmetic products introduced in the market are very in demand and costly.

Suraiya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products, such as facial creams, hair dyer, makeover kits, lipsticks, nail polish, etc. She hopes that through this amount, her husband will enhance the businesses.
 
Suraiya is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetic products for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is the single mother of five children, none of them in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

She has a business selling charcoal, and she sells to all categories of people on a retail basis.  She works at the market six days out of every seven. She generates additional income through roasting maize. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This is Hussein, a 27-year-old Lebanese married man and the father of two school-aged children. He is the one in charge of paying the family’s everyday expenses. 

He works as a mechanic and owns a garage. His work consists of changing cars' oil and repairing wheels. 

And today, Hussein is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase an electrical generator for his business. 

In that way, he will be able to carry on with his work constantly without being forced to face electrical interruptions and therefore will be able to meet his client's demands, hence will earn superior income.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator for his business

loans.name: Zahra Shehzad

texts.en:
Zahra Shehzad, a 26-year-old hardworking woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and 2 sons who are studying. Her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family needs, so Zahra Shehzad is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Zahra Shehzad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо 21 год, она проживает в городе Исфара. Ее муж в данный момент находится на службе в армии. У них с Зебо имеется годовалый сын. Зебо сейчас намерена начать торговый бизнес, так как после ухода мужа в армию в их семье начались трудности с финансами. Она планирует заняться продажей женской одежды. Поскольку ее собственного сбережения не хватает, Зебо запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить ассортимент зимней женской одежды. Она будет закупать товар оптом с города Худжанд и продавать на местных рынках города Исфары. Ей будет помогать тетя мужа, у которой большой опыт в этой сфере. Чтобы начать свой новый бизнес, Зебо ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Zebo is 21 years old she lives in the city of Isfara.  Her husband is currently serving in the army. He and Zebo have a one year old son.  Zebo is determined to start a retail business, because after her husband joined the army their family started having financial difficulties.  She plans to sell women's clothing.  Because she does not have enough personal savings Zebo is asking for a loan in order to buy winter women's clothing.  She is planning to buy the products at wholesale from the city of Khujand and to resell them at the local markets in Isfara.  Her husband's aunt will help her, as she has a lot of experience in this area.  In order to start her business, Zebo waits for your support.

loans.use: to purchase winter women's clothing and to start sales

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells cereals in Kangundo town, and has been in this business for 10 years. She also sells grocery items, such as vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. She is 57 years old and a widow with 6 children.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of maize for selling. She also plans to buy cabbages, tomatoes, and potatoes for selling in her grocery business. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow. This is her third loan term, and she paid her previous loans successfully.

Mary's future hope is to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy stocks of maize, cabbages, tomatoes and potatoes for selling in her grocery business.

loans.name: Fernando Luigui

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre de 32 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Fernando no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional. 
Por iniciativa propia, Fernando se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra plátano y yuca, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y experiencia.
Fernando se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de abono, riego y cosecha de sus cultivos, de esta manera Fernando espera lograr una buena venta, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 32 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa. He is very hard working and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts on getting ahead.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, and because he had to work, Fernando was not able to finish his elementary education which made it impossible to study to become a professional.

By his own initiative, Fernando works as a farmer. He has a small plot of land where he grows plantains and yucca. Samuel works about ten hours a day, every day.

He believes things are going well for him thanks to his dedication and efforts.

Fernando is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help given he can cover the costs of fertilizer, irrigation and harvest of his crops.

This way, Fernando hopes to have a good sale cycle and he  will keep working and making an effort to reach his dream of increasing his crops.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance cost of his crops.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is a 49-year-old married man. He lives with his 40-year-old wife, Gulnazi, in Zestaponi district. Gulnazi works at the educational resource center, and gets 320 GEL per month. This is the only source of income for the family, and is not enough to cover everyday costs. 

Gela decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $900 to purchase hens. Gela will purchase hens at wholesale prices, and then resell them at a higher price to generate income. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase hens to resell.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора 23-летняя молодая девушка, проживающая в районе Дж.Руми. Она еще не замужем и живет с матерью и братом. Нигора сейчас решила начать собственное швейное дело. Она изучила эту профессию и теперь хочет применить свои способности на деле. Для реализации цели Нигора просит кредит, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Она планирует принимать заказы на шитьё женских национальных платьев. Услуги швеи очень востребованы в их районе. Почти все женщины и девушки предпочитают шить платья на заказ. Вот и Нигора намерена серьезна заняться этим прибыльным бизнесом и своим доходом помогать матери в обеспечении семьи.
texts.en: Nigora is a 23-year-old young woman living in the J. Rumy district. She is still unmarried, and lives with her mother and brother. Nigora has decided to start her own business. She studied this occupation, and now wants to put her skills to work. In order to reach her goal, Nigora is asking for a loan to purchase a sewing machine. She plans to take orders to sew traditional women's dresses. Seamstress services are in high demand in the district. Almost all women and girls prefer to order custom dresses. Nigora is ready to seriously dive into this profitable business, and to use her income to help her mother provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine in order to start a sewing business.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 27 años, está casada con Alejandro y tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella en su casa de madera.
Desde muy joven aprendió la vida laboral en el campo ya que tenía responsabilidad de mantener a sus pequeños hijos. Desde que se inició en esta labor recibe el firme apoyo de su esposo quien al igual que ella espera superarse económicamente a través de esta labor. Tiene conocimientos en las labores agrícolas tales como el mantenimiento y producción de cacao orgánico ya que es uno de los productos que su familia siempre cultivó por herencia.  Al ser muy proactiva ha logrado llevar una buena campaña productiva contratando a su vez trabajadores del lugar para las distintas tareas y usando abono orgánico para obtener una mejor calidad de las cosechas. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertir en sus terrenos con la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Mery is 27 years old and is married to Alejandro. They have three children who live with them in their wooden house. From a young age, she learned to work in farming because she had the responsibility of providing for her young children. Since she started working in this field, she has had the firm support of her husband who, like her, hopes to progress financially through his job. She knows about agricultural work, as well as about how to grow and produce organic cocoa because this is what her family has always done. By being proactive, she has managed to produce a good yield, hiring workers to carry out the different tasks and using organic manure to get a better quality harvest. This is her first loan from Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support which will help her to get ahead. She pledges to make timely repayments. She is requesting 1000 soles to invest in her land by buying organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and blessed with three children. They live in their own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a tailoring business, making women’s and gent's suits for sale at home. She cites stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing treads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing treads for her business

loans.name: Perseverancia Group

texts.es:
Perseverancia:
Cornelia tiene 40 años y tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación de dulces de leche. Ella es integrante de un grupo llamado Perseverantes, ellos decidieron dar este nombre al grupo porque piensan que el que persevera alcanza, con mucha paciencia y esfuerzo lograran que sus negocios prosperen. 
Cornelia es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, platica que durante 10 años se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de dulces de leche, ella comenta que desde muy pequeña su madre le enseño a realizarlos y salían a venderlos pero ahora que formo su propia familia decidió poner en práctica lo que su madre le enseño y ganar un poco de dinero extra para ayudar en los gastos de du hogar. 

Cornelia ya tiene sus clientes y dos veces por semana se pone a preparar sus dulces para al día siguiente salir a entregarlos a las tiendas  o puestos en el mercado que le hacen pedidos.  Con el préstamo que le gustaría comprar la leche, el azúcar, el coco, la vainilla, la mantequilla, para la preparación de sus dulces. 

A futuro le gustaría que su negocio continúe progresando y hacer más clientes, aumentar sus ganancias y hacer algunos arreglos a su casa.
Los demás integrantes de este grupo son:
Gregoria venta de abarrotes 
Reyna venta de tacos 
Maria de Lourdes repostería 
Nayeli repostería 
Maria Isabel venta de ropa 
Cornelia venta de dulces 
Marta venta de tortillas 
Rosa venta de abarrotes 
Jesica venta de antojitos
texts.en:
Perseverance:  Cornelia is 40 years old and has a small business making milk candies.  She is a member of a group called Perseverantes (determined). They decided to give their group this name because they believe that s/he who perseveres achieves; with a lot of patience and effort their businesses will prosper.  

Cornelia is a happy and enterprising woman. She relates that over the past 10 years she has worked at making and selling milk candies, and that since she was a little girl her mother taught her how to make them and they used to go out together to sell them. Now that she has her own family she decided to put into practice what her mother taught her and make a little extra money to help with the household expenses. Cornelia has her customers and twice each week she makes her candies and the next day she delivers them to the stores or market stalls that have ordered from her.

With the loan she would like to buy the milk, sugar, cocoa, vanilla, and butter needed to make her candies. She hopes that her business will continue to progress in the future and that she will have more customers, increase her earnings and make some improvements to her house.

The other member of this group are:
Gregoria - grocery sales
Reyna - taco sales
Maria de Lourdes - baked goods
Nayeli - baked goods
Maria Isabel - clothing sales
Cornelia - candy sales
Marta - tortilla sales
Rosa - grocery sales
Jesica - sale of traditional corn-based Mexican dishes

loans.use: to buy the milk, sugar, cocoa, vanilla and butter needed to make milk candies.

loans.name: Honestidad Group

texts.es:
Honestidad es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 7 personas, ellas decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo ya que la honestidad es un valor que todos comparten. Este Grupo está ubicado Tierra blanca que también es conocido como “la novia del sol” por sus fuertes calores de mas de entre 40 y 50 grados en los veranos. 
Teresa es uno de los integrantes de dicho grupo, ella tiene la edad de 53 años, es soltera y solo estudio la preparatoria, posteriormente aprendió el oficio de mecánico dental el cual lleva desempeñando 35 años, ella se dedica al diseño, elaboración y fabricación de placas, dientes, puentes y hacer impresiones dentales. 
Ella tiene su pequeño taller en un local que renta, al cual acuden las personas y odontólogos hacer sus pedidos o a buscarle para que acuda a sus consultorios hacer impresiones dentales. 
Teresa platica que es un negocio muy rentable ya que actualmente la gente está más preocupada por su estética dental e invierten en tener una mejor sonrisa. 
Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudara a comprar acrílico, metales y porcelana para continuar con su actividad. 
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y pueda cubrir la demanda de pedidos que le realizan y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Francisca servicio de albañilería 
Irma venta de quesos 
Ernesto servicio de herrería 
Joaquina venta de refrescos 
Josefina cuartos de renta 
Rosa venta de calzado
texts.en:
The group is named Honestidad (Honesty) and it is made up of seven people. They decided to name their group this as honesty is a quality they all share. 
This group is located in Tierra Blanca which is also known as " the bride of the sun" due to its hot summer climates of between 40-50 C (104-122 F).

Teresa is one of the members of the group. She is 53, single and only studied through high school. She trained to be a dental technician and has had this job for the past  35 years. 
She designs, develops and manufactures plates, teeth, dental bridges and makes dental impressions. 

She rents her small workshop where people and dentists come to place orders or to ask her to come to their office to make dental impressions.
 
Teresa says that her business is profitable since currently people are more worried about their dental aesthetics and they invest in having a better smile. 

A loan from Kiva and VisonFund will help her to buy acrylic, metals and porcelain to continue working. 

She hopes that with this investment, her business will prosper and she will be able to meet the demand in orders and improve her quality of life. 

The other members of the group are: 

Francisca: masonry service  
Irma: cheese sales 
Ernesto: blacksmith services 
Joaquina: soda sales  
Josefina: room rental 
Rosa: shoe sales

loans.use: to buy acrylic, metals and porcelain

loans.name: Nerses

texts.en:
Nerses is 28 years old. He lives in the village of Getahovit, which is in the Tavush region. He lives with his wife, daughter, new born son, and parents. His father runs their farming and takes care of their farm cattle (cows, calves and sheep). His mother is a teacher at a local school. His wife used to work as an accountant, but now she stays at home and takes care of their children. 

Nerses has his own business. He has a garage on a highway where he repairs car tires. As he says, it is a profitable business, and he plans to enlarge it. He asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy car tires for the winter season, since very soon they will be in great demand and he will have a good income.

loans.use: to buy car tires for the winter season.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Венеры - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Венера занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 1 год назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, а также имеет 0,70 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает перец, кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Venera is 45 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children.  She has a specialized secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business a year ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Venera's hard work, her farming business now comprises one dairy cow and one calf.  She also owns 0.7 hectare (1.72 acre) of land on which she grows peppers and corn annually.  She makes a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Venera has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some cows for breeding. 

She plans to re-invest some of her profits back into her business by purchasing additional livestock. She is also planning to save enough money to continue to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Adiba

texts.ru: Адиба жительница района Дж.Руми. Ей 36 лет. Ее муж торговец, он продает продукты питания на рынке. Дети учатся в школе. Адиба помогает мужу, в его отсутствии заменяет его. Сейчас Адиба хочет начать собственный бизнес. Ей интересна животноводческая деятельность. Она знает как ухаживать за животными. При дворе ее дома имеется хороший сарай для содержания скота. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить двух голов крупнорогатого скота и начать свой бизнес по откорму и продаже скота. Благодаря кредиту у нее будет свой источник дохода и она больше не будет зависимой.
texts.en: Adiba lives in the J. Rumy district. She is 36 years old. Her husband is a salesman who sells groceries at a market. Their children attend school. Adiba helps her husband: when he is gone she stands in for him. Now Adiba wants to begin her own business. Her interest is in animal husbandry. She knows how to raise animals. In the yard around her house there is a good barn to keep animals in. She is asking for a loan to buy two head of cattle and begin her own business feeding and selling the animals. Thanks to the loan she is going to have her own source of income and will be more independent.

loans.use: To buy two cattle to start her own business

loans.name: Janyl

texts.ru: Жаныл 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Жаныл - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жаныл занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жаныл, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, а также имеет 1,20 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль, перец и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаныл обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жаныл планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Janyl is 39 years old, married, and with her spouse is raising 5 children. Janyl has a high school education, and to earn her family's sole source of income she farms and raises animals. She started 19 years ago with the purchase of animals for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work, Janyl now owns three dairy cows and 1.20 hectares of arable land on which she grows beans, peppers, and clover each year. Her monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Janyl is asking the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy cows to expand her herd. She plans to use profit from use of the loan to invest in further growing her livestock herd. She also plans to save for her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married with eight school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids. 

She has been operating a Khanga (women wrap cloth) selling business; selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga (women wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: El Compromiso Group

texts.es:
El Compromiso es el nombre de un grupo que se ha integrado por 10 personas alegres y emprendedoras cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica: Saira venta de cosméticos, Darwin refaccionaria, Victoria venta de calzado,  Ana Gabriela venta de comida y calzado, Edith venta de comida y cosméticos, Teresa venta de antojitos, María Jazmín club de nutrición, Perla bisutería, Erika venta de calzado, Juana venta de cosméticos. Ellos le dieron este nombre a su grupo ya que tienen el compromiso de mejor la calidad de vida de sus familias y pagar a tiempo su préstamo.
Saira tiene la edad de 23 años, estudio la Universidad y está casada con José Israel, ella platica que tiene 4 años vendiendo cosméticos por catalogo, cuando ella inicio con esta actividad aun está estudiando la Universidad y le ayudaba a pagar sus estudios, por cuestiones personales tuvo que dejar de estudiar y pero continua con sus ventas ya que quiere ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de hogar, además de que le gustaría a futuro que construyera su propia casa.

Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a compra de esmaltes, sombras, delineadores, maquillajes, perfumes para continuar con sus ventas. 
“Gracias por la oportunidad que me dan a mí y mi grupo de recibir un crédito para impulsar nuestros pequeños negocio”.
texts.en:
El Compromiso ("The Commitment")  is the name of this group that is made up of ten cheerful and entrepreneurial people. Each one of them carries out a business activity: Saira, cosmetic sales; Darwin, repair shop; Victoria, shoe sales; Ana Gabriela, food and shoe sales; Edith, food and cosmetic sales; Teresa, the selling of traditional Mexican corn-based dishes; María Jazmín, nutrition club; Perla, general merchandise; Erika, shoe sales; and Juana, cosmetic sales. They gave their group this name since they have a commitment to improve their families' quality of life and repay their loan on time. Saira is twenty-three years old. She studied at a university and she's married to José. She says that she has been selling cosmetics by catalog for four years. When she began this business, she was still studying at the university and it helped to pay for her education. Due to personal matters, she had to leave the university, but she continues her cosmetic sales since she wants to help her husband with home expenses. In addition, she would like to build her own home in the future.

A loan from VisionFund will help her to buy nail polish, eye shadow, eyeliner, makeup, and perfumes to continue with her cosmetic sales. "Thank you for the opportunity that you're giving to me and my group to receive a loan to promote our small businesses."

loans.use: to buy nail polish, eye shadow, eyeliner, makeup, and perfume.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 38-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and seven children; some of them are attending school. Her husband works in the construction field, specializing in placing bricks. He is the main income source for the family. As for her, Rima helps him in supplementing his income with the income she earns from her grocery store, where she sells daily and dairy products. 

With the loan requested from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., Rima is willing to increase her store’s inventory by purchasing a large quantity of food provisions. In the future, Rima plans to expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of food provisions.

loans.name: Mairamgul

texts.ru: Майрамгул 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Майрамгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Майрамгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,30 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу, люцерну. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Майрамгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на строительство нового сарая-помещения для скота.
texts.en:
Mairamgul is 34 years old and married. She and her husband are raising four children. She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Mairamgul's hard work, her farming business now comprises five dairy cows.  She also owns 0.3 hectare (0.74 acre) of land on which she grows potatoes, corn and alfalfa.  She makes a monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Mairamgul has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some cows which she will fatten and then resell at a higher price at the market. 

She plans to re-invest her profits from this loan back into her business by purchasing additional livestock. She is also planning to save enough money to build a new barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батме 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Батмы - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Батма занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Батмы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 овцы, а также имеет 2,54 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает перец, фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Батма обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Батма планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на приданное для дочери.
texts.en: Batma is 45 years old, married, and has four children with her spouse. Batma has a high school education. To earn the sole source of income for her family Batma raises livestock. She began the business 23 years ago with the purchase of 5,000 som (KGS) of livestock. Thanks to her tireless work, Batma now owns two milk cows, two sheep, and 2.54 hectares of land which she grows peppers, beans, and clover on each year. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Batma is asking the Microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy bull calves to expand her herd. She plans to invest the income from use of the loan into further growing her herd, and she also plans to save for a dowry for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and two siblings. One of them is working. Youssef cooperates financially with his brother and father, to gather enough income to support the family’s needs.

Two years ago, Youssef got an idea of opening a car wash. Now, he receives cars there and cleans them out sparklingly. He always ends up with satisfactory results, and this is why customers remain loyal to him - because of his cleanliness. With the youth loan that he has requested from Kiva partner Vitas, s.a.l., he will renovate his car wash and equip it with new supplies. The renovations and supplies will enable him to continue his work with high professionalism.

loans.use: to renovate his car wash and equip it with new supplies

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa tiene 43 años, está casada con Enrique de 53 años y tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de material noble. Posee un terreno de cultivo de una hectárea y media que compró desde muy joven donde actualmente se dedica a mantener sus plantaciones en buen estado porque le permite obtener una buena calidad de los frutos en la cosecha y venderlos a buen precio en los centros de venta de su localidad
Se inicio por iniciativa de sus padres a quienes apoyaba desde niña en las distintas tareas agrícolas de este oficio. Usa solo abono orgánico para tener un crecimiento óptimo de sus plantaciones porque los terrenos de sus cultivos son muy fértiles. No obstante esto también favorece al crecimiento de maleza que debe retirar constantemente con la ayuda de trabajadores a quienes paga por adelantado. Cuando llega la cosecha contrata personal de apoyo para la recolección de los frutos maduros y secarlos al aire libre para posteriormente ponerlos en sacos adecuados y llevarlos a  los acopiadores del lugar en donde recibe un precio de acuerdo a la calidad.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Santa is 43 years old and she's married to Enrique who is 53 years old. Together they have 3 children who live with them in their house, which is made of noble materials. Santa owns a hectare and a half of farming land which she bought when she was very young. This is where she works to maintain her cultivated fields in good shape. This allows her to obtain a high quality product which she sells at a good price in her local markets. She started working as a farmer due to her parents initiative, they supported her since she was a child in the various agricultural tasks which are a part of this trade. 

Santa uses only organic fertilizer in order to obtain an optimal growth in her fields, which are very fertile. Nonetheless, this also encourages the growth of weeds which she must remove constantly with the help of workers who she pays ahead of time. When harvesting time comes around she hires support employees in order to pick up the ripe fruits and to air dry them. She then bags her fruits in the appropriate burlap bags and takes them to the area warehouse where she is paid according to the quality of her product.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels thankful for the financial support she receives in order to get ahead. She also commits to pay her dues punctually. She wants to take this opportunity to apply for 1,000 nuevos soles ($375) in order to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in the village of Geghamavan, which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is 47 years old. She is married and she has a son. Her husband does construction work. From time to time, he goes to the Russian Federation for work abroad; at this moment, he is working in Yerevan city. 

Susanna has no higher education, and for many years, she worked as a milkmaid at the village farm. Now she has established her own farm; in her farm she has two cows, two calves, a pig, seven sheep and 40 chickens. She also raises potatoes on her plot of land. She sells all her farm products at the city wholesale market. 

Susanna asks a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams in order to make a surprise for her husband and buy a car for him. He needs the car greatly, since very often he goes to different regions to do his work, and sometimes, he spends more money on roads than he earns for his family.

loans.use: to make a surprise for her husband and buy a car that he needs to travel to different regions for his work.

loans.name: Berwant

texts.en:
Berwant is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. Four years ago, he opened a garage where he repairs cars from the inside and outside. He is specialized in repairing multiple types of cars, and he is well talented. 

Currently, Berwant is eager to apply for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., as he will purchase car spare parts in a large quantity at a very attractive price. He states that these purchases will certainly help him in improving his repair services, and therefore, will meet his customers' requirements.

loans.use: to purchase car spare parts.

loans.name: Bernice's Group

texts.en:
Bernice is a member of this group. She is single with two children who are both in school. 

Bernice has sold bedsheets, towels and curtains for seven years now. She uses the money from her business to cover home expenses. Her children's fee payments are a challenge for her. Despite these challenges, Bernice is a hardworking lady who works endlessly to take care of the family single-handedly.

Bernice’s group is applying for a total loan amount of 3,500 GHS [Ghana cedis] through ID-Ghana. She will use her 2,000 GHS portion of the loan to buy a bale of bedsheets to sell to customers.

loans.use: To buy a bale of bedsheets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 27-year-old single man from Lebanon. After gaining many years of experience working in mobile shops, Ibrahim decided in 2010 to open his own communication shop where he puts up for sale cellular phones, related accessories and rechargeable cards. 

With his requested youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., he will increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories with the intention of increasing his sales, and therefore, his income. Ibrahim’s only wish is to live in good conditions, and he is ready to do whatever it takes to achieve this.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Kolya

texts.en:
Kolya is a young farmer of 35 years. He lives in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. He is married and already the father of two school-aged sons. Now he is engaged in farming and agriculture with his wife, who helps him very much. Before, Kolya used to work in the Russian Federation and from there he provided for his family financially, but soon he understood that being so far from his family was a very hard trial for him and his family as well. On his farm Kolya raises cows, calves and chickens. On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, carrots and cabbage. He sells all of these through resellers.

Kolya is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy two more cows in order to enlarge his family's income.

loans.use: to buy two more cows in order to enlarge his family's income

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has a grocery business in Kangundo town where she sells vegetables, fruits, onions and tomatoes.. She is 46 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with five children. Her spouse also produces additional income.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables. These include spinach, kale and cabbages. She also plans to buy fruits, potatoes, onions and tomatoes. She anticipates making more profits that she will use to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her third loan and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, Margaret hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, onions and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu is a woman who works hard to improve her standard of living. The previous loan helped her to buy bales of clothes for sale. Here she comes to you again, requesting a loan of KSHS 20,000 to add another bale of clothes for sale. She appreciates the support from Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Rodolfo

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor que desde muy pequeño aprendió de su padre el oficio, realizando está actividad desde 6:00 a.m. hasta 2: 00 p. m. el genera los ingresos para darles a su familia todo lo necesario. Su familia está compuesta por su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 19,17, 15 y 9 años. Para el esta actividad no le representa ningún problema pues ya tiene mucha experiencia.
Comprará fertilizantes, plaguicidas, herbicidas y abono, para sembrar maíz y frijol, con lo que tendrá lo necesario para preparar la tierra, tener una producción abundante, aumentar sus ganancias y cancelar la deuda.
Todo estos esfuerzos tienen  como objetivo ver a sus hijos como profesionales, tener un negocio muy rentable y mejorar las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who learned his trade at a very young age from his father. He works at his job from 6:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. The income he generates provides everything his family needs. His family consists of his wife and four children (ages 19, 17, 15, and 9). Working in this trade has not presented any problems for him since he has a great deal of experience.


José will buy fertilizers, fungicides, herbicides, and compost for his corn and bean crops. As a result, he will have everything he needs to prepare the land so that he can have an abundant production, increase his earnings, and pay off his debt. All of his efforts are geared toward seeing his children become professionals, having a profitable business, and improving his family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides, herbicides, and compost.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is an experienced farmer from Khanjyan village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband. To take care of their needs, both of them are extensively engaged in agribusiness. They are involved in cattle breeding, in breeding pigs and piglets, and in cultivation of cabbage. Julieta and her husband realize the agricultural products in the local market. The latter is the main source of their income. As the autumn is progressing and winter is very close, Julieta needs to make some investments in her agribusiness to prepare it for the winter. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase forage for the livestock (alfalfa, barley, and combined forage). The loan will help her run the agribusiness in a sustainable way. As this is Julieta’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Julieta and her husband rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock

loans.name: Patma

texts.ru: Патме 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Патмы - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Патма занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Патмы, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, а также 0,26 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, кукурузу, сеет зерновые культуры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Патма обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов для обработки посевной земли, а также намерена купить семена картофеля. Доходы от кредита Патма планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт помещения для домашних животных.
texts.en:
Patma is 43 years old, married and she and her husband are raising 3 children. Patma has high school education. Patma provides her family's main source of income by growing crops and breeding livestock, which she started doing 20 years ago with 10,000 Kyrgyz som. Thanks to her hard work, Patma currently has 1 milking cow, 1 horse and 0.26 hectares of land. She uses the land every day to grow potatoes, corn and to sow crops to both sell and use herself. Her monthly income is 5,000 som. 

With the aim of further developing her farm, Patma contacted the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners to ask for a loan of 30,000 som, in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides to help her work on her cultivated land. She also wants to use the money to buy potato seeds. Patma plans to use the profits from the loan to buy more livestock and plans to save enough funds to refurbish her animals' living areas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en: Radwan is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. In 2010, he was able to start operating his most adorable profession, which consists of repairing motorcycles. He owns a small territory where he performs his tasks gently and efficiently. Radwan is very ambitious and always tends to work with modern tools. So, he is requesting today to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to be able to possess modernized equipment. He is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming season and hopes that the loan will help him increase his income by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase modern repair equipment

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en: Khanum is an agronomist from Lernagog village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, school-age son and daughter (16 and 2 years old), and parents-in-law. Khanum works as a babysitter in the local kindergarten. Her husband works in the village local self-governance body. They are the main breadwinners of family. However, the salaries are so low that they cannot afford a living based on those salaries alone. With the help of her family members, Khanum is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding pigs and hens, and in cultivation of apricots. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Khanum needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase five steers and to buy some forage for the livestock, preparing it for the winter. As this is Khanum’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Khanum and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase five steers and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has a boutique business in Nairobi where she sells handbags, shoes and dolls. She is 47 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. Her spouse also produces additional income.

She will use this loan to buy more handbags, shoes and dolls to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to buy more handbags to sell. This is her third loan and she paid her previous loans successfully.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy handbags, shoes and dolls to sell.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahraa is a 19-year-old Lebanese single woman. A year ago, she decided to start her professional career with the intention of helping her family increase their income. She is a brilliant beautician and has magnificent and magic hands. With the purpose of improving her business, Zahraa is applying today for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will mainly purchase beauty products and cosmetics in addition to pedicure equipment. In the future, and after graduating, Zahraa plans to become the owner of a proper beauty institute.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, cosmetics and pedicure equipment

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento KANTUTAS está compuesto por nueve integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones, los socios de este banco se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Francisca tiene 50  años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 13 y 9 años  ella se dedica a la  venta de comida, tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicada en la zona de 12 de Abril de la ciudad de La paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Francisca va a usar este préstamo para compra de víveres para la elaboración de sus comidas como abarrotes para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital, la Sra. Francisca enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varios lugares que venden comida por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mesas y sillas para ampliar su negocio, se siente  feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Kantutas" consists of nine members, seven women and two men. The members of this bank engage in different businesses. The president of the bank is Sra. Francisca. She is 50 years old, married, and has two children (ages 13 and 9). Francisca sells food from a stand located in the April 12th District in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender.

Sra. Francisca will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes, which includes groceries for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her capital. Sra. Francisca faces challenges in her business, such as the competition that exists from different places that sell food in her area. She will use the profits to continue buying tables and chairs so that she can expand her business.

Francisca is pleased and grateful for this opportunity that has been given since her business is the only way for her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Juan” esta ubicado en una comunidad muy hermosa, se caracteriza por sus habitantes muy amables son personas muy trabajadoras las actividades sobresalientes son la elaboración de artesanía de yeso, también hay muchos negocios con desperdicio industrial y la venta de ollas para hacer las piñatas en el mes diciembre que  también son hechas a mano. El grupo “San Juan” lo conforman ocho integrantes todas son mujeres muy emprendedoras cada una de ellas tiene un negocio productivo por eso están solicitando un crédito a Kiva y VisionFund para invertir en sus negocios, Sandra invertirá en joyería, Fulgencia y Rosenda compraran maíz para su negocio de tortillas, Yolanda invertirá en tambos y cubetas, Yolanda en tela para colchas, Yunuen en equipo de computo, Rocío en la venta de colchas y blancos, Magdalena invertirá en su papelería. 

Doña Teresa es representante del grupo ella fue quien decidió en nombre del grupo y lo eligió porque así se llama el santo patrono de la comunidad le tiene mucha fe y le pidió mucha fortaleza para sacar adelante a su grupo, llevan muchos ciclos trabajando con la institución. Doña Tere tiene 51 años de edad está casada desde hace ya 31 años con el señor Santos juntos formaron una familia con cinco hijas de las cuales solo una es dependiente de dicha pareja. Doña Tere se dedica la venta de cosméticos y perfumes por catalogo desde hace ya 30 años platica que inicio su actividad porque le gustaba mucho el contacto con las personas pero también por necesidad porque sus gastos eran muchos y de alguna manera decidió ayudar con los gastos del hogar, también tiene una papelería desde hace ya seis años esta la inicio porque anteriormente tenía una cocina económica sus hijas eran quienes le ayudaban a atenderla pero tiempo después esto fue imposible entonces fue como la motivaron a emprender su papelería. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar más productos de belleza  necesita de su crédito porque trabaja con varias marcas, Doña Tere tiene mucha experiencia en la venta de cosméticos, sin embargo su reto es poder llegar a conocer más marcas para poder expender el numero de sus clientes, La meta de Doña Tere es poder ver realizada profesionalmente a su hija  la cual se encuentra estudiando la Universidad.  Doña Tere está muy orgullosa de sus hijas porque aunque ya no la apoyan en el negocio si le ayudan económicamente. *Magadlena esta atras de otra integrante del grupo*
texts.en:
The group “San Juan” is located in a very beautiful community, characterized by its very friendly residents. They are very hardworking people. The main activities are making handicrafts from plaster. There are also many businesses with industrial waste and selling pots to make piñatas in the month of December, which are also handmade.

The group “San Juan” is made up of eight members. All are very enterprising women. Each of them has a productive business. For this reason, they are requesting a loan from Kiva and VisionFund in order to invest in their businesses.

Sandra will invest in jewelry, Fulgencia and Rosenda will buy corn for their tortilla business, Yolanda will invest in buckets and barrels, Yolanda in fabric for quilts, Yunuen in computer equipment, Rocío in selling quilts and linens, and Magdalena will invest in her stationary shop.

Teresa is a representative of the group. She was the one who decided on the group’s name, and she chose it because this is the name of the patron saint of the community. She has great faith in him, and she asked for a lot of strength in order to get her group ahead. They have been with this organization for many loan cycles.

Tere (Teresa) is 51 years old. She has been married for 31 years to Santos. Together, they had a family of five daughters, one of whom is dependent on the pair of them.

Tere has worked selling cosmetics and perfumes by catalog for 30 years. She says that she started her work because she really enjoyed the interaction with people, but also out of necessity, because her expenses are high, and she decided in some way to help out with the household costs.

She has also had a stationary shop for six years now; she began this because previously, she had a restaurant. Her children were the ones who helped her to run it, but after a while this was impossible; this then motivated her to start her stationary shop.

This time, she is requesting a loan to purchase more beauty products. She needs her loan because she works with various brands. Tere has a lot of experience selling cosmetics; however, her challenge is getting involved with more brands in order to be able to expand her number of customers.

Tere’s goal is to be able to see her daughter who is studying at the university become a professional. Tere is very proud of her daughters, because although they no longer support her with her business, they do help her financially.

Magdalena is behind another member of the group.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en: Silva is an experienced agronomist from Haytagh village of the Armavir region. She lives with her son, daughter, and parents. To take care of the family's needs, Silva is engaged in plant cultivation. She cultivates beans, cucumbers, and greens. Her son and daughter assist her greatly during her daily activities related to farming. They take the agricultural products to the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Silva needs a loan of USD 1700 to purchase wheat seeds, to pay for harvesting services, to purchase cellophane for building a greenhouse, and to make previous credit repayments. The loan will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family, making their agribusiness more sustainable. Silva and her big family rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to pay for harvesting services, to purchase cellophane for building a greenhouse, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es:
Blanca, cuanta con una tienda que le genera los ingresos necesarios para darles alimentación, salud y educación a sus hijos, ella es soltera, vive junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 6 años. Esta actividad la realizaba junto a su familia pero se ha independizado y emprendió su propio negocio.
Comprar arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, etc., todo con el fin de tener más surtida la tienda, aumentar sus ganancias, y dales a sus clientes más variedad de productos.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y reparar la vivienda para q ue sus hijos vivan en un ambiente más seguro.
texts.en:
Blanca has a store that generates the income she needs to feed, educate, and provide health care for her children. She is single and lives with her two children (ages 10 and 6). Blanca manages her business with her family, but starting her own venture has enabled her to be independent. She will buy rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, and other products so that she can have more inventory in her store. This will increase her earnings and provide a wider variety of products for her customers.

Her dream is to expand her business and to repair her home so that her children can live in a more secure environment.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 32 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children. She runs a pharmacy and has been in the business for three years now. Her spouse also produces additional income. Besides the pharmacy business, Anne also does farming.

She plans to use this loan to buy more medicine to sell. She will use the anticipated income to start a green house. This is her second loan term, having paid her previous loan successfully.

In the future she hopes to invest in dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Karuwa

texts.en:
Karuwa is the married mother of four children, three of whom go to school and one who is still young. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells vegetables. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Dynamique Group

texts.fr: La cliente Charlotte est une présidente de l’association de crédit « Dynamique », entrepreneur expérimentée, courageuse, âgée de 38 ans, divorcée et mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous.   La cliente est  une vendeuse des souliers. Elle installe ses articles  au marché public, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds  propre issu des récoltes de son champs, avant qu’elle s’installe dans la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 7  ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 35 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une maison pour ses enfants. Les vols, les impayés, les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Charlotte is the president of the Dynamique loan group.  She is 38 years old, divorced and mother to four children who all attend school.  

Charlotte is a courageous, experienced entrepreneur who sells shoes.  She sells the shoes at the public market and, sometimes, from her home.  She started her business seven years ago, with her own capital which she earned from the sale of produce from her fields.  She later set up in the town and took a loan from the field partner Hekima.  This new loan will be used to buy 35 pairs of shoes.  With her earnings, Charlotte will pay her children's school expenses, expand her business activities and buy a house for her children.

Theft, non-payment of debts and exchange rate losses are all big challenges to the development of her business.

Charlotte is very grateful to Hekima for helping non-bankable, women entrepreneurs become autonomous, especially in this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 35 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ameth

texts.fr: Monsieur Ameth est un homme  qui évolue dans la vente de produits alimentaires  dans un marché de la commune.  Il dispose d’une boutique d’alimentation. Il est marié et père de famille. Ameth assure les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et il a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité. Il sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 500.000 pour acheter des denrées de 1ères nécessités comme le riz, le sucre, l’huile , le savon etc…… et ensuite les expose dans la boutique pour enfin les revendre à ses clients. Il souhaite augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Ameth sells food products from his shop in a market in his community, and has more than ten years experience in this trade.  He is married, has children, and is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family.

Ameth will use his loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy basic foodstuffs, and other necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, soap, etc.  These products will then be resold from his shop.  Ameth wants to increase his earnings to be able to diversify his business.

loans.use: to buy basic foods for resale.

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
Jeronima vive en el distrito de san Juan de Lurigancho, para poder salir adelante traba jane su pequeño negocio de venta de comida desde hace 5 años, Jeronima cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo porque tiene buena sazón.

Jeronima esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar enseres para su vivienda y su negocio como platos, vasos, cubiertos, entre otros, con lo cual podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y mejorar su calidad de vida, así seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Jeronima lives in the San Juan district of Lurigancho, and during the last 5 years she has been running her small business of food sales. She believes that things are going well in her business because she is very friendly with her customers, but above all, because she is a good cook.

Jeronima is grateful to Kiva Lenders because thanks to this help, she will be able to buy equipment for her home and for her business -like plates, glasses, silverware, among other- which will be useful to better serve her customers, and ultimately improve her quality of life. This is how she will continue to work to make her dream a reality: owning a big restaurant!

loans.use: to buy equipment (like plates, glasses, silverware, etc),

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene la edad de 44 años, estudio hasta el sexo año de primaria y está casada con el señor Miguel el cual trabaja como jornalero, ellos tiene una hija de nombre Xochilt que estudia la primaria.

Doña Lupe(como la llaman en su comunidad) y su familia viven en la comunidad de Vista Hermosa que se encuentra a 40 minutos de Tierra Blanca en el Veracruz, para poder llegar a la comunidad se toma un autobus que te deja en la carretera y debes caminar como 25 minutos para llegar ya que hay poco transporte.

Ella es integrante de un grupo llamado Sol Naciente el cual está conformado por 8 mujeres emprendedoras.
Doña Lupe platica que hace mas de 4 años vende ropa y cosméticos, ella vende casa por casa en su comunidad, lleva los catálogos con sus clientes, levanta pedidos y los encarga a sus proveedores cuando le llega el pedido lo entrega a sus clientes y recibe su pago. 

Ella decidió iniciar con su propio negocio ya que quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.
doña Lupe necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosmético(perfumes, esmaltes, sombras, maquillajes, delineadores, labiales) y ropa (shorts, blusas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas y ropa interior).
 
Ella espera que con este crédito su negocio prospere y deje buenas ganancias ya que ella espera terminar de construir su casa y darle una profesión a su hija. 

Doña Lupe se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la confianza que le está brindando al otorgarle este crédito el cual la ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida y a invertir en su negocio.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Teresa venta de abarrotes 
Nallely venta de antojitos
Dulce maria venta de antojitos 
Ana Linda venta de refrescos
Celene venta de zapatos
Mireya venta de platano macho
Roxana carniceria
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 44, has a sixth grade education and she is married to Miguel, who is a wage earner.  They have a daughter, Xochilt, who attends primary school. 

Doña Lupe (as she is called in the community) and her family live in the community of Vista Hermosa which is 40 minutes from Tierra Blanca in Veracruz.  To get there, one must take a bus, get off at the side of the road and walk for 25 minutes, as there is little transportation.

She is a member of a communal bank "Sol Naciente" which is comprised of eight women entrepreneurs.  Lupe says she has been sellling clothing and cosmetics for over four years.  She goes door to door in her community, taking catalogues to show the customers.  She then places the orders with her suppliers and later delivers the orders against payment.

Lupe began her own business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics (perfumes, nail polish, eye shadow, makeup, eyeliner, lipstick) and clothing (shorts, blouses, shirts, pants, dresses, skirts and lingerie).

With this loan she hopes her business will prosper and provide a good profit because she wants to finish building her house and give her daughter a professional education.

Lupe is grateful to the foundation for the trust being shown in her by granting this loan which will improve her quality of life and allow her to invest in her business.

The other members of the group are:

Teresa, grocery sales
Nallely, snack sales
Dulce Maria, snack sales
Ana Linda, soft drink sales
Celene, shoe sales
Mireya, banana sales
Roxana, butcher shop

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Venus Group

texts.es:
Venus es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 6 personas amables, trabajadoras y emprendedoras, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con el objetivo de ofrecer a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
Antonieta es uno de los miembros de dicho grupo, ella tiene la edad de 44 años, solo estudio preparatoria y es madre soltera de una pequeña de nombre Dulce de 7 años que estudia la primaria, Antonieta platica que por más de 8 años se ha dedicado al comercio de venta de abarrotes, ella tiene en su hogar una pequeña tienda y ella comenta que cuando inicio con su negocio era una pequeña papelería y poco a poco fue metiendo abarrotes haciéndolo crecer, Antonieta esta muy contenta ya que su negocio le da la oportunidad de tener su propia fuente de empleo y brindar a su hija una mejor calidad de vida, ella además en sus ratos libre sale a vender cosméticos por catalogo para tener un ingreso extra.
Ella dice “lo que más me gusta de mi negocio es que todo el día estoy en contacto con la gente y puedo atender a mi hija sin descuidar mi negocio”.

Un crédito de visión fund le dará la oportunidad de comprar galletas, refrescos, aceite, sopa, café, azúcar, frijol, arroz, papel higiénico, jugos, dulces, productos enlatados, lápices, gomas, cuadernos, lapiceros.

Espera que con esta inversión su negocio luzca más surtido para atraer clientes y poder aumentar sus ganancias ya que quiere que su pequeña continúe con sus estudios.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Teresa venta de comida 
Lilia venta de carne 
Donatos venta de carne 
Ciriaco venta de pan 
Maria Eugenia venta de calzado
texts.en:
The communal bank "Venus" is comprised of six kind, hard-working entrepreneurs who all carry out some type of business in order to offer their families a better quality of life.

Antonieta is one of the members of the group.  She is 44, has a high school education, and is a single mother of a seven-year-old daughter named Dulce who attends primary school.  Antonieta says she has been selling groceries for eight years out of the small store she has at home.  She claims that when she began the business it was a small stationery supplies store but, little by little, she began selling groceries and expanded the business.

Antonieta is very happy about being able to have her own source of income and give her daughter a better quality of life.  In her spare time she sells cosmetics by catalogue to earn extra income.  She says "what I like most about my business is that I am in touch with people all day while also attending to my daughter".

A loan from Visión Fund will give her the opportunity to buy cookies, soft drinks, oil, soup, coffee, sugar, beans, rice, toilet paper, juices, sweets, canned goods, pencils, erasers, notebooks and pens.  She hopes this investment in a variety of products will attract customers and increase her profit so she can pay for her daughter's continued education.

The other members of the group are:

Teresa, food sales 
Lilia, meat sales 
Donatos, meat sales
Ciriaco, bread sales
Maria Eugenia, shoe sales

loans.use: To buy groceries and stationery supplies.

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noemy es una joven de 28 años de edad, la cual es caficultora y ama de casa en un estado civil de unión libre y de su relación en hogar tiene 3 hijos, los 2 mayores están en la escuela y la niña menor en el kínder. Su grado de educación es de primaria completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres a quienes ella agradece el apoyo brindado. En sus cultivos de café y granos básicos (maíz y frijol) son ella y su pareja los únicos que se involucran en todas las tareas a realizar en sus cultivos teniendo 5 años de hacerlo en compañía de su pareja pero fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. El terreno que ella y su pareja trabajan es propio gracias a una herencia de parte de su madre a quien ella le agradece esa gran oportunidad de tener el terreno para poder generar ingresos para su familia. Al final de cada cosecha ella vende el grano a los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona y otros que llegan de lugares aledaños para re vender en el mercado local. Una parte de sus cultivos está ubicada a 5 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada en vehículo y la otra parte está cerca de 1 kilómetro a la cual se traslada caminando.  
Ella hoy en día solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y poder pagar mano de obra para poder asistir ambos cultivos ya que no le es posible hacerlo solo ella y su pareja por las distancias en las que están ubicados.
Sus metas son seguir cultivando café ya que es un rubro bastante rentable dando todas las atenciones y el mantenimiento posible para que al final de cada cosecha el grano sea un éxito. Como madre para sus hijos darles la oportunidad de ir avanzando con sus estudios un paso a la vez hasta llegar a la universidad y que puedan graduarse para ser mejores personas y con mejores oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Noemy, 28, is a young coffee grower and homemaker who has a common-law husband.  She has three children at home, two of whom attend school and a little girl who goes to kindergarten.  Noemy has a complete primary education which she was able to finish thanks to the financial and moral support of her parents to whom she is grateful.

She and her husband are the only ones who take care of the coffee and basic grain (corn and bean) crops and they have been working together for five years.  But it was their parents who taught them about crop farming.  They have their own land which was inherited from her mother, and she is grateful for having the land so she can earn a living for the family.  At the end of every harvest she sells grain to different buyers who come to the area and to people from neighboring communities who re-sell at the local market.  Part of her cropland is located five kilometers from home, so they go there by vehicle, and the other part is one kilometer from home, so they can walk there.

Noemy is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies for her coffee crop and to hire workers to care for the crops since it is impossible for her and her husband to cover everying given the distance.

Her goal is to continue growing coffee because it is a fairly profitable business; so she will give it the care and maintenance necessary for a successful harvest.  As a mother, she wants to give her children the opportunity to continue their education through university level so they can graduate and be better prepared and have more employment opportunities.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and hire maintenance workers.

loans.name: El Triunfo (Flat) Ahorros Group

texts.es:
Bertha es otra de las integrantes del grupo El Triunfo, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estudio primaria y esta casada con Margarito que trabaja como jornalero , ellos tuvieron 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de esa y trabajan. 
Bertha es comerciante desde hace 4 años, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar cuando ella inició con su actividad solo vendía refrescos poco a poco fue metiendo más productos y haciendo crecer su negocio, ella está muy contenta con su actividad ya que además de ganar su propio dinero brinda un servicio a la gente de su comunidad ya que es una de las pocas tiendas que hay en la localidad lo cual ayuda a que vende un poco más, también dice que el abarrote siempre se va de no hay temporadas diario cae dinero.
