Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a comprar frijol, aceite, arroz, café, azúcar, sal, galletas, dulces, refrescos, detergentes y productos enlatados para resurtir su negocio. 

Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y la calidad de vida de su familia mejore. 
Este grupo agradece el apoyo que han recibido atraves de estos créditos de Kiva y VisionFund para sus negocios. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Emma venta de abarrotes, Heladia cría de cerdos, Emiliano siembra de caña de azúcar, Gabino siembra de caña de azúcar, Teodoro venta de refrescos, Laura venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
Bertha is another member of the communal bank "El Triunfo".  She is 49, has a primary education and is married to Margarito who works as a wage earner.  They have five children who are all adults and work.

For four years, Bertha has been working as a merchant.  She has a small grocery store at home which she began by selling only soft drinks.  Little by little she introduced more products and expanded the business.  She is very happy with this activity because in addition to earning her own income she offers a service to the people in her community.  It is one of the few stores in the town which helps sales volume even more.    She says groceries are always sold, no matter what the season or money situation may be.

A loan from VisionFund will help her buy beans, oil, rice, coffee, sugar, salt, cookies, sweets, soft drinks, detergents and canned goods to stock her business.  She hopes this investment will allow her business to proser so her family's quality of life will improve.

The group is grateful for the support received through the Kiva and VisionFund loans for their business.

The other members of the group are: Emma who sells groceries, Heladia who raises pigs, Emiliano who grows sugar cane, Gabino who grows sugar cane, Teodoro who sells soft drinks and Laura who sells snacks.

loans.use: to buy soup, coffee, sugar, beans, oil, cookies, detergents, sweets, canned goods, and soda.

location.town: Plan de Villa, Tierra Blanca, Veracruz

loans.name: La Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
La Guadalupe es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 4 personas, este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de San Miguel soyaltepec el cual esta a la orilla de la laguna de Temaxcal la cual ayuda a que el comercio fluya en la comunidad ya que mucha gente se dedica a la pesca y la gente de las comunidades recabas acuden a comprar la mojarra. 

Martha es una de las integrantes de este pequeño grupo tiene 37 años de edad, sólo estudió la secundaria y esta casada con Raymundo que emigró a Estados Unidos en busca de un mejor trabajo, ella tiene tres hijos Erika de 19 años estudia la universidad, Nieves de 15 años estudia la preparatoria y Raymundo de 13 que asiste a la secundaria. 

Ella comenta que hace algunos años asistió a un curso de elaboración de bisutería y trajes típicos de la región, como aprendió muy bien y le gustó mucho decidió poner en su casa un pequeño taller en el cual elabora bisutería(aretes, pulseras, anillos y collares) además elabora trajes típicos bordados. Ella dice que lo que más le gusta de su actividad es que usa su ingenio y puede crear diferentes modelos en aretes, pulseras, anillos y collares y a sus clientes les gustan. Ella realiza la creación de su bisutería en su casa pero por la tardes sale a las casas de sus amigas y clientes a ofrecer sus productos en algunas ocasiones le hacen pedidos con los diseños que a sus clientes le gustan, Martha platica que le deja más ganancias los trajes típicos ya que con la venta de uno gana lo que ganaría en un mes vendiendo pulseras.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito de VisionFund porque quiere invertir en la compra de variedad de hilos, telas, pedrería, un taladro y una prensa para continuar con su labor artesanal. 
Ella espera a futuro terminar de acondicionar su taller y poder rentar un local en el cual mostrar y vender sus productos. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son: 
Raúl taller mecánico 
José Luis servicio de publicidad 
Jorge servicio de transporte
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Guadalupe" is comprised of four people and located in the community of San Miguel Soyaltepec, which is on the shores of the Temaxcal Lake.  This helps trade in the area since many locals are involved in fishing and people from neighboring communities come here to buy "mojarra" fish.

Martha is a member of this small group.  She is 37 years old and only has a secondary education.  She is married to Raymundo who emigrated to the United States in search of better work.  She has three children, Erika, 19, who goes to the university, Nieves, 15, in high school and Raymundo, 13, in junior high.

She says some years ago she took a course on making costume jewelry and typical regional costumes.  She learned it well and liked it, and decided to set up a small workshop in her home to make costume jewelry (earrings, bracelets, rings and necklaces) and embroidered regional costumes.  What she enjoys most about her work is that she can be creative to come up with different styles of earrings, bracelets, rings and necklaces that her customers will like.  She works on the jewelry at home but in the afternoon goes to friends' and neighbors' houses to sell her products.  Sometimes she receives orders for custom designs.  Martha says she earns more from the regional costumes because by selling one she can make the same amount of money as she does with one month's sale of jewelry.

She has requested a loan through VisionFund to buy threads, fabrics, rhinestones and a punch press to continue with her craft work.  In the future she wants to renovate the workshop and rent a shop to display and sell her products.

The other members of the group are:
Raúl, who runs a mechanic workshop
José Luis, who is in the publicity business
Jorge, who is in the transportation business

loans.use: To buy a variety of threads, fabrics, rhinestones, and a punch press.

loans.name: Maripositas Group

texts.es:
Maripositas es un grupo integrado por 10  personas alegres y emprendedoras, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad: Luz María venta de antojitos, Maricela venta de dulces, refrescos y coronas, Maria de Jesús venta de ropa, Dulce Maria repostería, Erika club de Nutrición, Alicia club de nutrición, Ciro taller de herrería,  Cruz Maria venta de calzado, Joaquina venta de dulces  y Oswaldo repostería. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Tierra blanca, donde la principal actividad económica es el comercio y se conoce por su clima soleado en gran parte del año. 

Maricela es uno de los integrantes del grupo ella tiene 47 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar y está casada con Arturo, ella platica que tiene 27 años dedicándose al comercio, actualmente vende desde su hogar, refrescos, frituras y dulces, además en el mes de noviembre realiza coronas para vender en día de muertos ya que la gente acostumbra a comprarlas y llevarlas a los panteones a las tumbas de sus familiares. Ella ya ha empezado a trabajar en la elaboración de sus coronas, pero ha solicitado este crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de mas materiales como flores, unicel, celoseda  para la elaboración de coranas y dulces, refrescos y frituras para  resurtir su tiendita.
Maricela platica esta venta de coronas es solo una vez al años y se debe aprovechar porque se vende mucho, como ella ya tiene años realizándolas sus amigos y clientes le hacen sus pedidos con tiempo. 
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio deje buenas ganancias ya que le gustaría hacer algunas mejoras a su hogar y acondicionar su local para su venta de golosinas y refrescos.

El Grupo Mariposas agradece a Kiva y a VisionFund por el apoyo que le esta otorgando atravez de estos prestamos.
texts.en:
Maripositas is a group made up of 10 cheerful and enterprising people. Each of them has an activity: Luz María sells snacks, Maricela sells candies, beverages and wreaths, Maria de Jesús sells clothes, Dulce Maria sells pastries, Erika has a nutrition club, Alicia also has a nutrition club, Ciro has a metalworking workshop, Cruz Maria sells shoes, Joaquina sells candies and Oswaldo sells pastries. This group is located in Tierra Blanca, where the main economic activity is commerce and it is known for it sunny climate for a big part of the year. 

Maricela is one of the members of the group. She is 47 and wasn't able to go to school. She is married to Arturo. She says that she has been a merchant for 27 years. Right now she sells from her home. She sells beverages, fried food and candies. In November she also makes wreaths to sell on the Day of the Dead because people buy them from her and take them to the cemeteries to their family members' graves. She has already started to make the wreaths, but she has asked for this loan because she needs to invest in buying more materials such as flowers, glue and ribbon to make the wreaths, as well as candies, beverages and fried foods to stock her store. 

Maricela says that selling the wreaths is only once a year and she should take advantage because she sells a lot because she has been making them for years for her friends and customers who order them ahead of time.
 
She hopes that with this investment her business will have good earnings since she would like to do some home improvements and do some work on her locale to sell snacks and beverages.

The Mariposas group thanks Kiva and VisionFund for the support they are giving through these loans.

loans.use: to buy flowers, glue, ribbons, candies, beverages and fried food.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
Elba es uno de los integrantes de un grupo llamado Emanuel, ellos decidieron dar este nombre ya que algunos de los integrantes son cristianos y significa “Dios con nosotros”, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Tierra Blanca donde las principales fuentes de empleo son el comercio y se caracteriza por sus fuertes calores en verano.
Elba tiene la edad de 35 años, solo estudio la secundaria y se encuentra casada con Gerardo con el cual tiene dos hijos, ella comenta que tiene 13 años dedicando se al comercio e inició vendiendo bolsas de regalo y poco a poco con el paso del tiempo y el apoyo de su familia abrió un pequeño negocio en el cual vende bisutería, plásticos y juguetes. Quien la motivo a abrir este negocio fue un familiar que también vendía, le dijo que la gente busca mucho estos productos se arriesgo y los resultados fueron satisfactorios para ella. 
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio ha Elba es que es su propio patrón y puede disponer de tiempo libre para atender a su familia hacer sus deberes del hogar. También comenta que trata de tener su negocio surtido con productos de temporada por ejemplo en navidad se surte series, esferas y  juguetes, en septiembre vende productos patrióticos cornetas, banderas, sombreros. De esta manera atrae a sus clientes. 
Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudará a invertirlo en variedad de "chácharas" (juguetes, plásticos, bisutería, bolsas de regalo). Ella espera que su negocio continúe prosperando, luzca mas surtido y atraer más clientes y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los demás miembros del grupo son:
Francisca florería 
Mauro servicio de taxi 
Joaquin Cesar venta de ropa 
Maria de Lourdes venta de perfumería 
Maria del Socorro venta de comida 
Miriam Deysi repostería
texts.en:
Elba is one of the members of the group  called Emanuel. They decided to give it that name since some of the members are Christian and it means "God with us".  This group is located in Tierra Blanca where the main source of employment is commerce and it is characterized by its strong heat in the summer.  

Elba is 35 years old. She only went to secondary school and she is married to Gerardo, with whom she has two children. She says that she has been working in commerce for 13 years and she started selling gift bags. Little by little, over time and with her family's help, she opened a little business where she sells jewelry, plastic items and toys. The person who motivated her to open this business was a relative who also was a seller who said that people really look for these products. She took a risk and the results were satisfactory for her.  
 
What Elba likes the most about her business is that she is her own boss and has free time to care for her family and do the housework. She also says that she tries to have seasonal products at her business. For example, at Christmas, she stocks up on Christmas baubles and toys. In September, she sells patriotic products such as horns, flags and hats. This is how she attracts her customers. 
 
A loan from VisionFund will help her to invest in a variety of "chácharas" (toys, plastic items, jewelry and gift bags). She hopes that her business will continue to prosper, look more stocked and attract more customers, thus improving her quality of life. 

The other members of the group are:
Francisca - flower shop 
Mauro - taxi service 
Joaquin Cesar- selling clothes 
Maria de Lourdes- selling perfume
Maria del Socorro - selling food  
Miriam Deysi -pastries

loans.use: to buy toys, plastic items, jewelry and gift bags.

loans.name: Zarouhi

texts.en: Zarouhi is a 49-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children. She works in collaboration with her husband with the aim of earning a satisfactory income. In 2007, she opened a store where she has been working as a tailor. She also irons clothes in order to deliver them to customers in good shape. At present, Zarouhi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to update her tailoring machinery and purchase textiles to increase her business productivity and therefore her revenue. In the future, she plans to expand her work into other areas.

loans.use: to update her tailoring machinery and purchase textiles,

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
La señora Melida es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y condimentos.
Doña Melida tiene su negocio desde hace 15 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como frijoles, arroz, plátanos, yuca, carnes, papas, refrescos, etc. Para aumentar la producción su negocio y de esta manera seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña Melida espera que sus ventas aumenten y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes,  gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que pueda tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Melida is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family. Her business is selling snacks and condiments. 

Melida has had her business for 15 years. She has it in her house in the town where she lives. She needs the loan to buy more products such as beans, rice, plantains, yucca, meats, potatoes, beverages, etc. in order to increase production at her business so she can keep doing her job.  

Melida hopes that her sales will increase and that she can satisfy her customers' demand. Thanks to this, she hopes to improve her family's quality of life with the increase of household income. In the short term, she hopes to grow her business and keep supporting her family so her children can have the education they need so that they can have more opportunities in life. 


Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2013

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, plantains, yucca, meats, potatoes, beverages, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man. He is a car mechanic who specializes in repairing electrical issues. At the same time, he works as an employee at a local company. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. With his youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l, he will purchase mechanical tools and supplies so as to facilitate and expedite his reparation services. Hasan is very optimistic and hopes to be able to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and supplies.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira is an experienced farmer from Vahagni village of Lori region. Her family consists of her husband and two school age sons (16 and 12 years old). Naira’s husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant; he works there and sends some money to the family to take care of their needs. Naira is employed in the government sector, in the postal service. She works hard for a living every day. Naira is also engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in breeding pigs, and in the cultivation of potatoes, grass, plums, apples and pears. She sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of her family’s income. As autumn is progressing, Naira needs to prepare her agribusiness for the winter. She needs a loan of 1500 USD to buy forage for her cattle. She has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during in recent times, Naira was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. Therefore, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Naira and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy forage for her cattle.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 60, is from Nyahururu. He is married to Eunice and they are blessed with four children aged 25, 23, 20 and 18.

He owns a restaurant, a business he has operated for the past ten years and to enable him buy more flour, potatoes, cooking fat,sugar and onions which are used in preparation of meals for his customers, he has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is 15,000 KES, and he intends to use profits realized from his expanded business to buy some rams and steers to rear and later resell after they are fattened.

Charles hopes to buy some plots of land in the future so he can construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy flour, potatoes, cooking fat, sugar, onions and other items to prepare food in his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri, 47,  lives in the village of Zeda Dagva. He is married and has one 21-year-old son. Badri works as a construction worker locally and gets a monthly income. Besides this, he runs an agricultural business and cultivates a plot of land where citrus, maize and nuts are grown. Badri sells his harvest locally and earns seasonal funds. Badri breeds a milk cow as well and sells milk in his village. The existing income is not enough to cover his family's daily expenses, so Badri decided to get additional job at the local clothing store. With this credit he is applying for, Badri will buy a mini-bus to serve the sartorial in return for a monthly salary. He will start a logistics business and hopes that his earnings will increase. 

Badri is very hard-working person who wishes to give his family members all the best things. 

He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus and start working in logistics for the clothing store.

loans.name: San Judas (Flat) Ahorros Group

texts.es:
Martha es otro de los integrantes del grupo San Judas, ella tiene 33 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres pequeños de nombres Jorge, José y Jesús ellos actualmente estudian la secundaria y primaria, Martha platica que desde hace cuatro años decidió iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que no quería trabajar sin descuidar a sus hijos así que decidido poner un pequeño puesto de antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas, gorditas, garnachas, papas )los fines de semana(viernes, sábado y domingo) en su casa con el objetivo de ganar su propio dinero y mejorar la vida de sus hijos, 
Ella comenta que como ya tiene tiempo desarrollando esta actividad ha ganado buenos clientes los cuales acuden a su negocio hacerle el gasto, ella decidió por esta actividad ya que la comida siempre se vende y le gusta cocinar. 
Ella espera que este crédito le ayude a  compra masa, aceite, frijoles, tortillas, crema, queso, lechuga, carne de pollo y res, chiles, papas, cebollas, tomates y ajos para continuar con sus ventas.
 
Futuro le gustaría que su negocio continúe progresando para que sus hijos continúen estudiando.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Ana Guadalupe venta de abarrotes
Clarissa venta de antojitos 
Nicolas cría de cerdos
texts.en:
Martha, 33, is another member of San Judas Group.  She's a single mother and has three small children, Jorge, José, and Jesús, who currently attend elementary and secondary school.

Martha says she decided to invest in her own business four years ago because she didn't want to neglect her children while working.  So she decided to set up a small stand in her home to sell Mexican snacks (empanadas, tostadas, sandwiches, potatoes) on the weekend (Friday, Saturday, Sunday) to earn her own income and improve her children's lives.

She says that because she has the time to do this job she has attracted good customers who spend in her business.  She decided on this business because food always sells and she likes to cook.

Martha hopes this loan helps her buy masa, oil, beans, tortillas, cream, cheese, lettuce, chicken and beef, chili peppers, potatoes, onion, tomatoes, and garlic so she can continue selling. 

Martha would like to continue making progress with her business in the future so her children will keep on going to school.

The other members of the group are Ana Guadalupe, who sells groceries; Clarissa, who sells snacks; and Nicolás, who raises pigs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 35 años, está casada con Marcelino de 42 años y tiene 3 hijos. Vive conjuntamente con su familia en su casa hecha a base de madera que construyó su pareja. Vivió  desde muy niña en el campo junto a sus padres de quienes aprendió el oficio de la agricultura. Tiene mas de  15 años desempeñándose junto a su esposo en las distintas tareas agrícolas como son la producción de cacao y otros productos rentables de su región. Para el normal desempeño de su trabajo cuenta en muchas ocasiones con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar  a quienes paga para las tareas complicadas como el retiro de maleza y recolección de los frutos en la cosecha.
Usualmente debe contar con dinero que le permite trabajar en cada campaña productiva sin inconvenientes para la compra de  abono orgánico para fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo y mejorar su producción. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Dese en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para mantener su terreno de 2 hectáreas con la compra de abono orgánico para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Sonia, who is 35, is married to 42-year-old Marcelino and has 3 children.  She lives with her family in the wooden house built by her husband.  From a very young age, she lived in the country with her parents from whom she learned all about farming.  For more than 15 years she has worked alongside her husband doing agricultural tasks such as producing cocoa and other products which are profitable in her region.  For the day-to-day work she frequently draws on help from local workers whom she pays for complicated jobs such as removing weeds and fruit-picking at harvest time.  She usually has enough money to be able to work in each production cycle without any problems in buying organic manure to fertilise her farmland and increase her production.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial help she receives which will enable her to make progress.  Furthermore, she guarantees that she will make her repayments punctually.  On this occasion, she would like to have 2,000 nuevos soles to maintain her 2 hectare plot by buying organic manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 45 years old and comes from Olkalou. She is married to Peter who is a civil servant, and they are blessed with six children aged 26, 24, 22, 18,13 and 9 years old.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last 13 years, and to enable her to buy some chickens and goats for rearing, she has applied for her fifth loan of Kshs. 30,000 from Kadet Ltd. 

Right now her monthly income from her business is Kshs. 20,000 and she has plans of using profits realized from her expanded business to buy a dairy cow and to pay her loan back to Kadet Ltd.

In the future, she hopes to be a very successful farmer in her town.

loans.use: To buy chickens and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 40 years old, a married woman and the mother of four children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.That will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a very hardworking man from Olkalou. He is 42 years old, married to Ann and they are blessed with four children aged 18, 14, 10 and 7 years old. All are in school.

He is a farmer who grows maize, potatoes, carrots and wheat, a business he has been running for the last ten years. He has applied for his third loan of Kshs. 50,000 from Kadet Ltd which will be used to buy a dairy cow.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 15,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd.

He hopes for a brighter future for his business and family

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 29 years old and comes from Nakuru. She is married to Paul who is a businessman and they are blessed with two children aged 7 and 4 years old.

She is a cereals seller, a business she has been running for the last four years. To enable her to buy more stocks of dried maize, beans, rice and wheat to sell to her customers, she has applied for her fourth loan of Kshs. 100,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is Kshs. 55,000 and she intends to use profits from her expanded business to buy more stock and to pay back her loan to Kadet Ltd.

She hopes to own one of the biggest and best-stocked cereals shops in her region in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of cereals, e.g., dried maize, beans, rice and wheat, to sell to her customers

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 25 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is not married yet but he financially supports his parents and siblings.

He is in the motorcycle transport business which he has been running for the last four years. To enable him to buy another motorcycle for increased income, he has applied for his first loan of Kshs. 96,500 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 30,000 and his plan is to use profits from his expanded business to start another business and to educate his siblings and pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd.

He hopes to buy a motorized rickshaw in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 53 years old and comes from Olkalou. He is married to Francisia and they are blessed with three children aged 17, 14 and 10, who are schooling.

He is a farmer who grows food crops as well as doing dairy farming. He has been running this business for the last 13 years and to enable him to buy a dairy cow to add to his herd, he has applied for his third loan of Kshs. 60,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 20,000 and he hopes to use profits from his expanded business to pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd and to educate his children.

He hopes to buy more land so as to expand his farming activities in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 24 years old and comes from Olkalou. He is not married and he supports his parents and siblings.

He is a farmer who mainly specializes in potato farming, a business he has carried out for the last six years.

John has applied for his fifth loan of Kshs.80,000 from Kadet Ltd which will be used to buy some fertilizers for his crops for high yields.

He intends to use profits realized from his expanded business to buy a dairy cow. He has hopes and dreams of becoming the most successful farmer in his region.

loans.use: To buy some fertilizer for his potatoes in the farm.

loans.name: Rostom

texts.en:
Rostom is a 53-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village of Sachkhere district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three cows. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, they have 0.8 hectare of agricultural land, where maize is grown. 

Rostom is a very hard-working man and always has high quality produce, which is sold to local retailers. Rostom decided to start up a family business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 4000 Gel for purchasing cattle. When the cattle is purchased, he will begin trade and will resell them at a good price. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to begin to trade in cattle

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 25-year-old married Palestinian woman who has been working as a hairdresser for 10 years. Rania started working to help her parents make their living and cover their expenses, since most Palestinian refugees have limited access to most working sectors in Lebanon.

In 2006, Rania opened her own beauty salon; her experience in this field attracted new customers and increased her income. She is now requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new items, wax machines, etc.

Rania is working hard to expand her enterprise by opening a specialized facial beauty sector.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with new items, wax machines, etc.

loans.name: Marwat

texts.en:
Marwat is 49 years old and a hard-working woman. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and three children. All of her children are studying in school. Her husband owns a small leather goods shop. He stitches leather goods and sells them in the market.

Marwat has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase leather, rexine, zippers and threads for sewing bags. This is very important to her husband so that he can continue his business. 

As a result of that, they can increase their monthly income as well as putting aside savings. Marwat dreams of higher education for her children. She is very much thankful to KIVA for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase leather and rexine for sewing bags, as well as zippers and thread.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old married father of three children. He has been working in selling shoes for 16 years. In 2006, he opened his current shop and is working hard to develop it and increase its capital.

His friend provided him with the necessary experience at the beginning, then he became skilled in this domain.

Ali is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with a new winter collection and to be ready for the Christmas celebrations. This will be his forth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good paying back history.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with a new winter collection.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as humble, patient and ambitious. She operates a retail shop and rental houses to earn a living. She describes her biggest business challenge as competition and late repayments by clients. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy an energy saving jiko for cooking at home. This will benefit four family members. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business and provide good education to her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy an energy saving jiko.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21 years old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Mohammad's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family needs. 

Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies public relations. He would like to finish his study and find a job in the future.

Mohammad took  a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to do his research and also his homework.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 25 years old and is from Nakuru. He is married and his spouse is a business lady who operates a general shop where she sells clothes, utensils, shoes, etc. They are blessed with one child, aged 2 years. 

He owns a motorcycle that he uses to transport his customers and he also co-owns the general shop with his wife. This is what has prompted him to apply for his second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd., so as to enable him to buy more stock to sell to customers.

Their monthly income right now from the shop, which has been in operation for the past five years, is KES 10,000, and he intends to use profits from his expanded business to buy a farm and indulge in production of vegetables.

He hopes to open a wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To add stock like clothes, utensils, shoes, etc. to his shop.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 22-year-old single man, who lives in the village of Chandari with his parents, brother and retired grandmother. David and his brother work at the local bakery and make pastry. Their mother is employed at the hospital as a nurse and gets a small monthly salary. David and his family members work hard all day long to earn their living, but their existing income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses. That is why David and his father decided to start their own business. 

David applied for credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved under the startup loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $5,000 will help David to purchase a minibus. His father will work on the minibus line as he is an experienced driver and jobless at the moment. He will transport passengers from his district to nearby Telavi. The new business initiative will significantly increase the family funds. With the increased income, the family will be able to increase their daily spending and improve their living standard in future.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married and has five children who still attend school. This is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mupa has been cooking and selling food in a hotel for the past one year, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 2 bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in their society.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gulsana

texts.ru: Гульсане 57 лет, вдова, одна воспитывает сына. У Гульсаны - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульсана занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульсаны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульсана обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульсана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Gulsana is 57 years old and is raising one son. She has a high school education. 

Her main income for the family comes from raising livestock. She started this business seven years ago with 15,000 KGS. Due to her hard work, she now has one dairy cow and four sheep. 

Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. To improve her household income, she is taking a loan of 30,000 KGS from Bai-Tushum and Partners micro-finance bank to buy a cow for breeding cattle. Gulsana plans to use the profits to further invest in her herd.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Asilkan

texts.ru: Асилкан 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 внука, дети все женаты проживают отдельно. У Асилкан - средне-специальное образование, в настоящий момент работает медсестрой в роддоме. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Асилкан занимается полеводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Асилкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2,16 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асилкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Асилкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Asilkan is 54 years old and married with one grandchild. Their children are all married and living independently. Asilkan has a high school education. She is working as a nurse in the hospital. To earn additional income for her family, she started farming three years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. Due to her hard work, she now has a 2.16-hectare plot where she grows potatoes and barley. 

Her monthly income is 25,000 KGS. To support her household goals, she is taking a loan of 65,000 KGS from Bai-Tuchum and Partners to buy a cow for cattle breeding. With the profits Asilkan will further invest in cattle and pay for renovations to her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 41, lives with his wife, two children and parents in the small village of Sachkhere district. His parents are provided with a retirement pension, while David's wife is a geography teacher at a local school, earning 250 Gel per month. David works as a security guard locally. 

The family has a cow, two buffalo and three calves from which they produce cheese to sell. In addition, they own a small vineyard and a 0.5 hectare plot of land upon which they grow maize and haricots which are eaten by the family.

David decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3000 toward purchasing a minibus which will allow him to work on a local minibus line and have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work on a minibus line

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 20 years old and single. He lives in the village of Kondoli with his parents and retired grandfather. David is a university student who goes to Telavi University, located in a neighboring town. He doesn't have his own source of income and depends on his parents. David’s father works as a driver at the local transportation company and his mother is a laboratory assistant at the university. Their modest earnings are hardly enough to cover their daily expenses and David’s tuition fees as well. That is the reason that he decided to start his own business. 

David is requesting a loan to start a car wash. He will purchase essential equipment including a vacuum cleaner. David’s loan falls under the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that envisions providing start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the vulnerable poor who do not have access to many credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. David will provide services to local community members and hopes to increase his family’s monthly income. His new business initiative will significantly improve his family’s funds and give him the chance to be financially independent.

loans.use: to start a car wash

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman without children. For years, she has operated a food stall business and sells items from home to her neighbors and passersby. Umazi’s major business challenge is price fluctuation. She lives in her own house without electricity or running water. Umazi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Umazi is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. In the future, she dreams of establishing a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Asalia

texts.en:
Asalia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Asalia has been working hard to manage her silver fish business. 

To help expand her business, Asalia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add fish stock and will help Asalia to generate greater profits. It will also supplement her siblings school fees. Asalia hopes that in the future she will be able to sell charcoal as her side income. 

Asalia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add fish stock.

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en:
Zahi is a 41-year-old married father of two children. He has worked as a taxi driver since 2000. It is his only business and that's why he has to work hard to develop it -- to make sure it will provide him with a good encouraging income. 

Zahi is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to do necessary maintenance for his car. This loan will be invested in fixing his car's gear box.

He hopes that one day he'll be financially capable of buying a new car to replace the current old one. That would attract new customers and develop his living.

loans.use: To fix his car's gear box.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old and married to Sarah, who is a businesswoman. The couple is from Nakuru and blessed with four children ages six, 10, 14 and 16. For the past eight years, David has been a charcoal vender who makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

David is requesting a 22,000 KES loan through KADET LTD to purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell to meet his increasing customer demand. This will be his second loan from KADET. David will use the anticipated profit from his loan to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes and dreams of a prosperous future in business and family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rezeq

texts.en:
Rezeq is 23 years old and a single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. For the past eight years, Rezeq has been selling construction materials. This is a good business that has good market demand.
 
Rezeq is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to buy more construction materials to sell to develop his store. His loan will increase his sales and income. Rezeq appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 44 years old and married to Maria. The couple is blessed with three children ages one, four, and eight. Samuel is from Nakuru. For the last 13 years, he has been a butcher and his monthly income right now is 20,000 KES. 

Samuel is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to buy some goats to slaughter and sell the meat to his customers. This will be his second loan. Samuel is planning to use the anticipated profit from his loan to educate his children and repay his loan. In the future, he hopes to expand into animal sales.

loans.use: to buy some goats for slaughter

loans.name: Kalidou

texts.fr: Monsieur Kalidou lui  est producteur agricole de profession. Il a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans son activité. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer  vers les coups de 20h. Disposant d’un périmètre agricole  Kalidou a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des semences d’oignon et des intrants agricoles. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de la maison et celle des enfants. Il habite dans les environs du guichet dans un village de maraichage. A l’avenir Kalidou voudrait exploiter d’autres périmètres  agricoles afin de diversifier son production et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Kalidou is a cultivator by trade. He has more than 25 years of experience in this business. He starts his days at 8 a.m. and finishes it at 8 p.m. He owns some land and, at this time, he needs this loan to buy onion seeds and agricultural inputs.

He covers the daily expenses of his household, and those of the children. He lives in a farming village, close to the MFI's office. In the future, he would like to cultivate more land in order to diversify his production and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 25 years old, married to John, and they have been blessed with one child of 1 year old.

She sells mitumba (plastic wrapped packages of used clothes) and she has been in business for two years. Right now her monthly income is KSH 26,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 50,000 in order more purchase more stock of clothes. She plans to expand her business with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her first loan and her hopes are to prosper in business and her family too.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 24-year-old man. He is married to Jane and is a father of one child who is 2 years old. David has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years and is making a monthly income of KES 12,000.

David learned about KADET from fellow riders who are already being funded by KADET. He has been advanced a first loan of KES 87,880 which will assist him to buy his own motorcycle. He is likely to earn more as he has already capitalized on transportation of farm produce for the women in the market.

He will use the proceeds to repay the loan as well as meet his young family's basic needs. He hopes to diversify into crop farming with the savings of the business.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, married and supports a family of four people. She has a grocery shop. She has been in business for 20 years and right now her monthly income from the business is KES 12,500.

Jane is borrowing a loan of KES 60,000 which she intends to use to purchase more cereals for her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to improve her business. This her third loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: to add more cereals to her shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old. She is from Nakuru. She is married and her spouse earns some additional income for the family. They are blessed with two children aged 24 and 22 years old.

Jane owns a clothing shop where she deals in children's wears, ladies' wear and all types of handbags. She has been running this business for the past 33 years. To enable her to add more stocks in her shop to sell to her customers, she has applied for her third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET.

Her monthly income right now is KES 20,000 and her intention is to buy more stocks for her business with the profits realized from her expanded business so as to have enough stock to sell to her customers during the festive season that is approaching.

She hopes to own the biggest clothing shop in her town in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of new clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of bowls and utensils.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante Al Progreso Group

texts.en:
Marina is the coordinator of her group Con Dios Adelante al Progreso ("Forward Progress with God"). The group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugarcane fields. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She is a single mother. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them. 

Marina is excited to be seeking her 10th loan with Esperanza. She started doing business almost nine years ago, at first walking with a bag of clothing, cosmetics and shoes. Now after taking out some loans, she has increased her sales and has run other businesses, like selling chickens in her community. 

Marina plans to use this loan to invest in her business, and she will continuing selling live chickens for her neighbors' daily meals. She will also increase her inventory by buying miscellaneous items like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc. She will use her business profits to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products (clothing, shoes, cosmetics) and meat to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pots for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Leocadia is one of the members of the group Caminando Hacia el Progreso (Walking to the Future) 1 & 7. This group is located in a rural community surrounded by sugarcane fields on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris, where the group's members sell various products like food, clothes, shoes, etc.

Leocadia makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. For the past six years she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall where, in addition to fruits and vegetables, she sells meat, charcoal, etc. She started her business with her own savings.

Leocadia is excited to be a part of this loan, her 11th with Esperanza, after having repaid her previous loan portions and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business inventory by buying plantains, onions, cassava, bananas, oranges, chickens, coriander, greens products, etc.

Leocadia says that her most difficult challenges are improving her business and helping her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a very hardworking lady from Nakuru. She is a single mother of a 17 year old and and twins of 12 years.

She has a business of selling new clothes, which she has been running for the last 10 years. Her monthly income right now is KES 100,000.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd., which will be used for buying more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers.

Her intention is to use the profits realized from her expanded business to educate her children, buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers and pay back her loan to KADET Ltd.

Her hopes for the future are to be successful and for her family to be happy and prosperous.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Naivasha area of Kenya, which lies in the Rift Valley, east of Nairobi. He owns a tree nursery that he has been running for three years. He is married and has five children.

Patrick will use both the loan and the anticipated profits to purchase more seeds for his nursery. He has a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan shillings. He repaid his previous loan and has now applied for a new loan which was approved.

His dream is to own the biggest tree nursery in Naivasha.

Note: Kadet used a tablet to create this borrower's profile, which reduces paper consumption, and makes their operations more efficient, thus reducing costs.

loans.use: To buy more tree seedlings.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 35-year-old lady who is married to George. Together, they have three children. For the past eight years, Grace has been a dairy farmer in Kiambaa, in the outskirts of Limuru. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Grace is requesting a loan to by a cow. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. In the future, Grace wants to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 48-year-old lady who is married and a mother of five children who are all in school. For the past three years, she has run a general shop in Limuru. Annah’s monthly income is 1,400 KES. 

Annah is requesting a loan with KADET LTD to buy items such as cooking oil, milk, sugar, rice, and other products for her store. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. In the future, Annah wants to educate her children and also open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, milk, sugar, rice, and other products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old and married. They are blessed with six children who are all adults.

Elizabeth owns a private primary school in Ndunyu Njeru which she has been running for thirteen years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to buy building materials to add more classes. With the anticipated profit, she plans to boost her business and provide scholarships.

In the near future, she hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet to improve her school and her students' livelihood.

loans.use: To buy building materials to expand her school.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 37-year-old lady who is married and a mother of two children. For the past six years, she has been a farmer in Limuru. Mary earns a monthly income of 13,800 KES. 

Mary is requesting a loan from KADET LTD to buy a calf and use some money to repair her calf shed. This will be her first loan with KADET. In future, Mary wants to own more cows and supply her whole village with milk. She also wants to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a calf and repair her calf shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a table, an iron and a chair.

loans.name: Eglal Group

texts.en:
Eglal group consists of three ladies from Taiz, Yemen. Each member has their own type of business. They have requested a group loan of YER 180,000 and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. 

Eyman is 29 years old. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. The income of her husband is not enough to cover living expenses and the rent of their house, so she decided to apply for a YER 60,000 loan from AMB to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Kanuma Group

texts.fr:
Misigaro fait partie du groupe  Kanuma et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 41 ans est marié à Violette. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 1 à 12 ans, dont 2 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de chèvres   depuis 19 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup chèvres  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait avoir 3 points de vente et voir les enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Misigaro is a member of Kanuma Group and lives in Bubanza. He's 41 years old and married to Violette. Together, they have four children, aged 1 to 12. Out of them, two go to school.

Misigaro has been selling goats for nineteen years. This is his first loan with Kiva's partner, Turame. He will use it to increase his working capital and buy many goats, in order to earn more.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to have three points of sale and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy many goats

loans.name: Gordana

texts.en:
Gordana is a 60-year-old married woman living only with her husband in the southern part of Kosovo in a minority community. Her children are married. 

Based on tradition, Gordana and her husband work together in an agricultural business by cultivating their land and by owning a cow. This provides for the family needs as well as an income from selling the fresh milk to a local dairy farm and other dairy products for the area.
 
Lately, they have been fortunate enough to have demand from the neighborhood for their milk and products and have been able to make a good living and profit in this manner. In order to generate even more income, she is requesting a loan to increase the amount of cows she owns and continue to keep multiplying their cows, business and profit. She is aware that without KosInvest/Kiva's support, her goal would be difficult to achieve. She really appreciates the support from the lenders.

loans.use: To buy another cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pots for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory of infant clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase kerosene for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 19 years old and has one child who is currently in school. She lives in the town of Kaliro, in Uganda. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

Sarah is requesting a 450,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to stock more clothes to sell. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and help her to buy iron sheets to complete her house. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bank account and start saving some money. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory of soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pots for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase salt for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of fish.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is a hardworking woman who is doing her best to support her family. She is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy weaving materials and palm leaves for her business. Chizi appreciates the support from Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials and palm leaves for her business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она одна воспитывает своего единственного сына, которому 17 лет. Гулбахор более 5 лет работает в местной больнице. Она работает заведующим отделом кадров. Гулбахор трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому выполняет свою функцию отлично. Гулбахору очень тяжело справляться с семейными расходами. Она хочет отправить сына в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы он там зарабатывал деньги и помогал ей по обеспечению семьи. Гулбахор запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a cheerful woman. She is 45 years old and has a 17 year old son. Gulbahor has worked in the personnel department of a local hospital for more than five years. She is a hard-working woman and does her job well. She does her best to handle all of the family's expenses. She wants to send her son to Russia so that he can earn money there and help her support the family. Gulbahor has asked for a loan of 2000 somoni to buy the plane ticket for her son. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a plane ticket for her son

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en:
Kupha is a mother who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a mat business at the market, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase weaving materials: palm leaves and needles. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials: palm leaves and needles.

loans.name: Tauilo

texts.en: Tauilo is a 38-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tauilo has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a spade, a wheelbarrow, and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Tauilo hopes to improve and expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a spade, a wheelbarrow, and a crowbar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current stock of pastries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and fish, boosting her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stocks of cookware.

loans.name: Ma Auxiliadira

texts.es:
Doña Auxiliadora tiene 37 años de edad una mujer muy luchadora y con muchos sueños e ideales en la vida, ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y estudian en una escuela de la comunidad viviendo en su casa de habitación su esposo, sus 4 hijos ella y una hermana. Ella cuanta con la primaria incompleta que no pudo terminar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres a quien ellas agradece el esfuerzo y el apoyo brindado mientras ella estudio. Doña Auxiliadora se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de papa desde hace muchos años ya que en su juventud no solo la educaron con principios y valores sino también a ver el valor del trabajo siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra. Sus cultivos están ubicados muy cerca de su casa de habitación a los cuales se trasladan a pie en compañía de su esposo siendo ellos 2 los únicos involucrados.
Sus metas y sus sueños es forjar un patrimonio fuerte poder comprar un lote de tierra el cual sirva como medio de ingresos y en un futuro como patrimonio para sus hijos y los futuros venideros para que tengan donde trabajar, donde construir sus hogares y poder generar ingresos para sus familias. Por lo que hoy en día está solicitando un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos como, foliares, abono, fertilizantes, semilla certificada de papa entre otros para poder asistir y sembrar nuevos cultivos.
texts.en:
Doña Auxiliadora is 37 years old. She is a very feisty woman with many dreams and ideals in life. She is the mother of four minor children who are attneding a school in the community. She, her husband, her four children and her sister live together.

She was unable to complete primary school due to the lack of economic support from her parents, to whom she is grateful for the help they did provide while she attended school.

Doña Auxiliadora has made a living planting and cultivating potatoes for many years because her parents not only taught her principles and values in her youth but also the value of work. It was they who taught her how to work the land. 

Her crops are located very close to her house. That is where she travels on foot accompanied by her husband, the two of them being the only ones involved.

Her goals and dreams are to build wealth so they can buy a plot of land which will serve as a means of income and in the future as a legacy for her children and their descendants. Thus they will have a place to work, build their homes and generate income for their families. So, today she is requesting financing in order to purchase supplies, such as foliar fertilizers, compost, manure and certified seed potatoes, among other items, so that she can take care of and plant new crops.

loans.use: to purchase certified seed potatoes and farming supplies to plant and care for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, seed potatoes and certified corn for cultivation.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady est une promotrice qui habite à notto. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce de poissons frais, elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans son activité. Métrisant bien son activité, ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter son fond de roulement pour satisfaire sa forte demande. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui soutienne son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Khady commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 14h. A l’avenir elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady is an entrepreneure who lives in Notto. She sells fresh fish, and she has over 10 years of experience in this activity. 

She has a good command of her activity and expects that this credit will help to bolster her working capital to satisfy high demands from her customers. 

She is married with children, and she supports her husband with the management of the household’s daily expenditures.

Khady works from 8 AM until 2 PM. 

For the future, she hopes to boost her income in order to be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale at the market.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She owns and operates a small fishing supply store and for many years has been selling items such as fishing gear and goggles. Ana needs a loan to buy more fishing gear, googles, spears, life jackets and coolers. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, googles, spears, life jackets and coolers

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 41 years old and lives with her husband and her five children, who still depend on her income and care. Srey’s main business is farming as she  learned to work the land from her parents and other older people. It’s the most important source of income for her family and she has been involved in this business for almost 15 years with the support of her husband and children.

Srey has had four loans already prior to this loan. She mentioned that the previous loans really helped her to improve her business and their living conditions. As her house is under construction, Srey will use the new loan to buy building supplies to complete the unfinished parts of her house. She will also use a small portion of the loan to buy fishing nets for her husband's fishing activities. Srey and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful for their support.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to complete the unfinished parts of her house.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is dreaming of finishing his studies and having a successful career. In his determination and trust, he always finds ways to help his parents find solutions financially. His farmer is a farmer, and he has four siblings who need parental support, too.

Elmer is studying  BS - Information Technology at Misamis University in Oroquieta City.  He joined GDMPC and obtained an education loan offered to students. PHP 10,000 will help Elmer to cover the costs of the courses required in this semester. 

He is thankful that God helps him find ways. In the future, Elmer wants to support his siblings and the entire family to improve their living.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his courses this semester

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Cette femme habite aux environs du guichet et son activité principale est l’achat et la vente des légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans cette activité. Elle s’appelle DABA, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle aide son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. DABA demande ce crédit d’un montant de 50.000F pour acheter des légumes et les revendre en suite.  Elle commence sa journée à 9h du matin pour la terminer à 13h de l’après-midi. Elle souhaite à l’avenir développer son activité afin d’augmenter ses revenus et pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman lives near the local U-IMCEC branch. Her main activity is buying and selling vegetables. She has over 15 years of experience in this activity. 

Her name is DABA, and she is married with children. She helps her husband with the household’s daily expenditures and the children’s tuition fees. 

DABA is seeking a loan of 50,000F to buy vegetables for resale. She works from 9 AM until 1 PM. 

In the long term, she wants to expand her activity in order to bolster her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a soldering machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale at her bar

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 24 years old, partnered, and has two children. She runs a small business selling meat pies in her community, which she has been doing for four years. 

Emma is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy chickens, onions, large pot, soy sauce, garlic, and gas burner. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Emma will help with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, onions, large pot,soy sauce, garlic, and gas burner

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo tiene 66 años, está casado con Luciana y tiene el orgullo de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos hasta ser mayores, excepto su pequeña Sulma de 11 años que vive junto a el y su esposa en su casa hecha de abobe.Es un agricultor muy conocido en su zona por los años que vive en su comunidad y la labor que desempeña. Creció desde muy niño junto a sus padres con la agricultura ya que fue el principal sustento económico desde sus abuelos. Tiene mas de 50 años de experiencia en su labor y a contado desde siempre con el apoyo de su esposo con quien tiene toda una vida de trabajo y dedicación por el bienestar de su familia.
Actualmente continúa con la producción de cacao, barbasco, palillo y árboles frutales como el plátano y cocos.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está primera oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para invertir en sus terrenos con la compra de plantas de almácigo para reemplazar varios árboles de cacao que están malogrados y adquirir sacos de abono orgánico para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 66 years old and is married to Luciana. He is proud to have provided for his children until they were adults, apart from his young daughter Sulma who is 11 years old and lives with him and his wife in their adobe house. As a farmer he is well known in the area for the work he does and because he has lived in the community for many years. He grew up with agriculture from a very young age alongside his parents, since it was the main source of income from his grandparents. He has more than 50 years' experience in this work and has always had the support of his wife with whom he has worked and dedicated his life to the wellbeing of his family. Currently he is growing cocoa, barbasco, turmeric and fruit trees such as banana and coconut. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support he is getting to make progress in life. He also promises to pay his loan instalments punctually. On this first occasion he wants 2,000 nuevo soles to invest in his land by buying seedlings so he can replace several cocoa bushes which are in poor condition and he also wants to buy bags of organic manure to improve his crop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 25 years old and ahs a degree in business information systems. He is passionate about IT, especially new technology and he is always eager and excited to learn and use new developments in IT.

He has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for the internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable him to gain skills and experience in IT, which will help him get a job.

In 5 or 10 years he sees himself as a consultant helping young businesses and entrepreneurs in his community implement IT to better their businesses and ideas. He feels that young people are very talented and have great ideas on how to better themselves. The greatest challenge he has faced is getting the right education that is suited for todays market. He hopes that he will get the necessary skills to enable him be a success.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Amka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Emile est une présidente du collectif de crédit « Amka », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans  et mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous.  Son conjoint un médecin vétérinaire de la division publique. La cliente est  une vendeuse de viande.  Elle installe ses marchandises  dans une boucherie au coté du marché public, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 7 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 quartiers de vaches et 2 porcs. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une charcuterie moderne. Les insécurités dans les zones d’élevages, les menaces de fermiers par les inciviques, le manque de froid, les impayés, les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Emile, is a president of the loan collective "Amka". She is a senior entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 45 years old, and a mother of ten children, all students. Her husband is a veterinarian in the public sector. This client sells meat. She sets up in a butcher shop next to the public market and sometimes at home. She started her business with her husband's assistance. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for seven years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 2 quarters of beef and 2 pigs. Thus, she would like to provide education to her children, expand her business plans, and build a modern delicatessen. The challenges of developing her business include lack of safety in livestock farming areas, farmer threats, lack of refrigeration, outstanding payments, and exchange losses. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase cows and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Sarorn is 56 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food for more than ten years, earning approximately $15 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $11 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sarorn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 41 years old and the loving mother of three school-aged children. She lives with her family in a thatched house located in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. Like other villagers, Neang is in the business of farming rice. She owns a few pieces of farmland for rice cultivation and is able to make a decent income of KHR 30,000 per day. Aside from the farming source of income, Neang is granted another source from her husband, who is involved in fishing.

As the old boat needs to be fixed and she has insufficient money to buy a new boat motor, she decided to take out a loan in the sum of KHR 2,000,000 from HKL, one of Kiva's field partners. This purchase will make their fishing business more sustainable and productive. Neang and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to fix their boat and buy a new boat motor.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Babacar, âgé de 40 ans, est tailleur depuis plus de 10 ans déjà, malheureusement, il n’a pas encore eu la possibilité de travailler avec ses propres moyens. Pour pallier a cela, il s’est rapproché de l’IMCEC pour recevoir un appui financier et pouvoir acheter une cantine et y pratiquer son activité.
Babacar est un homme marié, père de trois enfants dont il a la charge de nourrir et de scolariser. Et c’est grâce aux revenus de son activité, qu’il peut améliorer leurs conditions alimentaires et épargner. Babacar coud des ensembles qu’il expose et revend, il a donc besoin d’agrandir son activité pour produire plus, se faire connaitre et maximiser son profit. C’est là son plus grand rêve, détenir une grande unité de production.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar, age 40, has been a tailor for over 10 years already. Unfortunately, he is still unable to support this business himself. To remedy this problem, he turned to the IMCEC to get a loan that will enable him to buy a shop where he can practice his activity. 

Babacar is married with 3 dependent children. He provides for their needs and their education. He is counting on the income earned through his activity to improve their living conditions and save some money.
