Babacar makes clothes that he displays and sells, and he needs to expand his activity to bolster production, become better known and maximize his profits. His greatest dream is to run a large production facility.

loans.use: to buy a space that he can turn into a sewing shop.

loans.name: Matamoros Group

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene la edad de 52 años, solo estudio la primaria y está soltera, ella es otro de los integrantes del grupo Matamoros. 
Ella platica que desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar para salir adelante y durante 24 años se ha dedicado al comercio vendiendo de todo un poco para ganarse la vida ella dijo “yo nunca le he tenido miedo al trabajo  y no me gusta estar sin hacer nada siempre busco la manera de hacer mis ventas para ganar mi dinero” 
Ella actualmente se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, ropa y perfumería, sus ventas de antojitos las hace a diario  desde su hogar, un día antes levanta pedidos y al siguiente sala a entregarlos, ella trabaja como cocinera en un pequeño restauran de su comunidad y ahí aprovecha para ofrecer con sus compañeras de trabajo y clientes su ropa y perfumería, también por la tardes sale a ofrecer sus productos casa por casa y como ya es conocida en ocasiones le hacen pedidos y ella los surte, Narcisa es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 
Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudará a comprar variedad de perfumes, ropa (camisa, blusas, playeras, pantalones, vestidos, short, faldas y ropa interior) y aceite, frijoles, tortillas, crema, queso, lechuga, carne de pollo y res, chiles, papas, cebollas, tomates y ajos para la preparación de sus antojitos.

Ella espera que su negocio continúe progresando y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
 
Marisol venta de refrescos,
Berenice estética, 
Ignacia venta de comida,
Ysidra venta de abarrotes, 
Aeropajita venta de lencería,
Rosa Aurora venta de comida,
Rosa venta de refrescos,
Domingo venta de calzado,
Nelly sastrería.
texts.en:
52-year old Narcisa is single and has only primary education. She is one of the members of the Matamoros group. Ever since she was a young girl she has been in business selling a little of everything to make a living. She notes, 'I have never been afraid of work. I don't like having nothing to do, and I'm always looking for ways to earn money.'

Currently Narcisa sells Mexican food, clothing, and perfume. The snacks she makes daily in her house according to the orders she has from the previous day, and then delivers them. She works as a cook in a small local restaurant so can use the opportunity to sell clothing and perfume to her work mates and customers. In the afternoons she sells the products door to door and as she is well known, this sometimes results in orders too. Narcisa is a very enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.

A loan from Kiva and VisionFund will help her buy a variety of perfumes, clothing (shirts, blouses, t-shirts, pants, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear) as well as oil, beans, tortillas, mayo, cheese, lettuce, chicken, beef, chilies, potatoes, onion, tomatoes, and garlic-- the ingredients for the dishes she makes.

Narcisa hopes that her business will continue to prosper so she can improve her standard of living.

The other members of the group are:
Marisol (soft drink sales)
Berenice (beauty salon)
Ignacio (food sales)
Ysidra (corner store)
Aeropajita (lingerie sales)
Rosa Aurora (food sales)
Domingo (footwear sales)
Nelly (seamstress)

loans.use: Buy perfume, clothing, and ingredients for the Mexican food she makes

loans.name: Erika Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Erika es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos clasificados desde hace 5 años y tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Doña Erika necesita el préstamo para la compra de sandalias, blusas, pantalones, camisetas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le es de mucha ayuda, con el préstamo espera incrementar la cantidad de productos de su negocio logrando así que sus ventas aumenten.
Doña Erika espera que gracias al esta inversión poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. Ella espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hijo tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Erika is a very hard working and responsible person. She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. For 5 years she has had a business selling second hand clothing and shoes and runs this from her home in the town where she lives. Erika needs the loan to buy sandals, blouses, trousers, shirts etc. so she can carry on with her work which is a great help to her.

With the loan she hopes to increase the quantity of products in her business and so increase her sales. She hopes that with the help of this loan she will be able to improve her own and her family's quality of life a little with the increase in household income. In the short term she hopes to grow her business so she can continue to support her family and so her children can have the necessary education to have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy sandals, blouses, trousers, shirts etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en: Cherly wants to be an accountant in the future. She is studying for a  BS in Accountancy at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. She has four siblings and her father earns their living through farming. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to cover the costs of school materials for the second semester. In the future, Cherly wants to finish her studies and be able to find a job related to her course.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school materials

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is married and has four children. She operates a general store in the Philippines.

Nita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 1,800 PHP, which she will use to buy a solar lamp so that she can provide her children with bright light when they study at night. Nita is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for machine maintenance and buy other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay coffee pickers.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta  is a 49-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Jacinta has requested a loan to buy an over-lock sewing machine, thread, needles, and materials. She plans to use her profits to help her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy an over-lock sewing machine, thread, needles, and materials

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa is 46 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning $3 a day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $1 a day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $9 each a day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Channa is requesting a loan for $350, which she will use to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, Channa would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn their bachelor’s degrees. She also wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a 55-year-old married woman with six children. She has a huge plantation that covers eight acres of land where she grows taro, bananas, yams and kasava (sweet potatoes) to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years, and is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and a chain saw.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. With her profits, Mele hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, fertilizer and a chain saw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is studying Information Technology for a BS at the university in Oroquieta City. Her father earns from employment as a welder while her mother has a buying and selling business. 

This semester, Edna needs financial assistance to  pay school tuition fees for the second semester. She borrowed from the GDMPC education loan product and she is thankful that her needs were settled. In the future, she wants to be successful in her career and able to help her family.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame Astou  est une femme qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans le commerce de  légumes. Astou a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 13h30mn. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et ensuite vendre les légumes dans un marché de la commune. Astou aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Astou quitte sa maison à 9h pour y revenir dans l’après midi vers les environs de 13h 30mn. A l’avenir elle voudrait diversifier son activité en exploitant son ferme agricole, ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en: Ms. Astou is a married mother with a family. She does commerce in vegetables and has over fifteen years of experience in this business. She starts her day at 9 AM and finishes at 1:30 PM. She is requesting this amount of money to purchase and then sell vegetables at a commune market. Astou helps her husband in managing day-to-day family expenses and the children's schooling costs. For the future, she would like to diversify her business by making use of her farm. Thus, she will be able to increase her revenues and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items and products for her variety store. She had this store for seven years now, and it continues to grow. Her income from the business supported their everyday needs at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merly hopes that her business will last longer, and dreams to give her children a good future. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps to learn a lot from the Bible. The Word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She has been able to grow her dogs well and the profit was good. The loan also helped in the education of her children who are all in grade school. Her income from the business supported their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy dog food and pay for their grooming. Her profits from business will definitely help her support her family's everyday needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rona hopes that she can maintain her business and dreams of giving her family a better living. She attends the weekly fellowship group* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only with God but also with her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy dog food and pay for their grooming.

loans.name: Procy

texts.en:
Procy is 61 years old and married with eight children.

Procy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

Procy has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Procy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Jocelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising water buffalo in the Philippines. Elenita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional water buffalo to raise.

Elenita has been raising water buffalo for 6 years, and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional water buffalo to raise.

loans.name: Urufunguruzo Group

texts.fr:
Emile  fait partie du groupe  Urupfunguruzo et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 44 et est marié à Emelyne. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 6 à 10 ans,tous etudient.

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis  7 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait construire une maison, une moto pour son déplacement acheter  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Emile is part of the group Urupfunguruzo and lives in Bubanza. He is 44 years old and married to Emelyne. Together they have three children from 6 to 10 years old, all in school. 

Emile has been doing commerce in clothing for seven years. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to build a house, buy a motorbike as transportation, and sees his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally is 43 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animal for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a chef who earns about $5 daily. 

Due to the lack of funds, Phally is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen. This purchase will help provide a hygienic place for cooking. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Laihour

texts.en:
Laihour is 23 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband works as a soldier who earns about $3 per day.

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Laihour is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the family’s transportation expenses and help her husband easily go to work. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en: Tofu is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. She has a small taxi service business. She has been in business for five years. Tofu needs a loan to buy shocks, brake pads, brake fluid and seat covers. She will use her profits to help her children's education and provide for her family's daily needs. Tofu joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy shocks, brake pads, brake fluid and seat covers

loans.name: Vegie

texts.en:
Vegie is studying in Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City, taking his B.S. in Accountancy course. According to him, ambition is the path to success. His father is a farmer, and their income is good enough for their daily living with his three siblings. 

He joined GDMPC recently, and borrowed a loan to cover the costs for his school allowances for the semester. He is thankful to GDMPC for helping him to pursue his dream. In the future, Vegie wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for his school allowances for the semester.

loans.name: Gracia

texts.en: Gracia is a hardworking woman who is married and blessed with three children. She started a beauty and manicure shop in her home in 1996. She also has a farming business. Her goal is to improve her beauty salon, and to do this she is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy supplies, including nail polish and make up kits. She hopes that the loan she has requested will be granted because this will allow her to earn more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder es un hombre de 35 años, es soltero,vive en la ciudad de Chincha, el es muy trabajador,entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar,Wilder no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Wilder trabaja como operario en una empresa constructora de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Wilder se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar las paredes y el techado de su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura.
texts.en:
Wilder is a 35 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Chincha. He is very enthusiastic and hard-working. He dedicates all his efforts to getting ahead. Unfortunately due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work he was not able to study for a professional career.

On his own initiative Wilder works as a laborer in a construction company in his city. He works every day for 10 hours and feels that things are going well for him because of his good work and dedication.

Wilder is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they offer he will be able to undertake the improvements he needs on his house. He wants to re-enforce the walls and the roof of the house. He will continue to work and strive to attain his great dream which is to have a adequate and secure home.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house.

loans.name: Florame

texts.en:
Florame is 34 years old and married with seven children. With four children currently in school, Florame works very hard to provide for them.

Florame runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Florame has been in this business for 3 years, and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, sanitary napkins, noodles, sugar, etc. 

Florame would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Lilyn

texts.en:
Lilyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like chips, bread, eggs and canned goods for her general store business.

Lilyn has been in this business for one year. Lilyn earns additional income from fishing and selling charcoal.

Lilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.
.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like chips, bread, eggs and canned goods

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. Elvira is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Elvira has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Constancia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling rugs in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Constancia is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase more rugs to sell for her business.

Constancia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rugs to sell

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es: Yuri tiene 28 años, está casado con Luzmer y tiene una hija de 2 años. Vive conjuntamente con su familia en su casa de madera. Desde muy niño obtuvo los conocimientos de las diversas  actividades que desempeñaban sus padres para sustento de su familia como es la producción de cacao orgánico y otros productos propios de su zona. Esto lo motivo  con el paso de los años a usar lo aprendido como un rubro comercial de la producción gracias al apoyo de sus padres y como agradecimiento de haber brindado su trabajo desinteresadamente recibió como herencia una herencia un pequeño terreno de una hectárea  en donde se inició en la producción de  cacao orgánico luego obtuvo más terrenos en donde ha crecido satisfactoriamente. Tiene el firme apoyo de su pareja quien le apoya mucho en su trabajo haciendo de este una labor colectiva junto a los trabajadores que suele contratar para tareas complicadas. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está primera oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Yuri is 28 years old. He is married to Luzmer and has a two year old daughter.  He lives with his family in a house made out of wood. 

Since he was very young he learned the various activities that his parents carried out to support the family such as growing organic cocoa and other products typical to this area. With the passing of the years this motivated him to use what he had learned as a commercial enterprise. Thanks to his parents and as a reward for the years of disinterested work, he inherited a small plot of land, one hectare in size. On it he started to grow organic cocoa. Later he acquired more land to expand his workings. He has the full support of his wife who helps him a lot with the work, making it a collective labor along with the day labor they contract for the more difficult tasks. 

This is Yuri's first loan with Kiva. He is very pleased with the financial support he is receiving so that he can get ahead. He promises to pay his installments in a timely manner. In this first opportunity he would like 1000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Huon is 34 years old and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in a rural village in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She earns her income by farming and her husband works in the construction industry. As the family doesn't have its own motorcycle to support its transport needs, Huon’s husband has to pay for motor taxi every day in order to get to his workplace, and this increases their daily expenses. For this reason, she would like to borrow KHR 1,000,000 to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to use when commuting to work. This will help her reduce unwanted expenses and save money for any future emergencies the family may face. Huon and her family rely heavily on the good will of lenders and are very  thankful for their support.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Cirly May

texts.en: Cirly May is studying for a BS in Accounting at Stella Maris College in Oroquieta City. Her parents are teachers and they were able to support her in school. She had a passion to become an accountant in the future. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy school materials and textbooks. It is her idea to lessen the financial support from her parents. In the future, she wants to be a successful individual who is able to help her family and the community as well.

loans.use: to buy school materials and textbooks.

loans.name: Essa

texts.en:
Essa is 26 years old and married; he supports four members of his family. He runs a retail shop in Kamobo and is served by KADET Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the last six years. From this business he earns a monthly income of 100,000 KES.

Essa has borrowed 90,000 KES, which he will use to buy cooking fat, sugar and wheat flour. He will use the anticipated profits to pay his children's school fees and make loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is 39 years old and a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Floriana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Floriana requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Floriana has been in this business for 7 years. Floriana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a banana vending business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years now.

Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jedelyn

texts.en:
Jedelyn is a married woman with four children, two of whom are still in school. She is 25 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 5 years.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like meat, cooking oil, rice, etc. for her business. In the future, Jedelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like meat, cooking oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 40 years now. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu, aged 39 years, is a married woman and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past years, she has operated a milk-selling business. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Mariamu is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy gallons of milk for sale. She dreams of expanding to become a wholesale supplier of milk in the near future.

loans.use: to buy gallons of milk for sale.

loans.name: Soklang

texts.en: Soklang is 47 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband works in construction. He earns about $5 daily. Her children are garment workers. They make an income of $16 each day. Due to lack of funds, Soklang is requesting a loan of $1,500 USD to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her to provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and earn more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Nakry

texts.en: Nakry is 38 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than seven years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a security guard who makes an income of $4 daily. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $5 each day. In order to improve her family’s standard of living, Nakry is requesting a loan of $1,500 USD to purchase farmland. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to take another loan from KREDIT to build a new house and help her children earn higher educations.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 40 años, está casado con Clementina y tiene 5 hijos a quienes brinda lo mejor de si mismo.
Vive junto a su familia en su casa hecha con bloques de adobe. Es muy conocido en su zona por ser nieto de los fundadores de la comunidad donde reside. Nació y creció en el campo junto a sus padres quienes desde siempre se dedicaban a la agricultura y producción de productos que son considerados los mas rentables de su localidad como el cacao orgánico y palillo. Hace más de 20 años decidió independizarse de sus padres y con la llegada de su primer hijo optó por seguir de manera independiente con la labor que mejor sabía hacer.
Al ser un hijo muy trabajador y honrado recibió por parte de sus progenitores una parcela que le ayudó mucho a solventar los gastos de su familia. Actualmente cuenta con el firme apoyo de su esposa y sus hijos en tareas menores,Es el primer préstamo que solicta a Kiva y agradece por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir adelante. En está primera oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para comprar un pequeño terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 40 years old and married to Clementina. They have five children and try to provide the best for them. Guillermo lives with his family in a house made of adobe bricks. He is well-known in the area for being the grandson of the founders of the community where he lives. Guillermo was born and grew up in the countryside with his parents, who always made their living as farmers. His parents produced products that were considered to be the most profitable in their town, such as organic cacao and turmeric.

More than 20 years ago, Guillermo decided to become independent of his parents. When his first child was born, he continued to work independently in the trade that he knew the best. Being a hardworking and honest son, Guillermo received a parcel of land from his parents that has greatly helped him provide for his family's expenses. He currently has the solid support of his wife and children with the smaller tasks.

This is the first loan he is requesting from Kiva and he is grateful for the opportunity that he has received so that he can continue forward. He is taking this initial opportunity to request 3,000 PEN so that he can buy a small plot of farm land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farm land.

loans.name: Fulaupu

texts.en: Fulaupu is a 37-year-old partnered woman with 2 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. She has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, dripping oil, a gas burner and a large pot. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fulaupu will help with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, dripping oil, a gas burner and a large pot.

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta refrescos y cuajada, desde hace 10 años.
Doña María tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más refrescos y cuajadas para tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes que le visitan.
Doña María con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten de forma y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. Espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y también a su hijo para que tenga los estudios necesarios, para que pueda tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
María is a hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in Southern Honduras, together with her family. She has been selling beverages and curd for ten years.

María works at home. She needs this loan to buy more beverages and curd in order to have more products to offer to the customers that visit her.

With this loan, María hopes to increase her sales and as a result, to improve her family’s quality of life once she receives a higher income. She hopes to expand her business in the short term to be able to continue supporting her family and make sure her son can study and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy beverages and curd to sell.

loans.name: Mario Ezequiel

texts.es:
Don Mario Ezequiel es un señor de 57 años originario del municipio de Achuapa, que se siente muy orgulloso de haber nacido en este pueblo lleno de bondades y haber crecido en el núcleo de un hogar humilde pero luchador donde sus padres eran ganaderos que le enseñaron el amor al trabajo y a luchar para salir adelante.
Don Mario hace muchos años se dedica al comercio donde vende lácteos que es cuajada, queso y crema y granos básicos que son frijoles y maíz.
Estos productos los adquiere en las comarcas aledañas al municipio para ello sale a las cuatro de la mañana de su casa para poder regresar alcanzar el bus, luego esto los distribuye en la ciudad de Estelí donde tiene una gran demanda de sus clientes por la buena calidad del producto y por lo sabroso que es.
Don Mario en este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para abastecer a gran parte de su demanda, ya que quiere aprovechar la oportunidad de que el invierno está saliendo y es cuando más se vende este producto.
Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva para que através de Ceprodel le financien este crédito ya que son de gran ayuda para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mario Ezequiel is a 57-year-old man from the municipality of Achuapa, who feels very proud of having been born in this town full of goodness and having grown up in the heart of a humble home that fights to get ahead, where his parents were farmers who taught him about love for work and the desire to fight to get ahead.

For many years Mario has been making his living in the sales where he sells dairy products such as curd, cheese and cream and bulk grains such as beans and corn. He obtains these goods from the areas neighboring the municipality, which is why he leaves his home at 4 am in order to come back with the bus. He them distributes the goods in the city of Estelí where there is strong demand from his customers for the excellent quality of the product and for its delicious taste. 

At this moment in time, Mario needs a loan to cover a large amount of his demand, as he wants to benefit from the opportunity that winter is on the way out and that is when he sells this product the most. He is asking the Kiva loan lenders via Ceprodel to finance this loan as it is of great help to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cheese, curd, cream, corn, beans and pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is aiming to earn a better income and improve her way of living. She is engaged in a retail store business and at the same time she offers street foods in her locality. According to her, she has managed her retail store for six months. 

She is 40 years old, married and blessed with six children. Four of her children attend school while another one is a farmer and her youngest child is still  infant-aged.

Marilyn would like to take out a loan of PHP 8,000 which will be used to buy stocks of groceries and to invest in a clothing business. She hopes that with this loan she can expand her retail store and someday improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries and invest in a clothing business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 42 years old, married and lives in a rural village of Siem Reap province. To earn a living, she started to cultivate rice and raise pigs in her backyard. She learned to manage these businesses from her parents, who transferred their knowledge to her and her siblings. She uses the income she earns from the businesses for meals, commodities costs, and for allowances for her school-aged children. 

In order to help her further develop her pig raising business, Sam is requesting a loan of KHR 2,500,000 which she will use to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her sows. She hopes that her business will grow and benefit her family. In the future, Sam anticipates having a large farm to place more pigs to raise. Sam and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funded to improve their business as well as their living standards.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her sows.

loans.name: Valentinas Group

texts.es:
Valentinas es el nombre de un grupo que está conformado 9 personas emprendedoras, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica Isabel, venta de abarrotes, Maura lavado de autos, Mirna venta de antojitos, Paula venta de comida, Gabriela venta de pollo y sabanas, Barbara restaurante de mariscos, Eustolia restaurante de mariscos, Flor de Liz venta de tamales, Guadalupe venta de antojitos, este  grupo se encuentra ubicado en san miguel Soyaltepec ha orilla de la laguna de temazcal y las principales actividades económicas son la pesca, el comercio y el cultivo de caña de azúcar.
Mirna tiene la edad de 42 años, estudio la prepa y está casada con Julio que trabaja como taxista, ellos tienen dos hijas Diana de 15 años estudia la secundaria y Nadia de 10 años que asiste a la primaria, ella platica que tiene 6 años dedicándose a la venta de antojitos mexicanos y dulces en la hora de recreo (tiempo para el desayuno en las escuelas) en la escuela primaria, ella platica que su actividad inicia desde muy temprano con la preparación de sus antojitos mexicanos y después se va a la escuela para instalar su pequeño puesto, ella dice que aunque solo es media hora su venta se vende todo, e incluso como las madres de los niños la conocen le hacen pedidos y ella lo entrega. Ella decidió iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio porque no le gusta estar solo en casa, sino que le gusta trabajar y poder contribuir al gasto del hogar. 
Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a comprar aceite, frijoles, tortillas, crema, queso, lechuga, carne de pollo y res, chiles, cebollas, tomates y variedad de dulces.
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continúe progresando y a futuro le gustaría poner una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar.
texts.en:
"Valentinas" is the name of a group that comprises 9 entrepreneurs. Each member runs a business. 

Isabel: grocery sales. 
Maura: car wash. 
Mirna: selling antojitos (corn-based snacks). 
Paula: food sales. 
Gabriela: selling chicken and linens. 
Barbara: seafood restaurant. 
Eustolia: seafood restaurant. 
Flor de Liz: selling tamales. 
Guadalupe: selling antojitos. 

This group is located in San Miguel Soyaltepec on the shore of Temazcal lagoon. The area's main economic activities include fishing, trade and the cultivation of sugar cane. 

Mirna is 42 years old. She has a high school education and is married to Julio, who works as a taxi driver. They have two daughters. Diana is 15 years old, and is in high school. Nadia is 10 years old, and attends primary school. 

Mirna noes that she has worked selling Mexican antojitos and sweet treats for 6 years. She sells during the recreation period (breakfast recess in schools) at the primary school. Her work day starts very early with the preparation of Mexican antojitos. She then goes to the school to set up her small stall. Although she only sells for half an hour, she sells out and even the mothers of the school children know her, and place special orders that she delivers. 

She decided to start her own business because she doesn't like being alone at home. She likes to work and to be able to contribute to the household expenses. 

The loan from VisionFund will enable her to purchase oil, beans, tortillas, cream, cheese, lettuce, chicken, beef, chili peppers, onions, tomatos and a variety of sweets. She hopes that with this investment her business continue to develop. 

In the future she would like to establish a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to purchase oil, beans, tortillas, cream, cheese, lettuce, chicken, beef, chili peppers, onions, tomatos and a variety of sweets.

loans.name: Los Vecinos Group

texts.es:
Los Vecinos es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 9 personas, ellos se organizaron y reunieron para formar un grupo ya que tiene muchas cosas en común como el dedicarse al comercio y ser vecinos de la misma colonia, Este grupo está ubicado en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o Algunas personas lo llaman la novia del sol por sus fuertes calores y las principales fuentes de empleo es el comercio. 
Guadalupe es una de los integrantes de dicho grupo, ella tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio la secundaria y está casada con Enrique. Ella platica que tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa desde hace más de 15 años, dice que cuando inicio con su actividad era porque quería ganar un poco de dinero extra sin descuidar a su familia y en su colonia no había tiendas de abarrotes entonces sería una buena inversión. 
A Guadalupe lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que siempre está en contacto con  las personas y siempre se vende, ella abre su negocio todos los días de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche y le gustaría tener un Crédito de Kiva y de VisionFund le ayudaría para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, harinas, refrescos, dulces, galletas, jabón, embutidos y productos enlatados.
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y luzca mas surtido así atraer más clientes, aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Nelida venta de cosméticos
Fidelia venta de hotdog y hamburguesas
Fidela venta de tacos 
Jenny venta de lencería
Rene venta de calzado 
Alicia venta de flores 
Anabel venta de cosméticos
Aracely venta de lencería
texts.en:
Los Vecinos is the name of a group comprising nine members who organized and met up in order to found a group because they had many things in common, like working in retail and living in the same neighborhood. This group is based in the town of Tierra Blanca. Some people call this place "the sun's bride" because of its high temperatures. Its main source of employment is retail.

Guadalupe is one of the members of this group. She is 49 years old, completed secondary school, and is married to Enrique. She says she has run a small grocery store from her home for over fifteen years, and that she started her business because she wanted to make some extra money without neglecting her family. Since there were no grocery stores in her neighborhood, she thought it would be a good investment.

What Guadalupe likes the most about her business is that she is always in contact with people and always manages to make sales. Her business is open daily from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and she would like to get a loan from Kiva and VisionFund because it would help her invest in purchasing rice, beans, oil, flour, soft drinks, cookies, soap, cold cuts, and canned goods.

She expects her business to prosper from this investment and that it will be visibly more well-stocked in order to attract more customers, increase her earnings, and improve her quality of life.

The other members of the group are: Nelida and Anabel, who both sell cosmetics; Fidelia, who sells hotdogs and hamburgers; Fidela, who sells tacos; Jenny and Aracely, who both sell lingerie;  Rene, who sells shoes; and Alicia, who sells flowers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, flour, soft drinks, sweets, cookies, soap, cold cuts, and canned goods.

loans.name: Junior Smith

texts.es:
Junior es un hombre de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Junior no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Junior trabaja en un mercadillo de su ciudad vendiendo limones, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Junior se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará variedad de tubérculos para complementar su negocio de limones, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Junior is a 23-year-old man, he lives in the city of Chincha with his wife and their young son. He is very hardworking, enthusiastic and puts all his effort into getting his family ahead in life. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources, and due to the need to work, Junior was unable to study a professional degree.

At his own initiative, Junior works in a small market in his city selling limes. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and thinks that it is going very well thanks to his dedication and effort.

Junior is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as thanks to the help given he will be able to buy a variety of tubers to complement his lime business. In this manner he will continue working and making an effort to achieve his dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to buy tubers.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor is studying for a BS in Business Administration at the University of Misamis Occidental. She needs to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester so she borrowed a loan from GDMPC, where she had joined recently. In the future, Amor wants to help her two siblings and to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en: Marvie works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Marvie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 45 años de edad, está soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Siempre se ha dedicado a la confección de ropa, desde pequeño ayudaba a su padre. Tiene 10 años de tener su propio taller donde elabora ropa intima para caballeros y niños,también confecciona pantalones cortos para damas. El prestamo que solicito es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de fardos de tela para confeccionar ropa intima para caballeros y niños y pantalones cortos, con esta inversión va aumentar las ventas y sus ganancias. Tiene como meta comprar dos maquinas industriales de costura para su taller.
texts.en:
Carlos is 45 years old, he is single, has two children and lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula. He has always made a living making clothes, from a young age he helped his father. He has his own workshop where he makes underwear for men and children as well as shorts for women. 

The loan that he is seeking is for 5,000 Honduran Lempiras and he will invest the money in the purchase of bundles of fabric to produce underwear for men and children and make shorts. With this investment, Carlos will increase his sales and his profits. He aims to buy two industrial sewing machines for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fabric to make underwear for men and children and shorts for women.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a food-vending business in the Philippines. Susan has requested a PHP 11,000 loan from NWTF to buy ingredients to use to make food to sell. Susan has been in this business for 10 years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 47 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, coffee and other groceries to sell. Janet has taken out and repaid three previous loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running a general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending. Her goal is to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucena is 44 years old and has four children who are still in school.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lucena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest her coffee.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de tortillas, desde hace 10 años, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. 
Doña María necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal y poder aumentar la producción para seguir realizando su trabajo, y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Doña María espera que sus ventas aumenten y de forma poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios.
Doña María espera tener mayores oportunidades en la vida y que esta inversión le ayude a salir adelante en su negocio y lograr que sea más prospero y seguir ayudando a su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and responsible person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras together with her family. Her business is selling tortillas, which she has been doing for 10 years. María has her business in her house in the municipality where she lives.

María needs a loan to buy corn, wood and lime to be able to increase her production. Then she can continue doing her work and meet the demand from her clients. María hopes that her sales increase as in this way she can raise the quality of living for her and her family with the extra revenues coming into her household. In the short term she wants to expand her business and continue to support her family and provide her children with the necessary studies.  María is looking for better possibilities in life and this loan will help her get ahead with her business and make it more prosperous. Then she can continue supporting her family.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, wood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary is 49 years old. She is married and resides with a twenty-five-year-old child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been running a cosmetics service for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income about $3 each day. Her child is a painter who earns about $3 daily. 

Sary is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase more cosmetics to use in her business. This purchase helps her obtain enough materials for her services and to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to use in her business.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is 43 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling ice and fried bananas for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her children are employed. They earn about $10 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Thon is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business by adding more items in the shop.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is married with two children and she runs a clothing business in their community. She has been sewing and selling dresses, curtains and pillows for thirteen years to earn a living. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional materials, like textiles and yarn goods. Silveria wants to improve her business, for it is the only earned income to cover their daily needs. She saves a portion of her returns to be used for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like textiles and yarn goods.

loans.name: Juan Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 53 años de edad, pero tiene la alegría y el espíritu de un joven de 20 años, el vive en la ciudad de Camaná, día a día Sixto trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, con su trabajo puede solventar los gastos propios del hogar  con mucho esfuerzo, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 cliente diariamente; él cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.

Sixto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le dan su apoyo y gracias a ello podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a sui vehículo y poder trabajar con mayor tranquilidad y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de transportes”.
texts.en:
Sixto is 53 years old, but has the joy and spirit of a 20-year-old, he lives in the city of Camaná. Day after day Sixto works as a moto-taxi driver, with his job he can cover the household expenditure, with a lot of effort. He works around 10 hours a day and can attend up to 15 customers a day. He believes that he is getting along just fine with his job as he is responsible and friendly with his customers.

Sixto is very grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as it is the second time that they have given them his support, and thanks to the support, he will be able to service his vehicle and he will be able to work more at ease and realize his greatest dream of having a transport business.

loans.use: to service and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de La Masica, Atlántida. Hace 3 años que estableció su propio negocio de una pulpería donde ofrece productos alimenticios como ser refresco, carnes, frijoles, harina, manteca, azúcar, jabón, además vende achinería, ropa entre otros. Ella a solicitado el segundo préstamo que es por 11,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, harina, azúcar, manteca, pan, churros, refrescos y otros, también va comprar ropa y cosméticos para la vender. su objetivo es ampliar el negocio ofreciendo variedad y obtener mejores ganancias para el bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old. She is a single mother of four, and lives in La Masica, a town in Atlántida. She started her own business three years ago, when she opened a grocery store where she sells food items like soft drinks, meats, beans, flour, lard, sugar, and soap. She also sells miscellaneous products like clothing and other items. 

She is requesting her second loan, in the amount of 11,000 lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of staple goods like rice, beans, flour, sugar, lard, bread, churros, soft drinks, and other basic items, and she will also buy clothing and cosmetics to sell. Her goal is to expand her business by offering variety and to obtain higher earnings for her own personal wellbeing as well as her family's.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her grocery store and also clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 32 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Annie requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Annie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kisila

texts.en:
Kisila is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a taxi business.  

Kisila is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy tires, brake pads, steering fluid, and brake fluids. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. Kisila will use her profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase tires, brake pads, steering fluid, and brake fluids

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand, age 59, is married and blessed with four children. He has been in the farming business for almost twenty-eight years and earned a net income of approximately 30,000 PHP last harvest season. His income was spent on the hospitalization of his wife who is ill due to a cerebrovascular attack (CVA) (stroke). 

Due to a lack of capital to use in his farming business, he would like to take out a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can utilize it immediately in his farming activity.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides.

loans.name: Adarlina

texts.en:
Adarlina offers various kinds of roses and gumamela (hibiscus). Aside from buying and selling flowers, she is also engaged in a direct selling business. According to her, she has run her direct selling business for five years, while she has been in her flower business for two years. 

She is determined to improve her financial status and her way of living, and to let her youngest child finish her studies. To make all her dreams possible, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000. She will use this loan amount to buy more flowers, such as gumamela and various kinds of roses, and some of the loan will be used in her direct selling business. She knows that success in her life and business relies on her initiative and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more flowers, such as gumamela and various kinds of roses, and some will be used in her direct selling business.

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala is a 45-year-old married woman with 6 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. She needs a loan to buy cordial, foam cups, sugar and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Tala has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy cordial, foam cups, sugar and a cooler.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Candelaria works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Candelaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Antonieta

texts.es:
Doña Sonia es una señora muy luchadora y muy emprendedora de 45 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 5 hijos, los 3 mayores ya están en hogares a parte y bajo su responsabilidad y la de su esposo solo están los dos menores. Su nivel educativo primaria completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo por parte de sus padres pero no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y no tenían los suficientes medios para seguirla apoyando. Doña Sonia desde muy temprana edad se dedica a la agricultura ya que en su familia este rubro es una tradición y la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que su padre la llevaba a los campos donde él trabajaba y le enseñaba como se hacía la recolección de café, posteriormente le enseño como cultivar granos básicos (arroz, maíz y frijoles). Junto a su compañero esposo se dedican a la agricultura al cultivo de café, siembra de maíz y frijoles ellos cuentan con su propio terreno que se encuentra cerca de su casa de habitación por lo que día con día trabajan arduamente y a la vez con mucho entusiasmo cuidan y limpian sus cultivos con la convicción que obtendrán una excelente cosecha, ya que es el rubro que más ingresos genera.
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar asistencia técnica a su cultivo de café como ser compra de fertilizantes, foliares fungicidas entre otros que ayudaran a mantenerlos sanos y protegidos de plagas entre otros.
Ella sueña en un futuro hacer crecer sus cultivos sembrando y cultivando mayor cantidad de café y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan salir adelante con su familia y brindarle una mejor oportunidad de vida a sus hijos, educarlos de forma que ellos en un futuro sean personas preparadas y visionarios que cuiden el patrimonio que ella y su esposo desean heredarles.
texts.en:
Sonia is a true fighter and is very enterprising. She is 45 years old, married and has five children as a result of her marriage, the three older children already live in other households, and there are only the two younger children under the couple’s responsibility. Sonia has a full primary education thanks to her parents' support, but she was unable to continue studying as her parents had few financial resources and didn't have enough means to continue supporting her. 

From a very young age Sonia has been making her living in agriculture as this profession is a tradition in her family and is the source of income for her family. Her father took her to the fields where he worked and he showed how her to harvest the coffee. Later on he taught her how to grow bulk grains (rice, corn and beans). Together with her husband, they make their living in agriculture, growing coffee, sowing corn and beans. They have their own land which is near their home which is why from day to day they work tirelessly and yet with a huge amount of enthusiasm to tend and weed their crops with the strong belief that they will obtain an excellent harvest as this is the area in which they generate the most income.

This is why at the moment Sonia finds herself in need of money to buy agricultural supplies to technically support her coffee crops such as the purchase of fertilizers, fungicides and so on which will help them to keep the crops healthy and safe from plagues among others. 

In the future, she dreams of increasing her crops; sowing and cultivating a larger amount of coffee plants and in this way obtaining a greater income that will help her get ahead with her family and give her children a better opportunity in life: educating them so that in the future they become people that are prepared and with a vision who look after the inheritance which she and her husband want to leave them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Bakbergen

texts.en:
Bakbergen is a first-year student at  AUCA (American University of Central Asia), department of Business Administration. Here is his story.

"Last year I was a student at International Ataturk Ala-Too University. I applied to three universities last year and was been accepted by all of them, but because of the financial limitations of my family,  I decided to study at Ataturk Ala-Too University.  This year I decided to reapply to AUCA, as I did last year (although I could not attend AUCA last year). This year I have been accepted by AUCA. 

AUCA gives students a chance to apply for exchange programs or the MBA program. Students of AUCA are highly qualified and it is an honor for me to become part of it now. The quality of education is very high, so the teachers are highly qualified, accordingly. Students of AUCA are from different parts of the world and form one culture at AUCA. There is a fantastic atmosphere at AUCA. AUCA is recognized for its outstanding educational system and many programs that are ranked highly across the nation. This is a university that always expands and every time becomes more advanced for its students. Knowing that the staff cares about its students, as exemplified through their persistent and constant up-grading of the school, highly influenced my decision to apply to this university. 

AUCA will become my home for the next four years, and the diverse cultures and comforting atmosphere of the university are things I would be proud to associate myself with. While going on tours throughout high schools, AUCA has been the one that drew me in the most. This university offers me many different opportunities and resources that other schools could not. Another opportunity that AUCA gives to every student is a Kiva loan. It is what can make dreams come true. I am applying for the loan as I have financial difficulties and am not able to cover my tuition fees fully."

loans.use: To pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of fish, thus helping her sell more as a result of increased inventory capacity.

loans.name: Veun

texts.en: Veun is 45 years old and a widowed mother living in a small thatched house in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. Veun is a mother of six children of various ages. Three of her children are married and have independent lives. To earn a living, Veun is in the business of sourcing and purchasing hair to sell to local hairdressers. She has been doing this for nearly three years and earns an income of KHR 50,000 per day. To help her sustain with her current business, Veun would like to request a loan of KHR 2,500,000 as her working capital to buy hair to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable. In the future, Veun aims to expand her business and save enough for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy hair to sell

loans.name: Tua

texts.en:
Tua is a 29-year-old married woman with three children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tua has requested a loan to buy a chain saw, water gallon and backpack sprayer. With her profits, Tua hopes to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a chain saw, water gallon and backpack sprayer

loans.name: Sedana Yoga Group

texts.en:
The Sedana Yoga group is located in the village of Baturiti, Tabanan, Bali. This area usually has very high rainfall and most of the members are farmers who plant various kinds of vegetables. In this dry season, a lot of the farm production is not optimal. Seeing this situation, the Sedana Yoga group, which consists of 10 women, took the initiative to raise pigs in an effort to support the family's economy.

Ni Nengah, head of the group, has one child still in school. After successfully selling her piglets, she is using the loan to buy three more piglets to be sold for pig roll. Pigs are maintained for two months and then are ready to sell. Her profits will be used to buy another pig, so after six months, she is ready to make repayment on the loan. She hopes these efforts will help her husband's income from farming.

loans.use: to buy three piglets

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 40 years of age, married to a farmer/carpenter and they are blessed with two children. 

Divina has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost twenty two years and earns a net income of 200 PHP per day. Her profits are spent on their daily expenditures and school allowances for their son. Due to financial constraints she would like to avail a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to purchase rice grains, coffee, sugar, coffee creamer, vinegar, soy/fish sauce and noodles to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains, coffee, sugar, coffee creamer, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna owns a general store within her local community. She lives simply with her husband and three children. Two of the children have settled into marriage while the other child is still attending to school. Myrna and her husband work together to a earn greater income.

Myrna aspires to have continuous growth of her business, that's why she would like to ask for additional capital amounting to PHP 6,000. This amount will enable her to buy grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and cooking oil. She knows that, through the variety of grocery items she offers, she can further satisfy her customers demands and enable her to maintain her general store business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and cooking oil to use for her retail business.

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es:
Joel Antonio, casado mayor de edad, originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por su responsabilidad en y cumplimiento en sus forma de pagos. El ha tenido que trabajar muy duro, y vencer las adversidades de la vida misma. Es lo que le ha ayudado a superarse en su negocio, y mantenerlo en la actualidad.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica un bar y comedor ubicado en su casa de habitación. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como comida casera, refresco, gaseosas, jugos, y licor. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra producto comestibles para preparar la comida casera, ofrecerles variedad y calidad a sus clientes.  Joel agradece la ayuda que los  inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua
texts.en:
Joel is married and advanced in age. He is originally from León, a place that is located in the western part of the country. He is known for being responsible and completing his payments. Joel has had to work very hard in order to overcome adversities in his life. What has been helpful is his ability to succeed at his business and maintain it. Thanks to his effort and his drive to succeed, he has been able to make a living by managing a bar and diner located in his home.

Joel spends about 12 hours a day at his business by offering home-cooked food, refreshments, sodas, juices, and liquor. The purpose of this loan is to have operating capital to invest and to buy ingredients for preparing home-cooked meals. This will enable him to offer variety and quality to his customers.

Joel appreciates the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing home-cooked meals, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Ma. Roselyn

texts.en:
Ma. Roselyn is 29 years old and married. With two children currently in school, Ma. Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years and she sells a variety of items such as bath soap, sugar, shampoo, soft-drinks, bread and other groceries. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Ma. Roselyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store, like bath soap, sugar, shampoo, soft-drinks, bread and other groceries.

loans.name: Feleciano

texts.en: Feleciano is married and has two children. He is running a fishing business to earn a living while his wife works as a lady guard. He has been fishing for ten years, earning a good enough income to provide for the family. He has borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fishing materials to use in the business. He is hopeful that, in the future, he will acquire a fishing boat to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

Ma. Cecelia has been in this business for 8 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Veronica has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Veronica has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
Shahzadi is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw, which he has been doing for many years to meet the family expenses. 

The rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. Shahnaz is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband, which he will use to buy new tires and some engine maintenance for his vehicle. This loan will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

loans.use: to repair an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Opeka

texts.en:
Opeka, a 39-year-old married mother of six, has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbage, cucumber and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. In business for three years. she needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, spade, rake, crowbar and barbed wire.

Opeka will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's school fees and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, spade, rake, crowbar and barbed wire

loans.name: Chhil

texts.en:
Chhil is 54 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her children are garment workers. They earn $10 daily. 

To improve her family’s finances, Chhil is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow and produce a calf to sell. This purchase will help her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and produce a calf to sell.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay is 52 years old. She is married and resides with a fifteen year-old child in Kampog Speu Province, Cambodia.
