She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animasl for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her husband runs a business of cattle trading. He makes an income of $10 daily. 

To improve her family’s finance, Hay is asking for a loan of $1100 to purchase two cattle to resell for a profitable price. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she wants to rebuild the roof of her house.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle to resell for a profitable price.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is a 56 year old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Sa has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, bush-knives and a spade for her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Sa hopes to assist her family's daily needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, wheelbarrow, a crowbar, bush-knives and a spade.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn, a 49-year-old married mother of six, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a general store in the Philippines for nine years, and also earns an income from selling firewood and nipa roofing.

Marialyn, who has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF, is requesting a new one for PHP 25000 to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, eggs, canned goods, milk, etc. 

Marialyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, eggs, canned goods, milk, etc

loans.name: Ailua

texts.en:
Ailua is 22 years old and single.  She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants, and cucumbers that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Ailua is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a rake, and garden hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Ailua will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a rake, and garden hose

loans.name: Mardoqueo

texts.en: Mardoqueo is married and blessed with seven children. Among his children, three are attending schools that are in between college and high school level of education. To make a living he is engaged in the farming and livestock business. His profit from the business is not fit to sustain family's daily expenditures since his business generates only an income when time of harvesting and selling of hogs. Sometimes he is asking for financial help from his child, who is working abroad, to provide for his other children's needs in school. Now, Mardoqueo has decided to borrow a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to gain enough profits to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Faaolataga

texts.en:
A 32-year-old mother of one, Faaolataga has a small garden where she grows taros, yams, bananas, etc. that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years and needs a loan to buy a pickaxe, crowbar, chainsaw and chemicals.


Faaolataga, who became a member of SPBD this year, will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's standard of living and pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a pickaxe, crowbar, chainsaw and chemicals

loans.name: Silvia Yessenia

texts.es: Silvia de 34 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijos de 5 y 13 años de edad. Silvia se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de antojitos tales como: yuca frita, pastelitos de carne, enchiladas, empanadas, etc. Es muy emprendedora y busca cualquier oportunidad del mercado para poner su negocio. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y les da a sus hijos lo necesario. Desea mejorar las condiciones de vivienda ya que como se muestra en la fotografía es de lámina y madera que con el tiempo se han deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de pilares de cemento para reforzar la casa y dar mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 34 years old, she is a single mother and lives with her two children, a 5-year-old and a 13-year-old, in a house that she owns. She is known for being a responsible and a very hard working person. 

During the last 7 years she has been working in the preparation and selling of snacks, like: fried yucca, meat pastries, enchiladas, empanadas, etc. 
Silvia is a very entrepreneurial person who seeks market opportunities to establish her business. This is how she supports her family and provides to her children what they need. 

She would like to improve the conditions of her house, because it was built with corrugated metal sheets and wood planks, as seen in this picture, and these materials deteriorate over time. This is why Silvia is requesting a loan through FUSAI, to invest in buying concrete blocks to reinforce her home and improve safety conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks to reinforce her home and improve safety conditions for her children.

loans.name: Glenda Grace

texts.en:
Glenda Grace is 35 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Glenda Grace has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Glenda Grace requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell.

Glenda Grace has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Glenda Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 38 years old and married with two children, one of whom in school. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, canned goods, spices, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bamboo to weave.

Fe has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 28 years old and married with 6 children. She has a plantation where she grows taros and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Susana needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, crowbars and pickaxes. Susana will use the profits from her sales to improve her family standard of living and help her kids education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, crowbars and pickaxes.

loans.name: Neyi Amparo

texts.es:
Neyi es una mujer de 53 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene muchos deseos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Neyi no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Neyi trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella vende desayunos y almuerzos a diversos clientes, Neyi trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y dedicación.
Neyi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear, pintar y ponerle piso a su hogar, así pues Neyi seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Neyi is a 53-year-old woman who is single and lives in the city of Chincha. She is hardworking, enthusiastic, and has tremendous drive to succeed. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work at a very young age, she was not able to study for a professional degree.

Through her own initiative, Neyi works at her small business of selling food. She sells breakfasts and lunches to different customers. Neyi works every day for approximately 10 hours. She believes she is doing well because of her delicious food and her dedication.

Neyi is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to make improvements to her house. She wants to plaster and paint the walls, as well as install a floor in her home. Neyi will continue working and striving toward her greatest wish of having her own vending stall.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her home.

loans.name: Khushruz

texts.ru: Хушруз очень сообразительный, добрый и трудолюбивый парень. Он живет со своими родителями. В семье их 3 детей. Он самый старший. Его отец старался, чтобы его сыновья получили хорошее образование. Его отец зарабатывает в Российской Федерации. Несмотря на тяжелое условие жизни, он окончил среднюю школу с отличными оценками. Хушруз поступил в университет. Мать Хушруза работает в средней школе преподавательницей. Его бабушка и дедушка живут вместе с ними. У его бабушки и дедушки очень маленькая пенсия. Его семья живет очень бедно. Хушруз запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Khushruz is a very smart, good and hard-working guy. He lives with his parents. There are three children in the family. Khushruz is the eldest one. His father worked hard for his sons to receive a good education. His father works in the Russian Federation. 

Despite tough living conditions, Khushruz finished high school with excellent grades. He entered the university. Khushruz' mother works as a high school teacher. His grandfather and grandmother live together with them. His grandmother and grandfather have very small pensions. This family lives in poverty. 

Khushruz requests a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his education

loans.name: Ana Adelsa

texts.es: Doña Ana, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace 4 años estableció el negocio de pulpería donde ofrece productos de la canasta básica como ser refrescos, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, arroz, frijoles, maíz, churros, dulces, productos de limpieza etc. El prestamo que ha solicitado es por 6,000 Lempiras y es el quinto ciclo con la institución,  el cual lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos como arroz, frijoles, carnes, churros, lácteos, maíz, pan, huevos etc. y asi poder vender variedad de productos a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan es mantener su negocio activo y ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is 54, married, and has three children. She lives in the town of San Pedro Sula. Four years ago she set up her business, a grocery store. She sells staple goods such as soft drinks, meat, sausages, diary products, rice, beans, maize, churros, sweets and cleaning products.

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 lempiras and it is her fifth loan with the institution. She will invest this into buying more products such as rice, beans, meat, churros, dairy products, maize, bread and eggs. This means she can sell a range of goods to her customers and improve her profits. Her plan is to keep her business going and help to contribute to the household costs.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, beans, meat, churros, dairy products, maize, bread and eggs in order to stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Lilliam Victoria

texts.es: Lilliam Victoria, mayor edad casada con dos hijos aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, Lilliam se caracteriza por ser una Mujer muy trabajadora, responsable. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por lo que  vio en la necesidad de  trabajar desde muy joven  para aporta a los gastos del hogar. Ella día a día se esfuerza para sacar adelante  a sus hijos para verlos convertidos en unos profesionales,  se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: abanicos, ropa, peroles, productos plásticos, prendas de oro, peluches, planchas, cosméticos, entre otros, su forma de trabajo es ambulante y por encargos, ella inicia su jornada desde muy temprano saliendo a la calle a realizar  sus entregas y ofreciendo a nuevos clientes sus productos, sus compras las realiza al contado, y sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal, El objetivo del crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería  en general, el cual pueda  obtener mejores ingresos. Lilliam está muy contenta y  agradecida con la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Lilliam Victoria is married and still has two children under her charge.  Originally from the municipality of Chinandega, in the west of the country, Liiliam is hard-working and responsible. Unfortunately she was not able to study at university, as she did not have the financial means and needed to work from a young age in order to support the family income.  Day after day Lilliam puts in the effort to get ahead with her children and to see them become professionals.  Liiliam makes a living selling merchandise such as clothes, fans, kitchen utensils, plastic products, gold pins, teddy bears, irons, make up, and more.  Lilliam works as a street vendor and also takes orders. She starts her day very early, heading out to the street to make deliveries and to offer her products to new customers.  Lilliam buys in cash and sells both for cash and on credit, collecting weekly or fortnightly.  This loan will be invested in working capital and will be used to stock up her business buying and selling general merchandise. This loan will help give her higher profits.  Lilliam is very happy and grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with little money - and to poor countries, such as Nicaragua, - to help give them a decent job.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as plastic products, make-up, clothes, kitchen utensils, and more.

loans.name: Lizzie

texts.es: Lizzie, de 19 años, es una mujer emprendedora y que no le tiene miedo a los retos, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres. Lizzie, tiene como trabajo la venta de bebidas al por menor, el carro repartidor de una empresa de bebidas de la ciudad se encarga de proveerle directamente de la planta envasadora hasta su local de atención que está ubicado en su hogar. Realiza la venta directa de gaseosas y cervezas y la atención a sus clientes gracias a que cuenta con algunas mesas y sillas en donde atiende cómodamente a sus consumidores. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad  más de 02 años y lo hace con ayuda de su pareja. Le gusta lo que hace, pues brinda a sus clientes bebidas de marcas reconocidas por su gran calidad, trabaja con mucha responsabilidad y medidas de seguridad complementarias, además tiene buenas ventas y con eso puede mejorar los ingresos económicos que necesita  para su hogar, desea seguir trabajando y más adelante agrandar su establecimiento. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará más bebidas al por mayor para continuar con sus ventas en su negocio.
texts.en: Nineteen-year-old Lizzie is enterprising and is not scared of a challenge.  She is single and does not have children; she lives with her parents.  Lizzie's work is selling drinks.  The bottling plant delivery lorry brings the drinks to Lizzie's business, which she runs out of her home.  She sells her fizzy drinks and beers directly to customers and, thanks to some chairs and tables she has, Lizzie is able to serve her customers comfortably.  Lizzie has been doing this work for over two years, and receives help from her partner.  She likes her work and is providing her customers with brand-name drinks, known for their good quality.  Lizzie is responsible in her work and has good security there.  She has good sales and so can increase the income that she needs for her home.  Lizzie wants to continue working and, in the future, expand her shop.  On this occasion she is applying for 800 Nuevo Soles and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support.  With it she will feel more secure as she progresses with her business.  Lizzie promises to make her repayments on time.  She will use this loan in order to buy more drinks in bulk, in order to continue selling them through her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.ru: Ширингул хранительница очага своего дома  и основная кормилица своих 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Он не имел постоянное место работы на родине, и поэтому ему пришлось покидать страну. Ширингул 14 лет назад начала свой бизнес, так как она нуждалась в деньгах, чтобы обеспечить своих детей. Она занимается купле продажей тканей на местном рынке. Ширингул имеет свою торговую точку. Она продает ткани по сезону. Ширингул знает, как сделать индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту и поэтому успешно введет своё дело. Так как она является основной кормилицей семьи, она не может сделать сбережения для ремонта дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как краски, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shiringul is the head of her household and the main breadwinner for her four children. Her husband could not find steady employment at home so he left the country and is now a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Shiringul started a business 14 years ago because she needed the money to provide for her children. She has a shop in the market where she buys and sells fabrics. She is successful because she knows how to take an individual approach for each of her customers. Because she is the main source of income for her family she isn't able to save any money for home repairs. She has asked for a loan of 4000 somoni in order to buy building materials such as paint, wood, and such. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials like paint and wood for house repairs

loans.name: Mirian Guadalupe

texts.es: Mirian de 32 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida quien es mecánico y sus tres hijos de 16 años, 14 años y 4 años de edad.  Mirian se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y así lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de asegurar su vivienda ha decidido enrejar el corredor  para lo cual necesita comprar hierro y pago de mano obra para hacer el enrejado. Solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para hacer el desembolso que necesita ya que no cuenta con el capital disponible pero si con la capacidad de pago mensual que el préstamo implica.
texts.en: Mirian is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner - a mechanic - and their three children, aged 16, 14, and 4 years old respectively.  Mirian is enterprising and very responsible.  She has made a living selling beauty products from catalogues for five years, and this supports her household.  In order to make her house more secure, Mirian has decided to build a fence around the passage outside and, for this, needs to buy iron and pay labourers to build the fence.  Mirian is applying to FUSAI for the money that she needs, as she does not have enough cash available.  However, with the loan, which she can pay back monthly, she can build this fence.

loans.use: to buy iron and to pay labourers to fence up her home's passage.

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei is 25 years old and married with two children. 

She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community, and has been doing this for two years.

Tinei has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, eggs, and baking soda. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tinei will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, eggs, and baking soda

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa de 44 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo quien es albañil y le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Desde hace 6 años logró establecer un pequeño puesto de tortillas en su hogar de residencia. De esa forma logra colaborar con la economía de su hogar. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa junto con su esposo. Su deseo es terminar algunas mejoras que tiene pendientes y desea terminar lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro que no ha logrado terminar y para reparar el techo ya que se encuentra dañado. Con el crédito comprará cemento, ladrillo, arena, hierro, lámina y madera. Espera poder obtener esta ayuda para terminar el muro y reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and lives in the house she owns with her husband, who works in construction and helps her support their household. Six years ago she was able to set up a tortilla stand in her home. This allows her to contribute to the household economy.  With lots of effort, she has managed to build her house alongside her husband. 

She wants to finish some pending improvements as soon as possible. That is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a wall she has not been able to finish and repairing the roof, which is damaged. She will use the loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron, sheeting, and wood. She hopes to receive this help in order to finish the wall and repair her home's roof.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a wall around her house and repair the roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and also repair his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cocoa powder, powdered milk, sugar, flour and other ingredients to fry doughnuts

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Ханифа трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 53 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она работает в средней школе учительницей истории. Она работает более 31 года. Ханифа хорошо знает все тонкости своего дела. Она считает, что нет более благородной профессии, чем профессия учителя. Она гордится тем, что она является преподавателем. Ханифа и ее семья живут в доме, который имеет плохое состояние. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег, чтобы купить строительные материалы как цемент, краски и оплатить за работу мастеров по ремонту. Ханифа является повторной клиенткой. Она имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Hanifa is a hardworking woman. She is 53 years old. She is married and raising two children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Hanifa works at a high school as a history teacher. She has worked for more than 31 years. Hanifa knows all the intricacies of her work. She thinks that there is no nobler profession than being a teacher. 

Hanifa and her family lives at a house which is in a very bad condition. She plans to repair her house, but does not have the money to purchase building materials such as cement and paint or to pay workers for doing the repairs. Hanifa is a returning client. She has a good credit history. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and paint, and to pay for workers to do repairs

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро родилась в 1982 года. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Зухро сильная женщина, так как пережила тяжелый период своей жизни с гордо поднятой головой. Она несколько лет назад потеряла своего мужа и осталась без кормильца с одним несовершеннолетним ребенком. Она была очень в тяжелой ситуации. Она нигде не работала и не имела никакой поддержки после смерти мужа. Однако она набралась мужества и поступила на работу для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и защитить себя и своего ребенка от голода. Она работает в государственной организации бухгалтером более 3 лет. Она старается для усовершенствования своего знания. Она данное время учится в Таджикском Государственном Университете Коммерции в заочное отделение. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zuhro was born in 1982. She is a hardworking and purposeful woman. Zuhro is a strong woman, as she has lived through a difficult period in her life with her head held high. Some years ago she lost her husband and was left without support with a small child. She was in a very difficult situation. She did not work anywhere and did not have any support after the death of her husband. However, she gathered her courage and started working in order to earn money and protect herself and her child from hunger. 

Zuhro has worked as an accountant at a public organization for more than three years. She strives to improve her knowledge. Currently she studies at the Tajik State University of Commerce through correspondence. She requests a loan in the amount of 5,500 somoni to pay her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her education

loans.name: Dwighta

texts.en:
Dwighta is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her store has been running for eleven years now, and it keeps on expanding. Her income from the loan supported her everyday expenses. She continues to work to provide for her and to help her family. She also sells charcoal and mineral water for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 45,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Dwighta dreams that her business will get bigger. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more bananas, sugar, oil, and the gas needed in her other business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. Aside from selling banana cue, she is also a tricycle operator for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to pay for more bananas, sugar, oil, and the gas needed in her other business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Hilda dreams to be more successful in her business and dreams to have their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more bananas, sugar, oil, and the gas needed in her other business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 48 years old and married with five children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell vegetables.

Alicia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn, who is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family. In business for 25 years now, she has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her business.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family; she has a fishing business in the Philippines. Norma has been in this business for 5 years now.

Norma requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a boneless dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more fish for making dried fish for her boneless dried fish making business.

Josephine has been in this business for eleven years; she earns more income from a general store.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish for making dried fish

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.ru: Нурлан 44 года, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Нурлана - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нурлан занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурлана, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 56 овец, 2 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,0 ГА, на котором выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). Нурлан входит в группу "Келечек -Калба", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека.  Нурлан является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурлан обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурлан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Nurlan is 44 years old, married and raising three children together with his wife. Nurlan has secondary education. As a main source of income for his family, Nurlan works with livestock breeding, after having started 10 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurlan's persistent work, his farm currently has seven dairy cows, 56 sheep, two horses and also a plot of land of 2.0 hectares. Here he grows beans, potatoes and perennial grasses. The monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). 

Nurlan is a member of the group "Kelechek-Kalba". This group also has two other members. Nurlan is the second member of this group. With an aim to further develop his business, Nurlan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) to purchase bull-calves to increase the number of livestock. Nurlan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save money for building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children, with ages between 2 and 13, who attend school and live at home. She has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for the past years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like bamboo, wood paint, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like bamboo, wood paint, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers

loans.name: Bayan

texts.ru: Баян 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Баян - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Баян занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Баян, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок 20 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,50 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетнюю траву. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). Баян входит в группу "Келечек -Калба", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. Баян является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Баян обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Баян планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Bayan is 47 years old and raising three children together with her husband. Bayan has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Bayan works with livestock breeding, after having started 16 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bayan's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow, one calf and 20 sheep, and also a plot of land of 2.50 hectares. Here she grows beans, potatoes and perennial grasses. The monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). 

Bayan is a member of the group "Kelechek-Kalba". There are two other people in this group, and as a result there are three of them. Bayan is the leader of this group. With an aim to further develop her business, Bayan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep to increase the number of livestock. Bayan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save money for repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Meet Imelda, a 30-year-old farmer living in the Kitale area. She has practiced farming for 5 years where she gets her income from the sale of milk and eggs. In farming, she loves poultry keeping because it gives her more profit. When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund her, she said that it offers low interest on their loans. During the training she learned how the savings co-guarantee mechanism is important‌ to every group, because an individual needs guarantors to get a loan.

loans.use: For purchasing poultry.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and lives in Montserrado County, home of the country's largest Freeport and the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with a child, aged 13, who is in school and lives at home. 

Rose has been selling cookies for the past five years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and butter for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and butter for her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina de 59 años, no estudio ya que en su niñez, en su lugar de residencia no habían escuelas y ella se dedicó mejor al trabajo de campo, y al cuido de animales domésticos, como: gallinas, cerdos y vacas.  Ella actualmente está casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, es madre de  6 hijos dos estudian en la escuela, y 2 trabajan la agricultura junto con su padre, y dos que  viajaron hace 4 años para los estados unidos;  los cuales le mandan ayudita a ella cuando pueden. También ella tiene el papá, el cual es el que depende de ella ahorita.      

Angelina se está dedicando, al cuido de cerdos, posee 25 años de dedicarse a este trabajo; lo aprendió ya que sus padres por la escases de recursos económicos, desde mucho tiempo se dedicaron a este trabajo ya que de este trabajo y la agricultura eran las fuente de ingreso de dinero que ellos tenían,

El préstamo que está solicitando, es  para comprar 4 cerdos pequeños, que el costo de cada uno de ellos es de $ 50 dólares cada uno, 15 quintales de harinilla; para darles una buena alimentación durante el periodo de engorde de estos, así los venderá posteriormente a un mejor precio.

Los sueños de ella, es tener una criandera de cerdos, para ya no tener que comprarlos para engordar, y así ella también podrá vender cerdos pequeños a un buen precio, y obtener más ganancias, ya que los venderá recién nacidos de 1 mes con 15 días. Ella con esta ganancia, les podrá ayudar a sus dos hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Angelina is 59 years old and never went to school as there were no schools where she lived as a child.  Instead, Angelina worked in the field and looked after animals, such as hens, pigs, and cows.  Angelina is now married and, with her husband, works in agriculture. She is a mother to six children - two are in school and two work in farming with their parents.  The other two travelled to the US four years ago and send home a little money whenever they can.  Angelina's father now also now depends on his daughter.

Angelina makes a living looking after pigs, and now has 25 years experience doing this work.  She learned it from her parents, who were very poor.  They did this work for a very long time and it, with farming, was their income.

This loan will be used to buy four small pigs, each of which will cost $50.  It will also buy 15 hundredweights of feed to fatten up the pigs, which she will later sell for a better price.

Angelina's dream is to have her own pig farm so that she does not have to buy them to fatten them up.  With a pig farm she would be able to sell young pigs at a good price - she would receive higher profits as she could sell them at six weeks old.  With this profit, Angelina would be able to help her two children who are currently in school.

loans.use: to buy four young pigs, and 15 hundredweights of feed, to fatten up the pigs.

loans.name: Odelia

texts.en:
Meet Odelia. She is 21 years old from Jui, eastern area of Freetown. She is married with children. In 2005, Odelia established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted generates a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Odelia requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Odelia plans to expand her palm oil business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is the mother of five children. She is living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables.

Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables. Irshad thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in more quantities.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Mona has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a tarpaulin, a watering can and bushknives. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Mona hopes to save for her children's school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a tarpaulin, a watering can and bushknives

loans.name: Carlitos

texts.pt:
Carlitos tem 29 anos de idade é segurança e nas horas vagas presta servicos como electrecista, casado tem 1 filho sem idade escolar vive na casa própria sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ele.
Com o valor do crédito vai comprar material eléctrico tais como: quadros monofásico, interruptores, tomadas, tubos, fios pbc,e pbt caixas de derivação que parte do material ira revender nos sitios onde e contrado para fazer instalacoes.
Para o futuro quer ter uma ferragem no mercado local, adiquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal e para o negócio.
Diz que quer crescer no negocio, pagar pontualmente suas prestacoes e voltar a solicitar mais emprestimos para realizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Carlitos is 29 years old. He's a security guard and in his free time he provides services as an electrician. He's married and has a son who hasn't reached school age. He lives in a house that he owns and supports a nephew who lives with him.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase electrical supplies such as an electric board, power switches, outlets, tubes, electrical wires and juction boxes. He will re-sell part of the supplies at the places where he's hired to do installation work.
For the future he wishes to own a hardware store at the local market and buy a vehicle for personal and business purposes.
He states that he wishes to make progress in his business, make his repayments in a timely fashion and apply for more loans again so he can achieve his plans.

loans.use: to purchase an electric board, power switches, outlets, tubes, electrical wires and juction boxes.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan de 57 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija de 23 años de edad y sus dos pequeñas nietas de 9 y 3 años de edad. Toda su vida ha trabajado como agricultor y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Juan es un hombre responsable que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de comenzar a construir su casa ya que donde habita actualmente está deteriorada y piensa que es mejor comenzar a construir una nueva dentro de su mismo terreno. Solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y polines ya que no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso pero si con la capacidad para cancelar las cuotas que dicho préstamo implica.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 57 years old, lives in the home he owns alongside his 23-year-old daughter and his two little granddaughters, who are ages nine and three. He has worked as a farmer his whole life and that is how he supports his household. Juan is a responsible man who has managed to provide for his family with lots of effort. In order to improve his housing situation he has decided to start building his house, since where he is currently living is deteriorated. He thinks it best to start building a new house on his same plot of land. 

He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing corrugated sheet metal, wood, nails, and beams, since he does not have enough capital for such an expenditure, but he does have the ability to pay off the debt such a loan implies.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheet metal, wood, nails, and beams to build a small house.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Armando é militar de 45 anos de idade, casado, pai de 2 filhos ainda menores vive na casa própria e sustenta uma cunhada que vive com ela.
Com o valor do crédito irá comprar cimento, areia, pedra para ampliar sua casa pois agora é so um quarto e sala.
Diz que tem como plano terminar a sua obra e mobilar e diz ainda que irá solicitar mais créditos.
Compromete se a honrar com o contrato e diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para atingir seu plano e que para isso tambem conta com a ajuda de sua esposa que faz pequenos negocios que reforcam a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Armando is a 45-year-old serviceman. He's married and has two underage children. He lives in a house that he owns and supports a sister-in-law who lives with him.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, sand and rocks so that he can enlarge his house, because right now it only has a bedroom and a living room.
He states that his plan is to finish the construction work and furnish the house. He also states that he'll apply for more loans.
He pledges to abide by the contract and states that he'll apply for more loans so he can achieve his plan. To that end he also gets help from his wife, who does small business that increases the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and rocks.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia’s dream is to establish another business aside from her current retail store business. She wants to manage a 'Karinderia' (mini restaurant) business in their village for additional income. 

Pacencia is married and has five children. She sells grocery items like biscuits, snack foods and drinks. With regards to her dream, Pacencia is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy beverages, sugar, milk and coffee. She is also planning to buy meat and raw ingredients to cook menus for meals.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sugar, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Nica

texts.en:
Nica manages a variety store in her town, which was first started as a beauty salon business. When Nica got tired of managing the salon she decided to convert it into another type of business and since then it became a variety store selling school and office supplies. She is also selling jewelry like earrings, rings, bracelets and necklaces.

Nica dreams to travel abroad to see the different and beautiful places in the world. That’s why her goal is to earn a higher income and save some of it to make her dream come true. 

Nica is requesting a loan of PHP45,000 to buy various school supplies, like papers, folders, pens, and other office supplies to sell. She is doing her best in managing well the business toward its growth.

loans.use: to buy various school supplies, like papers, folders, pens, and other office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase an increased quantity of recharge cards, thus allowing him to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Njiriri

texts.en:
Njiriri is a farmer in Oloitoktok town, where he plants cash crops such as maize and vegetables to sell. He has been in the farming business for ten years, and right now his monthly income is Kes 6,000. He also has a retail shop. 

He is 52 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with three children.

He plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds, and agrochemicals to use on his farm. He will also use part of the loan to buy an additional stock of retail goods to sell in his shop. These include tea leaves, flour, and cooking oil. 

This is his third loan term, and he paid his previous loans successfully.

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

In the future, Njiriri hopes to build rental houses and also provide for the basic needs for his family.

loans.use: To buy an stock of retail goods

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida, 53 years of age, is married to a utility man, and they are blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 13 years and earns a net income of 400 PHP per day. Her profits were spent on the school allowances of her three grandchildren and some of their personal necessities. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to purchase beverages, biscuits, chips, canned goods, and noodles to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to expand her business and increase her stocks so she could generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, biscuits, chips, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of women accessories like earrings, necklaces, hair bands etc

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 47 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. She has a boutique business and also does farming. Her spouse also provides additional income. She has been selling clothes and jewellery for 10 years now.

She will be using this loan to purchase more stock of clothes and jewellery for sale. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy more varieties of clothes and also repay the loan.

This is her 3rd loan term and she paid all her previous loans successfully. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her boutique business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy clothes and jewellery for sale

loans.name: Antony Cesar

texts.es:
Antony vive en la ciudad de carhuaz, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de artículos de ferretería desde hace 1 año, con lo cual puede obtener ingresos para poder seguir adelante.

Antony esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería como bolsas de cemento, fierros, herramientas, entre otros,  para poder seguir trabajando y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una casa propia y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Antony lives in the city of Carhuaz and has a small business, a hardware store, where he has been working for one year. This allows him to obtain income in order to keep moving forward.

Antony is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they offer he will be able to buy merchandise like sacks of cement, metal, tools, and other items, so that he can keep working and fighting to make his big dream come true: "To own a home and attend university."

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Judalyn

texts.en:
This is Judalyn. She previously accessed an 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase watch batteries, bracelets and other materials needed in repairing watches. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan for her to buy watch batteries, bracelets and other materials needed in repairing watches. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Judalyn dreams to have other sources of income and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for watch batteries, bracelets and other materials needed in repairing watches.

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva works hard to support two children. She is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Menerva requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Menerva is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,500 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing/fish vending business.

Arsenia has been in this business for 8 years. Arsenia earns more income from buy and sell dry goods.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy medicines for his pharmacy

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat, a 43-year-old mother of three daughters and two sons, has been engaged in hand embroidery for the past five years. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory, and the work provides her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery, Nusrat has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy more frames, needles and threads of various colors. This will enable her to meet customer demand in a timely fashion, thereby helping her to earn more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

Nusrat thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for boards and plywood

loans.name: David

texts.en:
This is thirty-six year-old David. He is married, and has one child, aged one. In 2011, David established his motor spare parts business. He began his business business to be self-reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in city center and his main customers are mechanics and motor bike riders. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,306,150 every month from this business. 

David would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  He has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to add the engine oil stock. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, David hopes to improve the business and expand to other towns. He started the business hawking around the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for engine oil

loans.name: Aida Maria

texts.pt:
A senhora Aida é  viúva, maĕ de 05 filhos que já não estão na sua responsabilidade. Vive  na casa própria, tem 60 anos de idade e trabalha cinco horas diárias. 
O  crédito que ela contraiu será aplicado na compra de produtos  tais como: Esteiras, sabão, biscoitos, e outros para revender.
No futuro ela pretende construir uma Mini-Mercearia de modo a vender num lugar fixo. 
O seu maior desafio é honrar com os compromissos na Hluvuku para garantir mais emprestimos e assim poder realizar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
Aida is a widow. She has five children who are no longer under her care. She lives in a house that she owns. She's 60 years old and works five hours a day.
The loan she got will be used to purchase merchandise such as mats, soap, cookies, etc., for re-selling.
In the future she intends to build a small grocery store in order to have a fixed place to sell from.
Her biggest challenge is abiding by her commitment to Hluvuku so that she can ensure more loans. That way she'll be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase mats, soap and cookies.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a  39-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cucumbers, cabbages, tomatoes, and eggplant to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Epifania has requested a loan to buy a garden hose, a rake, bushknives, gloves and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Epifania hopes to improve her business to help her family matters and her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy a garden hose, a rake, bushknives, gloves and fertilizer

loans.name: Carlota

texts.pt:
A dona Carlota é comerciante, tem 53 anos de idade, mãe de 5 filhos já maiores e vive na casa própria é solteira sustenta 1 neto que vive com ela.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar açúcar, óleo, refrescos e cervejas para revender no seu estabelecimento na sua casa. 
Diz que tem como plano para o futuro fazer cerscer seu negócio, remodelar a sua loja.
Diz ainda que ira honrar com o compromisso pagando pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais creditos para a concretizacao de seus planos.
texts.en:
Carlota is a merchant. She's 53 years old and has five children who are already adults. She lives in a house that she owns. She's single and supports a grandson who lives with her.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase sugar, cooking oil, refreshments and beer for re-selling in the store she runs in her house.
She states that her plan for the future is to make her business grow and remodel her store.
She also states that she'll abide by the commitment by repaying the loan in a timely fashion. She'll also apply for more loans again in order to achieve her plans.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, refreshments and beer.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a woman who has a strong determination to succeed. She is a hard-working mother with two children. She manages a 'sari-sari' store business within her village.She is selling various items like soap, shampoo, conditioner and beverages. Generated income from her store business is used for her piggery business.

Florencia wishes to improve her sales and income but her capital is not enough; that's the reason why she's requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, condiments and many more goods for her general store. She hopes to earn better income to secure her family's welfare and be able to ensure her hogs have proper nutrition.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, condiments and many more items for her general store

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is married with 5 children. She is 50 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur. 

To earn a living, Felipa has a junk shop. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6,000. She applied for a loan to support the expansion of her business into the nearby municipalities. She needs capital to purchase junk items and empty bottles and re-sell it for recycle.

Felipa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. 

In the future, she hopes to build a big shop to store the junk.

loans.use: to purchase junk items and empty bottles for resale

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Donia

texts.en:
Donia, age 44, is from Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She is married and bravely raising 3 children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Donia is now trying to expand her pig business and has also decided to venture into food vending. She presented her project proposal to PMPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000. She is thankful to PMPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional capital for food vending.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia, aged 60, is happy tending her little store. She is married with three children, and her husband is a fisherman. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Julia keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Julia believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Julia has reached her fifth year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 25,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there, good living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy basic commodities for her store

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 33 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur.   To earn a living, Perlita runs a junk shop, which she has been doing for five years. Each month, she earns approximately 8,000 PHP. Now she is asking a loan to buy weighing scale to be used at her junk shop.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to build a big shop for the stock of the junk.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale for her junk shop

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married with four children. She is 54 years old and lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Anita is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers, to repair their house and to pay labor expenses.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Anita hopes to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, to repair their house and to pay labor expenses.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios earns a living through farming. She is 65 years old. She is married and lives in Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is well-known for being a hardworking mother. She has sent her children to school through her farming business and she has been able to have savings because of PMPC.
 
Remedios is seeking a PHP 20,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. In her previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Remedios is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita is married and has seven children. She is 63 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past 31 years, Pablita has operated a general store, buying and selling firewood and white wine. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to pay for the pawned land. Pablita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to pay for the pawned land

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a bread supplier in Oloitoktok town. She supplies the bread to various shop retailers and she has been in this business for 12 years now. She is 39 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with five children. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more bread to supply. This will enable her to have enough stock and thereby meet the demand of her customers. She will use the generated profits to educate her children.

Having repaid her previous loan successfully, this will be her second loan term. In future, she hopes build rental houses and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bread to supply to retailers.

loans.name: Cenia Antonia

texts.es: Cenia, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Olanchito. Anteriormente trabajo en un supermercado. y hace 2 años que se dedica a su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas como baleadas, pastelitos, pollo frito con tajadas, tacos etc. y venta de ropa. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo con la institución y es por 10,000 Lempiras, el cual lo va invertir en la compra de mas materia prima para elaborar las comidas como carnes, harina, manteca, condimentos, etc. y compra de mercadería como ropa, sandalias y otros. ya que así tendrá su negocio mas surtido y ofrecerá variedad de productos. tiene como meta darle la educación a su hijo y crecer con el negocio.
texts.en:
Cenia is 36 years old. She is married, has one child, and lives in the town of Olanchito. She used to work at a supermarket, but for the past two years she has had her own business, where she works selling fast food like baleadas, pastries, fried chicken and plantains, tacos, etc. and also selling clothing. 

The loan she is requesting is her third cycle with our institution and is in the amount of 10,000 lempiras. She will invest it in purchasing more ingredients to prepare her food, such as meats, flour, lard, spices, etc. and merchandise like clothing, sandals, and other items. This will allow her to keep her business well stocked and offer a variety of products.

Her goal is to give her son an education and for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and merchandise like clothing and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.pt:
Jonas, é solteiro, tem 31 anos de idade, é cabelereiro a 4 anos, e é também estudante do nivel médio geral no periodo pos laboral,vive na casa própria,trabalha 10 horas diárias.
O dinheiro do recente empréstimo vai aplicar na compra de cimento, blocos, chapas, janelas para iniciar a construção de  uma boutique.
No futuro pretende iniciar a venda de produtos de belesa feminina na boutique que vai construir com o dinheiro do empréstimo.
Terminar o ensino médio geral e fazer formação profissional é o maior desafio.
texts.en:
Jonas is 31 years old and single. He has been a hairdresser for over four years and he's also a high school student after his work hours are done. He lives in a house that he owns and works 10 hours a day.
The money from the recent loan will be used to purchase cement, bricks, metal sheets and windows so he can start building a boutique.
In the future he intends to begin selling feminine beauty products in the boutique that he'll build with the money from the loan.
His biggest challenge is finishing high school and getting professional training.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, metal sheets and windows.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Francisco é casado, e pai de 6 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frenquentando ensino primário e secundário,vive na casa própria ,trabalha como cozinheiro num quartel e trabalha 8 horas diárias.
Com o dinheiro do recente empréstimo vai comprar cimento, porta, areia,barrotes,varrões para reabilitar a sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir mercearia no pátio da casa, para movimentar negócio para quando se reformar do serviço.Continuará a fazer empréstimos na hluvuku para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Francisco is married and has six children, two of whom attend primary and secondary school. He lives in a house that he owns. He works as a cook in a military barracks and works 8 hours a day.
With the money from the recent loan he'll purchase cement, a door, sand, beams and rods so he can renovate his house.
In the future he intends to build a grocery store in the yard of his house so he can run a business once he retires from service. He'll continue to get loans from Hluvuku so he can achieve his projects.

loans.use: to purchase cement, a door, sand, beams and rods.

loans.name: Chanthan

texts.en:
Chanthan (pictured here), age 56, is a widow living in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has three children-two work for hotel and another one is in school. 
Chanthan sells grocery items at home. She is applying for a loan to buy tools to carve wood for her son who is a wood carver. Because nowadays Chanthan’s son does not have his own tools to work, he borrows from his uncle. He will use money from the loan to buy tools from his uncle. The tools will be used to carve stairway railings and maybe other furniture.

loans.use: To buy tools to carve wood for her son.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Fátima é casada e mãe de 1 filho que está frenquentando nivel secundário,tem 33 anos de idade,vive na casa própria com a sua familia,é negociante a 1 ano,trabalha 12 horas diarias.
Com o dinheiro do recente empréstimo vai comprar azuleijos,cimento,banheira,para dar a continuidade a construção da sua casa visto que a mesma onde vive ainda não está concluida.
No futuro pretende expandir o negocio e contruir mercearia.para lograr os seus projetos vai poupar as receitas do negócio e fazer mais empréstimos na hluvuku
texts.en:
Fátima is married and has a son who's in high school. She's 33 years old and lives with her family in a house that she owns. She has been a trader for a year and works 12 hours a day.
With the money from the recent loan she'll purchase tiles, cement and a bathtub in order to continue building her house, since the house she lives in is not finished yet.
In the future she intends to expand her business and build a grocery store. In order to achieve her projects, she'll save the profits from her business and get more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase tiles, cement and a bathtub.

loans.name: Leta

texts.pt:
Leta é divorciada, e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 1 estuda frenquentando nivel secundário,tem 51 anos de idade,vive na casa própria ,é negociante a 3 anos.
Com o dinheiro do recente empréstimo vai comprar fardos de roupa usada para revender.
No futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio e organizar um lugar melhor para vender seus produtos.
Liquidar o empréstimo o mais rápido possível é o seu maior desejo ,para voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos  na hluvuku ,de modo a realizar os seus intentos.
texts.en:
Leta is divorced and has five children, one of whom attends high school. She's 51 years old and lives in a house that she owns. She has been a trader for three years.
With the money from the recent loan she'll purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling.
In the future she intends to expand her business and set up a better place to sell her merchandise.
Her biggest wish is to repay the loan as quickly as possible. That way she'll apply for more loans with Hluvuku so that she can accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Tupelele

texts.en:
Tupelele is a 39-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tupelele has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, a rake and a pickaxe. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Tupelele hopes to earn more profit from her plantation to help in her family matters and her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, a rake and a pickaxe

loans.name: Tusi

texts.en:
Tusi is 24-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yam and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tusi  has requested a loan to buy  weed spray, spades, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Tusi hopes to earn more profit from her plantation to help her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, spades, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: El

texts.en: El (in the photo) is a farmer. He lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. He has two sons and two daughters. One is a security guard and the other three are in school. His wife is a cleaner for a company. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his farm and pay for plowing fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain his farm and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en: Ramy started his store business when he was single. According to him, capital he had used from his retail store came from his savings when he was still employed. Now, Ramy is married and his income from his store business serves as his main family source of income. Ramy is now eight years in running his business. With his aim to expand his retail store and completely stock the merchandise he offers, he decided to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy beverages, breads, spices, canned goods and soaps. He believes that he can expand his business, and earn more income which enables him to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads, spices, can goods and soaps for his retail store

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma is 45 years old and lives in Buenavista Pagadian city; she is married with five children. 

Nelma is raising a pig to earn a living, and she has been doing this for two years. 

She has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy new piglets.

Nelma has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the the future, Nelma hopes to build a big piggery.

loans.use: To buy new piglets.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 31, is engaged in a retailing business. She has been in the business for a long time, but she had to stopped it temporarily because she needed to focus on accompanying her child to school.

Now she is again back in the business to add income for the studies of her two children. This is the main reason why she is requesting a loan as added capital in restoring her business and buying the necessary retail items like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, coffee, sugar and many more. 

Rowena is moving forward toward the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy retail items like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, coffee, sugar and many more.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 47 years from Nyahururu. She is married to Joseph and they are blessed with three children aged 23, 14 and 10 years old.

Rahab is a tailor, and she has been running her business for the last six years. To enable herself to buy clothing materias, buttons, zippers and thread to use in sewing clothes for her customers, she has applied for her third loan of KES 25,000 from KADET Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KES 9,000. Her plan is to use the anticipated profits from her business to buy more clothing material and another sewing machine so that she can employ someone to assist her with the work.

In the future, she hopes to start a tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy clothing material, buttons, zippers and thread for use in sewing clothes for her customers

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Carhuaz y cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder trabajar en su negocio de venta de confites y productos como maíz dulce salvado de trigo, fideo dulce, entre otros al por mayor y menor desde hace 17 años; con el fruto de su humilde trabajo puede sacar adelante a su familia.

Luz esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más insumos para poder vender sus confites al por mayor como maíz, fideos, entre otros y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesion a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Luz is a very hard-working woman.  She lives in the city of Carhuaz.  She gets up very early every day in order to be able to work in her business of selling sweets and products like sweet corn, wheat bran, and sweet noodles, among others.  She has been selling for wholesale and retail for 17 years.  With the fruit of her humble work, she is able to get her family ahead.

Luz is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have provided her with, she will be able to buy more supplies in order to be able to sell her candies wholesale and things like corn, and noodles, among others.  This way she will improve her income and continue struggling in order to be able to make her big dream come true.  Her big dream is to give her child a profession.

loans.use: to buy supplies like corn and noodles, among others.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, a 48-year-old married mother of four from Thika earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. Her husband, Peter, is a mason. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to lack of investment capital. Her goal is to fully stock her store in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Veronica is requesting for a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with bread, rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will reinvest in her business in order to generate more profits and improve the living standards of her family. 

In the future, Veronica plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger wholesale store.

loans.use: to stock her shop with bread, rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kid.
