For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is married and has children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She operates a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale shop for coconuts  in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for sale

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Bernardo é trabalha como técnico veterinário é também criador, casado, tem 49 anos pai de 4 filhos todos a estudar apenas 1 trabalha ele vive na casa própria sustenta 1nora que vive com ela.
Com o valor vai comprar gado caprino, suίno para criação que e feita na sua casa e na Moamba.
Diz que tem plano de reabilitar sua casa, ter uma quinta pessoal pois agora usa a do seu colega, ter uma carrinha para uso pessoal principalmente para esta actividade.
Terminar a sua formação em agropecuária, pagar pontualmente e solicitar mais créditos para a realização de seus planos.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a veterinarian and also a breeder. He's 49 years old and married. He has four children, all of whom are in school and only one is in the workforce. He lives in a house that he owns and supports a daughter-in-law who lives with him.
With this amount he'll purchase goats and pigs for his breeding business which he runs in his house and in Moamba.
He states that his plan is to renovate his house and own his own farm, because right now he uses one that belongs to a colleague. He also plans to own a station wagon, especially for business purposes.
He'll finish his farming and livestock training, repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for more loans so he can achieve his plans.

loans.use: to purchase goats and pigs.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
A senhora Alberina é solteira, mãe de dois filhos, dos quais um está na  formação profissional como professor e o outro no nίvel primário. Ela tem 35 anos de idade, vive na casa da sua prima e auxiliar de limpeza num hospital .
O dinheiro de empréstimo, será aplicado na compra de material de construção como: cimento, areia, varoes, barrotes, pregos para dar continuidade com a sua obra, uma vez que vive em casa cedida, isto é, casa da sua prima.
O seu maior desejo  é viver na sua própria casa e ver os seus filhos formados e o seu desafio é liquidar a dίvida sem problemas e fazer outros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Albertina is single and has two children, one of whom is studying for a career as a teacher and the other one is in elementary school. She's 35 years old and lives with her female cousin. She's a cleaning assistant at a hospital.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand, rods, beams and nails. That way she'll continue doing construction work, since she lives in a house she doesn't own, that is to say, her cousin's house.
Her biggest wish is to live in her own house and see her children get a degree. Her challenge is repaying the loan without problems and applying for other loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rods, beams and nails.

loans.name: Chicago Group

texts.en:
Astrida, who is in her early 40s, is married with five children, four boys and one girl who are in school. For eight years now, she has been managing her home expenses by running a stationery business where she sells books, pens, printing paper,and also making photocopies, design cards for weddings and other printing services. She starts working from 7:00 am and works till 10:00 pm per work day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her twelfth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she purchased more printing paper, pens, books and bought a new photocopy machine.  Astrida used her profit to cover school fees and part of the family's food expenses and improved her home kitchen with new oven. Astrida will use this loan to buy more out-of-stock books and pens to resell. She dreams of improving her lifestyle. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "CHICAGO" which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more out of stock books and pens to resell.

loans.name: Rosa Yoselin

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Rosa no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Rosa trabaja como vendedora en una tienda comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que dese mejorar las paredes, poner piso y refaccionar el techado de su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 21 year old single woman.  She lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and her siblings.  She is an enthusiastic hard-worker who has a great desire for self-improvement.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and out of the need to work, Rosa was not able to study for a professional career.

On her own initiative, Rosa works as a sales person at a commercial store in her city.  She works every day for approximately ten hours.  She believes that it is going well for her because of her dedication and her good performance.

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help provided, she will make improvements to her house.  She wishes to improve the walls, put in the floor, and refurbish the roof on her house.  This way she will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to achieve her big dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda, 57 years of age, is widowed and has four children. She has run a retail business particularly selling grocery items and food for almost twelve years; she earns a net income of 300 daily. Esmeralda also sells cooked foods for daily meals for additional income. Her profits are spent on their daily expenditures such as food expense and electric bills. Her profits are not enough to purchase more commodities to sell so she decided to request a loan amounting of 40,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, beverages, biscuits, noodles, and candies to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to expand and continue earning profits.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, beverages, biscuits, noodles, and candies to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old, from Nyahururu. He is married to Grace and they are blessed with four children aged 14, 12, 9 and 7 years old and they are all in school.

He is a shopkeeper, a business he has been operating for the last thirteen years. To enable him buy blankets, basins, shoes, school bags and umbrellas to sell to his customers, he has applied for his first loan of Kshs. 100,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 40,000 and his plan is to use profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children, pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd, and to start another business.

He hopes to open a supermarket in the future and for his children to reach the highest level possible in education.

loans.use: To buy blankets, basins, shoes, school bags and umbrellas to sell to his customers

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en: Kamene thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support of the previous loan which helped her to boost her business and also the living standards of her family. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan to buy a variety of vegetables, fruits and potatoes for sale to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, fruits and potatoes for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Lucy Wangari

texts.en:
Lucy is married with three children and one grand-daughter living in Muranga county in central Kenya. She has been a farmer for many years, specializing in dairy farming. She also has a small piece of land where she grows vegetables and cereals like maize, beans and peas for their food needs,  and she gets milk from her five cows. This income is used to cater for the family needs  and pay the children's school fees. 

Lucy, like other women in the county, has faced a lot of challenge when in comes to accessing fuel for cooking and lighting. She has to walk a long distance every weekend  to collect firewood  enough for the week and buy kerosene for lighting. After an encounter with a VEP marketing team at a farmers field day, Lucy learnt that she had a better source of fuel that was cleaner, cheaper and more convenient. She learnt that she could enjoy biogas fuel for cooking and lighting from the animals dung. To facilitate construction of the biodigester, VEP could advance her an affordable credit to be repaid in 24 months.

With the biogas Lucy will enjoy cooking in a cleaner kitchen without smoke. Her pots will not get dirty with soot, and she will not tire herself out with collecting firewood anymore. She will also replace her kerosene lantern with the biogas lamp that is brighter and save money spent on purchasing kerosene. This money can be saved for future needs.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester to provide her with biofuel from cow manure

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say is a widow who lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She sells grocery items at her home. She is asking for a loan to organize her house by laying bricks in order to visually enhance it.  

Say has sons. One is married and lives in a separate home, another one is employed full time, and the other two are construction workers.
Photo: Say and her son.

loans.use: To organize her house by laying bricks in order to visually enhance it.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is hardworking man who has been running a small eatery business for over three years. He is now 45 years old, married and blessed with three children.

Francis is applying a loan amount of PHP 20,000, which will be used to buy raw ingredients used in making viands such as meat and vegetables as well as to buy soft drinks and mineral waters. He hopes to obtain his requested loan amount so he can give his family a better way of living and be able to sustain his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, soft drinks and mineral water for his eatery business.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is married and is 35 years old. She owns and helps her husband in managing a plot of farmland to earn a living. She has been planting bananas for more than five years, and she earns a good enough income for her daily needs.

In 2009, she joined GDMPC. Her previous loan that she took was used for the farm and was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to improve her farm. In the future, Belinda's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a new lot for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga has a butcher shop in Emali town. He is 38 years old, married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with four children. He has been in this business for ten years, and it has been profitable. 

This being his third loan term, he plans to use the loan to buy more stock of cow meat to sell. He anticipates making more profits, which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

He paid all his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to educate his children to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Katherin

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 21 años,es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Elizabeth no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Elizabeth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa,tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Elizabeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 21 years old and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings.  She is very hard-working ad enthusiastic and has a great desire to do better than ever before.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and because she needed to work, Elizabeth was unable to study at university.

Through her own initiative, Elizabeth has her own business selling clothes, for men, women, and children.  She works every day for around ten hours and believes the work is going well because she is dedicated and puts in a lot of effort.

Elizabeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to this support, she will buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing items to stock up her business. With this she can continue to work and put in the effort to achieve her great dream of owning her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 76 years old and a widow with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nicanora is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nicanora has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 55 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan through BRAC Pakistan to purchase more stock of items to sell like sugar, flour, pulses, eggs, milk, soap, and shampoo.

Parveen has borrowed and repaid seven loans from BRAC prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for many years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables and fruits and raising cattle.

Parveen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, pulses, eggs, milk, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly (in the photo), age 32, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. He has two children-one son and one daughter. His wife is a garment worker. 
Chhunly is a driver and raises cows at home when he is free. He asked for a loan to purchase a second hand motorbike. Because he does not have his own transportation, spends lots of money for traveling costs.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike as transportation.

loans.name: Olinda Betty

texts.es: Olinda de 49 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 17 años y 13 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante son sus hijos y es por ellos que trabaja día a día para llevar el sustento y darles mejores condiciones de vida. Desde hace 21 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos tales como camarones, conchas etc. La venta la realiza en las playas cercanas a su localidad. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es como ha logrado mantener a sus hijos. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de pila y baño ya que tal como se aprecia en la fotografía no cuenta con un lugar adecuado. Con el Crédito comprará lámina galvanizada, arena, ladrillo y cemento.
texts.en: Olinda, aged forty-nine, is a single mother of two children, aged thirteen and seventeen. For her, the most important thing is her children, and she works every day to support them and provide them with better living conditions. For twenty-one years, she has been selling seafood such as shrimp, conch, and so on. She sells seafood at the beaches close to her community. This business is her main source of income, and it is how she has managed to provide for her children. She wants to improve her living conditions. For this reason, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a sink and bathroom since, as one can see from the picture, she does not have a suitable location. With the loan, she will buy galvanized sheet metal, sand, brick, and cement.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, sand, brick, and cement to build a sink and bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 33, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Joy, his business partner and they have a child. He, together with his wife, manages his household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.  

Romeo operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue his business operations, he is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. He will be incorporating the loan with his current revolving funds used to buy trash from collectors. 

Romeo dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes that his family will always be in good condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Crisostomo

texts.en:
Crisostomo is harmoniously residing with his wife and two children in their village. He is raising crops to sell, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been in this business for almost seven years and still aims for better crop production. 

From this, he joined ASKI and is now borrowing a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and insecticides, which he will use in farming. He is hoping that his agricultural business will continue to grow abundantly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and insecticides, that he will use in farming.

loans.name: Soeur

texts.en: A 34-year-old mother of two children residing in Kampong Cham province, Soeur is a farmer who strives to make a living via bean, cassava, and rice farming which she has been involved in for 10 years. Soeur is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in repaying her past loan to support her business as well as to maintain her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy a tier for her rice milling machine which she can use to earn additional income by offering a rice milling service. She hopes that she can make more income for her current business so that she can keep her kids in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy a tier for her rice milling machine

loans.name: Agnes Nyokabi

texts.en:
Agnes, a mother of five, is employed at a tea factory as a casual laborer. She lives in her ancestral home, where she inherited a piece of land from her parents. Three of her children have cleared school and help her in tilling the land and looking after the livestock. The other two are in high school and only help with the house chores in the evening. 

Agnes and her children have been relying on the income from the farm proceeds and sales of chicken eggs, as well as sales of milk from their ten cows. This income caters to their family needs, as well as payment of school fees.

To assist Agnes to cut down some of her expenses and save some money, VEP introduced her to the biogas project, which would provide her with a cleaner, more affordable source of fuel for cooking and lighting. She benefited from a loan that enabled her buy the materials for the biodigester construction and also got excellent expertise from the biogas engineers.   

She is currently enjoying convenient cooking in the comfort of her sitting room, and she no longer needs to use the outer kitchen that was previously used with the firewood jiko (stove). Her house is smoke and soot-free, her cooking pots clean, and her health better, as she no longer inhales smoke. 

She has also been trained on how to increase food production using organic fertilizer from the bio-slurry. This means that she will also save money previously used for buying chemical fertilizers, her food  production will increase, and if she sells some of it, it will be an added income to her family. Biogas will be a source of transformation and empowerment to Agnes and her family.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester, which provides a cleaner, more affordable source of fuel for cooking and lighting, and also organic fertilizer from the bio-slurry.

loans.name: Filiga

texts.en: Filiga is 42 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. Filiga has requested a loan to buy a chest freezer, foam cups, sacks of sugar, and cordials. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Filiga will improve/extend her business and use the profits for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, foam cups, sacks of sugar, and cordials

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 58 years old, widowed, and has eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas, which she has been doing for many years. 

Rasela is requesting a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy fertilizer, chemicals, water gallon, and chainsaw. With her profits, Rasela hopes to improve and expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, chemicals, water gallon, and chainsaw

loans.name: Litala

texts.en:
Litala is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Litala has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, water gallon (water gallon is a big water gallon used by farmers for water reservoir) and a backpack sprayer. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Litala hopes to improve and expand her business and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, water gallon and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Soliga

texts.en:
Soliga is a 64-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She has a small business selling coconut oil. To earn extra income, she also has an elei (patterned fabric) printing business. 

Soliga needs a loan to buy coconuts, materials, paints, elei designs and brushes. She will use her profits to extend/improve her business and to save for her family's betterment. Soliga joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, materials, paints, elei designs and brushes

loans.name: Tuli

texts.en:
Tuli is 50 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling sandwiches, coffee, etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. She also sells bananas at the food-stall.

Tuli has requested a loan to buy noodles, coffee, bread, tinned fish, mayonnaise, onion, eggs and Glad Wrap. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tuli will improve/extend her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, coffee, bread, tinned fish, mayonnaise, onion, eggs and Glad Wrap.

loans.name: Taua

texts.en:
Taua is a 30-year-old woman who is married with one child. She runs a business of elei (traditional printed fabric) clothing in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Taua has requested a loan to buy fabric color paint, stencils, elei designs, a roller and materials. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric color paint, stencils, elei (traditional printed fabric) designs, a roller and materials.

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is 46 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana Rose is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Rose has been raising pigs for 19 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs
